138001.name: Meta-Being
138001.description:
From Introduction:

The CORE Directive is a superhero role-playing games based upon the d20 system. You will need the three core Dungeons and Dragons 3rd edition books (PH, DMG and MM) as well as the Star Wars Rpg (SW), all by Wizards of the Coast, in order to use these rules.

138002.name: De Unesco-Regenboog
boardgameversion: Phoenix & den Oudsten Dutch First Edition
138002.description:
Card game published as a promotion for UNESCO. The tile means 'The Unesco Rainbow'.

The cards feature the letters U N E S C or O. There are eight of each letter and, in the main, they have different coloured backgrounds.

Each player, in turn, may lay a card on the table, that can legally go next to another card. There are none at the start so a U must be placed. After that, you may lay an N next to the U. You can place the N alongside the U or beneath it. The next player may now play a legal letter next to any card on the table. Thus, the word UNESCO will be spelt many times perhaps, horizentally or vertically. Think of it as a UNESCO crossword. If you cannot play a card, you draw one from the stock.

The first player to use all their cards wins the round. The other players total the value of cards left in their hands and take a score for them. Colour matches can matter because this makes a more penal score. After an agreed number of rounds, the player with the lowest score wins.

138003.name: Desert Ruins
138003.description:
From the Introduction

Long ago this castle buried under the desert's sand was one of many small fortifications guarding a caravan route running along the outskirts of a large desert. And while it withstood raiders and wars it had no chance against the ravages of time. Ever so slowly it was covered by the encroaching wandering dunes of the desert. Despite the best efforts of the garrison the castle's well fell dry, filled with sand and thus the castle had to be abandoned to be slowly covered by sand. Today as the large wandering dunes have passed what little remains of the castle has surfaced again, not much more than a small landmark among the endless dunes of the desert.

138004.name: Rope Bridges
138004.description:
From the Introduction

Only a short time ago the river that cut this canyon into the rocky ground was still flowing at its bottom. Then a nearby volcano violently erupted though. The river has been rerouted by the accompanying earthquakes and the streams of molten rock that are flowing in its old bed since then.

Crossing the canyon on the old rope bridges spanning its width via two rock pillars was at best perilous before the river far below was replaced by fast flowing lava. Now only the most hardened and desperate even dare considering such a venture. The heat wafting up is downright breathtaking and it has turned the ropes holding up the bridge dry and brittle.

138005.name: Motte
138005.description:
From the Introduction

The small stream flowing along in its bed has been the natural border between two realms for a long time. Recently relations between the two realms have turned sour and the ruler of one realm saw the need to establish a more formal border and to fortify it at the same time. For this reason he has started to construct small fortifications all along the former natural border.

Here a small moat, filled by the small river, has been dug and the excavated earth has been used to raise a small motte inside the moat. Its top is crowned by a simple stone watchtower and a low wooden palisade. A set of slippery earthen stairs leads down to the simple wooden bridge across the moat. A number of sharpened stakes at the bottom of the motte and hidden under the water of the moat are the only other defence of the small fort.

138006.name: Desert Dunes
138006.description:
From the Introduction

As far as the eye can see massive sand dunes stretch from one horizon to the other. As monotonous and unchanging the desert might look to the untrained eye, it is neither. The dunes are ever changing, slowly moving along as the wind moves them forward one grain of sand at a time. As it is now the chill of the night still lingers over the sand as the sun has just barely risen into the sky. While one side of the dunes is already bathed in the warming rays of the sun the other is still firmly in the dunes own shadows.

138007.name: Smart As
138007.description:
Think you’re as smart as your dad? Your best mate? Or even everyone in the country? Well, prove it with the social brain training game that divides the clued-up from the clueless — specifically designed to showcase the fully-immersive features of PS Vita system for today’s “always on” mobile gamer. Climb the leaderboards as you solve logic, arithmetic, observation and language puzzles and set challenges for those around you.

Source: The Publisher Website.

138009.name: DM's Idea Pipeline: June 2004
138009.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the first collection of the DM’s Idea Pipeline. The following pages feature the material that was e-mailed to subscribers during the month of June. If you’d like to be sure to get future material five times a week be sure subscribe to the DM’s Idea Pipeline. Subscribers are sent these monthly PDFs free.

The items, characters, rumors, and just plain stuff found in this PDF is all designed to be used in your games as you see fit. A lot of the material is created with adventure hooks in mind and DMs will no doubt have ideas of their own as they read through this PDF.

138010.name: DM's Idea Pipeline: July 2004
138010.description:
From Introduction:

And we’re back! This second collection of the DM’s Idea Pipeline features the material that was e-mailed to subscribers during the month of July. If you’d like to be sure to get future material five times a week be sure subscribe to the DM’s Idea Pipeline. Subscribers are sent these monthly PDFs free.

The items, characters, rumors, and just plain stuff found in this PDF is all designed to be used in your games as you see fit. A lot of the material is created with adventure hooks in mind and DMs will no doubt have ideas of their own as they read through this PDF.

138011.name: DM's Idea Pipeline: August 2004
138011.description:
From Introduction:

This collection of the DM’s Idea Pipeline features the material that was e-mailed to subscribers during the month of August. If you’d like to be sure to get future material five times a week be sure subscribe to the DM’s Idea Pipeline. Subscribers are sent these monthly PDFs free.

The items, characters, rumors, and just plain stuff found in this PDF is all designed to be used in your games as you see fit. A lot of the material is created with adventure hooks in mind and DMs will no doubt have ideas of their own as they read through this PDF.

138012.name: Blankity-Blank!
138012.description:
Blankity-Blank! is a word game that will appeal to anyone who likes Scrabble, Boggle, Scattergories, and other word games. It's a family game designed for 2 to 6 players ages 12 and older.

To begin a round of Blankity-Blank!, you take a card from the box and let all the players see it. On the front of the card is an incomplete word with some letters left blank; for example, P--N-. You and every other player have three minutes to write down all the words you can think of that would complete that pattern, like phone or piano or plant or prank. When time is up you all read your lists aloud and cross out any word that more than one person wrote; you score points only for words that you alone thought of.

The front of the card indicates whether this is a 1-point, 2-point, or 3-point round, according to how many potential matches there are for this pattern. 1-point cards have dozens of possible solutions, 2-pointers not so many, and 3-point cards have the fewest of all. So you score 1, 2, or 3 points for each unique word in your list. (P--N- would be a 2-point card.)

When you've recorded the scores for this round, you may look at the back of the card. It shows a list of the most common words that would be correct solutions, so players can see some of the words no one thought of.

You continue to play with another card and another until one player has scored enough points to win. This can be 25 points, or 50, or any number the group agrees to.

The game includes over 500 cards, a pad of answer sheets, and a timer.

138013.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 355 - Mar 2005)
rpgissuearticle: But It Is, Perhaps, The Title of a Beginning... (Legends From Loegres #112)
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Lozen's Adventure in the Folds, Part 5
This Isn't The Zine You're Looking For
138013.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #355
March 2005

Cover art by David T. Okamura.

138014.name: Spell Effect Patterns: Cantrips & Orisons
138014.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wonder if your Sleep spell caught that last goblin but there was disagreement between you and a DM or player?

Ever experienced a stoppage in game play over an agonizing, time-consuming spell lookup in the Player's Handbook?

Get clearer results and faster answers by using Spell Effect Patterns (SEPs). These are an exciting new way for DMs and spellcasting players to 'see the results" of the spells characters cast, and to lessen lookup time in reference books.

Scaled for use with miniatures, these handy printouts answer the questions of "Who/what does my Burning Hands spell affect?", "What's the area of my Fireball?" and "How is my Detect Poison spell targetable?", among others. And they do it quickly, and in the coolest visual way possible (barring holographic explosions!!!)

Features:

Full-color, artistically-designed, and made for use with miniatures - cool!
Color-coded - each spell effect is outlined in a color which tells its school of magic - a handy mnemonic device.
Made to Scale -1 inch = 5 feet, the scale for almost all D&D; miniature campaigns.
Info-packed - Consult important spell information on the SEP while you use it!
Customizable - players can cut out the patterns to best utilize them during play
Durable - can be printed on cardstock and/or laminated for greater durability
Markable - If laminated, can be written on using dry- or wet-erase markers.
Spellbook Alternative - The patterns can be used as an alternative to a spellbook, and in most instances, referencing the Player's Handbook.
SEPs include patterns for different caster levels - for example, a Ray of Frost cast by a 1st level caster is 5 inches (25 feet range), whereas the same spell cast by a 2nd-3rd caster is 6 inches (range of 30 feet).
Each pattern has the full System Reference Document spell stat block and spell description included for your reference, and are in a block of text that can be cut and pasted to a 3?x5? card.

138015.name: Swish Jr.
138015.description:
Swish Jr. is a version for children of Swish, a pattern recognition card game in which players make matches – dubbed "Swishes" – before opponents.

Swish Jr. includes 42 transparent cards; each card has some combination of small shapes on it, with these items coming in four colors. To set up the game, lay out 12 cards on the table. Players simultaneously try to create "Swishes" by spotting two or more cards that can be laid on top of one another in some manner so that shapes of the same color fit. Create a Swish, and you claim the cards used, with new cards then being laid out. Whoever claims the most cards wins the game.

138016.description:
In WordAround players try to discover and read words written in round cards before their opponents. The players who gueses it correctly gets the card as a point. Whoever has more cards at the end of the game wins.
The game includes 100 cards with 300 words.
138016.name: WordARound
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 104: Potpourri for 100
The Spiel #170 - All Access

138017.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 356 - Apr 2005)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Lozen's Adventure in the Folds, Part 6
Report from GAMA Trade Show in Fabulous Las Vegas
This Isn't The Zine You're Looking For #165
What's In a Name? (Legends From Loegres #113)
138017.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #356
April 2005

Cover art by Matt Stevens.

138019.name: Child Beauty Pageant Tycoon
138019.description: Child Beauty Pageant Tycoon is a game where you and your friends take the role of a mother whose greatest goal in life is to have her children win Beauty Pageants. The first player to win five Beauty Pageant crowns wins the game. There are 4 very different ways to make your Child ready to compete in a Pageant. 1) Spending a night with a Stud to give your child an edge from the very start. 2) Gaining experience by simply competing in Pageants. 3) Training your Child in a special Skill. 4) Buying a special 1-use Item to be used in any Pageant. Each Pageant will have different entry fees and winnings, and they will focus on different stats. When a pageant focuses on a stat, it counts for double towards winning the pageant. For example, let's say Mary Beth has a 'Smarts' score of 3. In the Pageant shown above, she will get to double her smarts score and it will instead give her 6 points toward winning the Pageant! Glitz or Talent stats still count toward winning, but they aren't doubled in this Pageant.

138020.name: Fort Thomas-opoly
138020.description: A unique version of Monopoly based off of the Northern Kentucky town of Fort Thomas. Properties include historical content and prominent places around town. The game is played nearly the same as Monopoly, but with a few variants. There are different cards, and different rules for gaining money in relation to the cards and properties on the board.

138021.name: Airport Firefighter Simulator
138021.description:
Nowhere are the dangers more apparent than in a modern airport where thousands of travellers are in close proximity to highly flammable aviation fuel and hazardous materials. The risks are great and so are the demands on the elite squad of airport firefighters!

Source: The Publisher Website.

138022.name: Power Rangers Action Card Game
138022.description:
Players customize a deck of 30 cards depicting the heroes, villains, Zords, and Megazords of the Power Rangers universe. Cards are found in special starter sets, booster packs, and also packaged with Power Rangers toys from the 2013 line.

Turn Order:

1. Draw 2 cards.
2. Choose a Ranger or Villain to play, or pass. Discard cards equal to the play cost.
2. Optionally, players can summon Zords or Megazords if a Ranger was played in the previous step.
3. If only one player played a card, that card deals damage equal to its damage value twice.
4. If both players played a card, each player performs a "judgement" by rolling a die (or using an app or Morpher toy) to determine what power level their card fights at. The higher Power value wins. The loser is dealt damage equal to the winning card's damage value.
5. If the winner's card's rock/paper/scissors icon defeats the opponent's, the winner deals damage twice.
6. Damage is represented by moving cards from the draw deck into the discard pile.
7. The winner's card is discarded, the loser's is moved to the reinforcements area, where it can boost the "judgement" value in subsequent battles.
8. Play continues until one player runs out of cards in his or her draw deck. That player loses and the opponent wins!

138023.name: Woodcutter Simulator 2011
138023.description:
The smell of fresh tree gum, the sound of heavy vehicles and hard work for real men awaits the player in the Woodcutter Simulator 2011. The player is in charge of his own wood-manufacturing facility in the deep woods. To get his jobs done, the player must do the work of a real man and handle all aspects of the forest industry from cutting trees to sawing.

Source: The Developer Website.

138024.name: Wartune
138024.description:
Wartune is a 2.5D real-time RPG+Strategic browser game.
The game pictures apply the method of 3D render 2D so that it can give all players outstanding visual joy. The initial version would mainly develop around the castle and explore the side quests as principal line. As the castellan, players fight against the monsters through developing castle, recruiting troops. And during the side quest exploration, players would also go through different things such as pursue and attack, Fugitive or Squelch, and finally become the king.

Source: The Game Website.

138025.name: Bridge Project
138025.description:
Build a bridge .... and get over it!

Are you ready for the next bridge building challenge? Build highly detailed bridges in beautiful landscapes and environments. You are tasked with constructing a huge variety of bridges. Build suspension and draw bridges, bridges made from stone, steel, wood, cable and concrete, bridges for cars, trains, tanks and more. Are you up to the bridge building challenge?

Source: The Developer Website.

138026.name: Critical Mass
138026.description:
The Critical Mass 15mm rule system is a fast play alternative action company level game. Infantry are based in multiples and form platoons, vehicles are based individually and grouped to form units. Each game round players must manage their units activations with play continually moving back and forth as each unit is activated meaning games a tense and involved. As you would expect from a sci-fi game Walkers, Drop Troops, Grav Tanks, and much more are a plenty, coupled with lots destruction and mission defined battlefield objectives.

The Critical Mass rules includes the core game rules, 4 full army sections for the ARC Fleet, Protolene Khanates, Kaamados Dominion, and Praesentia Factions and 4 game scenarios. Included with the rulebook is an A4 laminated playsheet.

138028.name: Cyril Cyberpunk
138028.description:
User Summary

In Cyril Cyberpunk, the protagonist, Cyril, hopes to halt an alien invasion of Earth. The alien minions are mainly robotic teddy bears, which Cyril can dispose of using his laser gun. He can ride a levitating board to higher heights as long as he has enough fuel for it.

138029.name: Three Kings PDQ Core Rule Book
138029.description:
From the introduction:

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a two-fisted wartime roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazis, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary war machines, and enough writhing tentacles to fill ten Reichstags!

Three Kings PDQ is a standalone roleplaying game using the award winning story-focussed PDQ System and includes the first in a series of adventure supplements in the globespanning Zero Point campaign for Achtung! Cthulhu.

138030.name: Black Mesa: Xen
138030.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




User Summary

This is a forthcoming standalone expansion for BLλCK MESA featuring the Xen chapters of Half-Life, redesigned and expanded.

Release date is not yet announced but it is speculated that the game will be released in 2013.

138031.name: Black Mesa: Deathmatch
138031.description:
User Summary

This is a forthcoming standalone expansion for BLλCK MESA featuring a multiplayer mode.

Black Mesa Deathmatch is speculated to be similar to Half Life: Deathmatch. Players will compete with each other online, attempting to do 100 points of damage to their foes with various weapons while remaining above 0 health themselves.

Release date is not yet announced but it is speculated that the game will be released in 2013.

138032.name: Drummer Boy
138032.description:
This is a game for children with an American Civil War military theme published in 1890.

Players begin the game as a drummer boy and attempt to rise through the ranks and become a general. The board is styled like a maze and players move based on the results of a spinner.
Certain spaces on the board have special rules. A drum symbol allows the player to spin again. Other spaces have instructions like "Surly. Go to Guard House" and penalize the player.

The first child to reach the "General" space is declared he winner.

Includes a colorful 13" x 13" board illustrated with Civil War scenes, metal tokens, and a drum-shaped spinner.

138033.name: Future INC. High-Tech Stakes
138033.description:
Game designed by creative team Lans Macabre. It's an area control strategy based on resource use, betting and bluffing. Players take the roles of megacorporations’ CEOs to enlarge influence and dominance of the world. To do so they must spend resources to get control of cyberpunk freelancers - but it's not as easy as it sounds. The cyberpunks are very hard to control and everyone will try to recruit them. Each player will bet on different resources to get best results.
Future INC. is all about getting control over locations and gathering resources.
Each player starts with the same amount of skyscrapers and tries to expand by building new and capturing or destroying those belonging to other players. Thanks to skyscrapers players gain control over locations – areas of the cyberpunk world - and gather resources.

There are five types of resources in the game:
Credits - represent financial capabilities - used to build new skyscrapers.
Cybernetics - represent technological advancement - used to change ownership of enemy skyscrapers to yours.
Gear - represents military potential - used to destroy skyscrapers.
Programs- represent defense against "cyber terrorism" - used to counter enemy actions.
Influence - represents political power and intel – used to gain an advantage by manipulating game’s mechanics.

The most important thing in Future INC. is using free mercenaries - known as Cyberpunks - to do the dirty work. Using resources, corporation may influence a group of Cyberpunks to capture enemy building and gain victory points.

Game is divided into five turns, each has three phases:
1st phase, collecting resources: in which players gather resources, determine new targets for Cyberpunks and update points status.
2nd phase, mission: in which players, using bluff, bet on resources to gain control over the Cyberpunks.
3rd phase, actions of corporations: in which players spend resources to perform actions against each other.
Points are gathered by winning control over Cyberpunks and locations. The player with the highest score at the end of the fifth turn wins the game.

Future INC. High-Tech Stakes is a dynamic strategy for everyone who likes power struggle and a poker-like experience.

138034.name: Zunftblatt (Print Issue 14 - Oct 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Die Ringvereine. Frühes organisiertes Verbrechen in Deutschland
Game of Thrones: Der Eiserne Thron - Das Kartenspiel
Napoleonen des Verbrechens. Große Verbrecher in Historie und Fiktion
Organisiertes Verbrechen. Spielleitertipps für mehr Vielfalt
Voll Indie Fresse: A Dirty World
Willkommen in der Alten Welt, Spielleiter
138034.description: Focusing on gangsters and crime, this is the 14th print issue of Zunftblatt.

138035.name: 2000AD: Rogue Trooper Miniatures Game
138035.description:
By the same designer and publisher of the Judge Dredd Miniatures Game, 2000AD: Rogue Trooper Miniatures Game is a science-fiction skirmish 28mm miniatures wargame based (as the title suggests!) on the Rogue Trooper stories of the classic British comic, 2000AD.

A Kickstarter project started in February 2013, successfully funded within one day of launch, the intention is to publish a hardback rulebook and a range of miniatures for both sides, of the perpetual civil war on Nu-Earth. The Nort and Souther armies are asymmetrical (army lists are featured in the rulebook; units each have a base points cost and upgrades available for additional points).

The scope of the game is intended to be from a handful of miniatures (one GI vs. a Nort squad for example) up to company level actions, including light vehicles.

The range planned for release currently includes:
GI Rogue Trooper
Souther soldier squad set (8 figs)
Nort soldier squad set (8 figs)
Nort elite assault squad set (8 figs)
Nort & Souther officer squad set (6 figs)
Souther lazooker team squad set (6 figs)
Nort snipers and Black Dome sniper squad set (7 figs)
Skorpion Battlewagon (light tank, 3 variants planned)

Troops have their own basic statistics (points cost, movement, defence and armour values, morale (called Will-to-Fight; WtF in this game!), individual abilities (traits) etc. which are then augmented by the range and damage ratings of the weapon with which they are equipped (range, damage, traits). The more powerful a weapon is, the more combat dice rolled.

Rules cover ranged and close combat, remote weapons, indirect fire, elevation, suppression, air units, fighting from and in structures, etc.

Missions can be generated within the 'Engagement' chapter by combining various mission profiles (attack, defend, probe, hold, etc) to give an alternative to simple meeting engagements of equal cost forces. Success or failure is adjudicated by victory points specific to the various missions.

NB: This information is based upon the first release of the draft rulebook, and thus may be subject to change before release.

138036.name: Dragons of Underearth
138036.description:
From the back of the box

Dragons of Underearth gives you danger and glory in a complete fantasy role-playing game where you are the hero. Underearth simplifies play, giving you more time for action and surprise. Included are character creation, magic, monsters, and combat (introductory, intermediate & advanced version for easy learning). And you don't need a game master or special dice.

138037.name: Ein kleiner Gefallen
138037.description:
Ein kleiner Gefallen (A Small Favor) is an introductory adventure to the Austrian RPG Finsterland and is complete with quickstart rules and four pre-generated characters.

The characters are called by an old friend. Recently, his cellar has been haunted by a dreadful apparition, and he asks them to investigate.

138038.name: Reise durch die Schweiz
138038.description:
Objective:
Be the first to reach target space
- moving by turns -

Typical 'roll and move' game, probbably published ~1920/30's
Roll the die, move forward; ending on a marked space read aloud the datails about that sight-seeing place and follow instructions, printed on a 2-sided rule sheet. Because it was played by adults you have to spend money first before you start.
Very nice drawings/printing and - of course - pewter pawns

138039.name: TRAUMA Universalrollenspiel
138039.description:
Publisher blurb

Von den weitläufigen Savannen der Urzeit mit ihren gigantischen Dinosauriern bis zu den unendlichen Tiefen des Weltalls einer hochtechnisierten Zukunft. Von der harten Realität historischer Schauplätze bis zu völlig freien Welten phantastischer Vorstellungen. Von den ernsthaftesten Szenarien bis zu den witzigsten Komödien. Wovon auch immer Ihre Träume handeln mögen, in TRAUMA steckt alles drin. Das Grundregelwerk umfasst nicht nur die Grundregeln für abwechslungsreiches Rollenspiel in allen erdenklichen Genres, es beinhaltet auch die Charaktererschaffung, hunderte von Fertigkeiten aller Epochen, umfangreiche Kampf- und Medizinregeln, Magie und Zaubersprüche, eine Anleitung zur Erschaffung eigener Spielwelten, zahlreiche Kreaturen, Hinweise für Spielleiter sowie einigeBeispielcharaktere. TRAUMA ist für neue Spieler genauso geeignet wie für alte Hasen.

Publisher blurb (user translation)

From the sweeping savannas of primordial times with it's gigantic dinosaurs to infinite depths of space in a hi-tech future. From the harsh reality of historical settings to worlds of unbound, phantastic imaginations. From serious scenarios to the funniest comedies. Whatever you are dreaming of, TRAUMA has it. The core book not only includes rules for diverse role-playing experiences in any genre you can think of, but also character creation rules, hundreds of skills of all epochs, combat and healing rules, magic and spells, a guide to worldbuilding, many creatures, GM tips and sample characters. TRAUMA is suited for new as well as experienced players.

User summary
According to the author, TRAUMA is based on the Rune Quest system. In late 2012, a second, revised edition was announced.

138040.name: Police Simulator 2: Law and Order
138040.description:
Fight the growing threat of criminal activity that is plaguing your city. As Chief of Police your influence and ability to protect relies on a keen understanding of danger zones and the ability to maintain control of your budget. Employ and command brave officers to patrol the streets, send out speeding emergency vehicles to respond to incidents quickly and invest in highly sophisticated new technology to assist your detectives in solving cases.

Source: The Publisher Website.

138041.name: Bus & Cable Car Simulator: San Francisco
138041.description:
Take a trip to the shores of the mighty Pacific Ocean as you embark on a public transport career in San Francisco, surely one of the most beautiful cities in the world! Operate the iconic cable cars and streetcars, carefully recreated in exacting 3D detail to provide unprecedented realism as you criss-cross the city and traverse miles of track. Alternatively, take control of an ultra-modern articulated electric trolley bus or traditional diesel bus.

Source: The Publisher Website.

138042.name: The Book of Shadow Bindings
138042.description:
From the website (no longer online)

Shadow Bindings is a roleplaying mechanics system, that is meant to be a more flexible system than Fantasy Realms, with less reliance on modifying the character construction system to suit particular worldbases. It is also intended to better represent realism in combat situations than Fantasy Realms did, and to deal with those areas of genre that Fantasy Realms cannot cover currently because of its simplex structure.

Shadow Bindings takes the best elements of the Fantasy Realms mechanic, plus those of some of our previous work with the Mystic Earth RPG and some new ideas towards streamlining some parts of game play. It is designed in such a way that worlds, scenarios etc developed for it will also be usable by those who prefer the Fantasy Realms mechanics.

Shadow Bindings is a Free-To-Use Roleplaying game. This means you can use it as a basis for any game you run, are welcome to adapt it, share copies of it with your friends, print it out to paper or do anything else you want with it, except sell it for a profit.

138043.name: Nornis (Grundregelwerk)
138043.description:
Publisher blurb

NORNIS ist ein Fantasy-Abenteuerrollenspiel auf der Welt Aveon. Das Grundregelwerk beinhaltet eine ausführliche Beschreibung des Weltenhintergrundes, sowie das Regelsystem und damit alles, was man braucht, um in eine fantastische Welt voller Mythen, alter Geschichten und Legenden einzutauchen. Die Regeln sind leicht verständlich und unterstützen das Storytelling - Konzept von NORNIS. Das Spiel basiert auf einem 12seitigen Würfel. Neben dem Grundsystem helfen mehr als zwanzig Optionalregeln. In der Welt Aveon schlüpfen Sie in die Rolle unterschiedlicher Zwerge, Menschen und Elfen und erleben Ihr eigenes Abenteuer auf der Suche nach verschollenen Artefakten oder beim Aufdecken von Intrigen in einer Welt voller Zauberei und Fantasie.

translation
NORNIS is a fantasy adventure role-playing game in the world Aveon. The rulebook includes a detailed setting description and the rules - thus everything you need to immerse yourself in a fantastic world full of myths, ancient stories and legends. The rules are easy to understand and support the storytelling concept of NORNIS. The game is based on a d12. Besides the core system you will find more than twenty optional rules. In the world Aveon you take on the role of different dwarves, humans and elves and enjoy your own adventure in search of lost artifacts or in the detection of intrigue in a world of magic and fantasy.

138044.name: Depth Hunter: The Spearfishing Simulator
138044.description:
Depth Hunter offers 25 exciting missions in which players will hunt different fish species and face the difficulties of breath-holding spearfishing, an ancient fishing method. Players will also have to fight predators, can find treasures and get the possibility to take underwater photos to capture the beauty of the simulated, detailed and lively underwater worlds they’re exploring.

Source: The Developer Website.

138045.name: Ski Region Simulator 2012
138045.description:
Through several activities you build up financial resources allowing you to buy better equipment. Thanks to the cooperation and official license of Kässbohrer you take control of authentic Pistenbully snow groomers.

Source: The Game Website.

138046.description:
The first fixed Shadowpack for Shadowfist.

From the website:

"The first 50-card expansion set for the new format features a combination of new cards and reprints (plus a few familiar old cards with a new slant!). The set is non-randomized and features seven cards per faction and eight Feng Shui sites."
138046.name: Shadowfist: Reloaded
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 22: So You Want To Get Into Card Games!

138047.name: Cart Life
videogamehonor: 2013 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Winner
2013 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Winner
2013 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Winner
138047.description:
User Summary

A monochrome business/life simulator that focuses on the lives of street vendors in the western US.

138048.name: Wiggs
138048.description: This 1903 card game by L.T. Hodges is played with 65 cards. There are six suits with 10 cards in each, plus 5 "cabbage" or trump cards. Players try to match cards in their hand to those on "the board" (the table). The object of the game is get the greatest number of cards, cabbage cards and fives. The 1904 edition also contains rules for playing Wiggs Auction.

138049.name: Complete Music Quiz Night In
138049.description:
From the box:

All the fun of a music quiz night in your own home.

This chart-topping quiz is packed full of fascinating music trivia questions (both popular and classical) guaranteed to keep everyone entertained. Suitable for all the family and any number of players.

Your knowledge will be pushed to the limits by the following categories: One Hit Wonders; 60s & 70s; 80s & 90s; Albums and Singles; Music Charades; Music & the Movies; General Music Trivia; Pop Music; Name That Tune (on CD).

The Complete Music Quiz Night In contains everything you need for night after night of fascinating music trivia fun - all you need to supply are the players!

Contents:
50 question cards containing 1,900 questions and answers.
Audio CD for Name That Tune category.
Answer sheets.
Quick start instructions.
4 pencils.

138052.name: Ports
138052.description:
Ports are the lifeblood of a country's economy, a cornerstone of trade and commerce. Ports places you firmly on the dock as you take charge of the hustle and bustle of loading and unloading a vast variety of goods in transit. With everything from cars to containers and bulk goods to be handled your organisational skills will be put to the test in a challenging range of missions, working against the clock to ship and store cargo.

Source: The Publisher Website.

138053.name: Love & Order
138053.description:
In the smallest district of Montreal, the Crown Attorney relies on the legal expertise of its lawyers; backed up by the support of a single hard-working secretary.

This is the story of Dana Larose, a young woman starting her career as a secretary in the Crown Attorney's office. The office is both overworked and understaffed, so you'll have to work out whose projects you help with accordingly.

Will you be able to unravel the mystery being covered up, balance the stress of juggling overtime for everyone, and still manage to find love...?

Source: The Developer Website.

138054.name: Shadowfist: Back For Seconds
138054.description:
Starter deck expansion for Shadowfist.

From the shadowfist.com website:

"This two-deck follow-up to Combat in Kowloon features 50-card starters for the Monarchs and the Jammers, to fill out the new six-faction standard for Shadowfist!"

138055.name: Circus World
138055.description:
Ladies and gentleman, children of all ages! The spotlight is on you as a travelling circus needs your management skills to grow into the greatest show on earth! Hire performers, purchase side shows, perform budget management and invest in bigger tents as you make your way across the UK, France and to New York!

Source: The Publisher Website.

138056.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 357 - May 2005)
138056.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #357
May 2005

Cover art by Lee Gold.

138058.name: Dangerous Dave in the Haunted Mansion
138058.description:
Dangerous Dave in the Haunted Mansion (also known as Dangerous Dave 2 and under the Froggman title, Rooms of Doom) is a 1991 sequel of the computer game Dangerous Dave. It was created by John Romero, John Carmack, Adrian Carmack and Tom Hall. It was developed on the Shadow Knights engine with some extra code for smoother character movement. Also an auto-loading shotgun debuts in the game. Many of the features that debuted in this game were carried over to its sequels, Dangerous Dave's Risky Rescue and Dave Goes Nutz!

Source: Wikipedia, "Dangerous Dave in the Haunted Mansion", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138059.name: Dangerous Dave's Risky Rescue
138059.description:
Dangerous Dave's Risky Rescue (known informally as Dangerous Dave 3) is a platform game developed by Gamer's Edge and published by Softdisk in 1993 for DOS computers. It is the sequel to Dangerous Dave in the Haunted Mansion, and is also the first Dangerous Dave game to not be programmed by John Romero. This is because he, John Carmack, Adrian Carmack and Tom Hall had left Softdisk by this point to form id Software. It was followed by a sequel, Dave Goes Nutz!, which shares similar gameplay elements.

Like the previous title, Dangerous Dave is on a mission to save his little brother Delbert, this time from the evil "Dr. Nemesis" (who is also the main antagonist in Softdisk's Catacomb franchise).

Source: Wikipedia, "Dangerous Dave's Risky Rescue", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138060.name: Dave Goes Nutz!
138060.description:
Dave Goes Nutz! (known informally as Dangerous Dave 4) is a platform game developed by Gamer's Edge and published by Softdisk in 1993 for DOS computers. It is the sequel to Dangerous Dave's Risky Rescue, and shares similar gameplay features.

Dave Goes Nutz continues from Dangerous Dave's Risky Rescue, where Dangerous Dave is on a mission to save his little brother Delbert, from the evil "Dr. Nemesis" (who is also the main antagonist in Softdisk's Catacomb franchise). The game takes place within a mental hospital filled with zombies.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dave Goes Nutz!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138061.name: Toukiden: The Age of Demons
138061.description:
User Summary

Soldiers of Mononofu are the first line of defense against hordes of demons threatening the land and reality itself. Utilizing weapons such as bows and arrows and swords, players will wage war on the demonic forces, striking at their vital points to incapacitate them and rend them limb from limb before finishing them off with purification magic.

138062.name: Spectraball: Extended Edition
138062.description:
Spectraball: Extended Edition is a remake (released as a large update) of the 2008 indie release, Spectraball, featuring a graphical overhaul, larger maps, smoother controls, and new stages not found in the original.

Spectraball combines elements of platforming, puzzle solving, addictive gameplay and stunning visuals to deliver an experience that sets a new standard for its genre. The object of the game is simple: make it through each stage as quickly as possible. However, as you progress you will find that each stage presents its own unique obstacles and challenges that you will have to overcome. In addition to the excitement of simply completing the stages, Spectraball also offers mini-games, unlockables, and online competition against others through its leaderboard system. Can you get the best time?

Source: The Developer Website.

138063.name: Bank-Letterspel
138063.description:
Promotional game for the Dutch bank Raiffeisenbank and this is The Bank Letter Game.

Simple crossword card game, similar to games like Lexicon and Kan-U-Go. In your turn you may play a maximum of 4 cards. Words must be formed that use at least one letter of an existing word (except for the first word obviously which, incidentally, must be a four letter word). Any word can be extended though, if possible. Game includes two Jokers which have an image of an old motor car.

The first player to use all his cards wins the round. The other players total the values of their unused cards and the winner of the round scores a total of all those points (each card has a number value on it).

The winner of the game is the first player to reach a pre-agreed score.

The backs of the cards are quite novel. They can be used to make four different jigsaws. It is suggested that 6 to 8 year olds might like to do the jigsaws. I doubt it, they are extremely difficult for their size.

138064.description: Line Dice is a simple game of path creation, where 2 to 6 people divide up a pile of 36 dice and attempt to build a path that continues forward for as long as they have pieces to allow it. Players attempt to create a path that makes it impossible for their fellow players to continue, well trying to keep enough playable pieces to avoid being removed from the game prematurely.
138064.name: Line Dice
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #172 - Game, Set, Match

138065.name: The Savage World of My Little Pony (4th Edition)
138065.description:
From the introduction:

You who are about to game, I salute you!

This 4th Edition of The Savage World of My Little Pony is the culmination of over a year and half of work, both by myself and by the numerous others who contributed to its continuing evolution since its conception in early February of 2011. It is my labor of love and gift to the greater My Little Pony fandom at large, and I am sure that you will be able to see the amount of exacting detail and work that has been put into making it as complete as possible. I hope that it inspires others to use their own skills and create something that they can then bring to others and share in the sense of community that this game has created for me.

[…]

The Savage Worlds system is designed to be Fast, Furious, and Fun; a perfect game for new and experienced players alike. Few games offer this combination of streamlined simplicity and simultaneous complexity, and is a perfect way to introduce people into the world of roleplaying games.

The fact that you are reading this means that it is likely you are a fan of, or at least aware of, the show My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic and are interested in the unique things that it’s universe has to offer the roleplayer. I have conceived this system as a means to play almost any sort of story in the Friendship is Magic universe that one might think of, from episodic slice-of-life stories to grand epics that see the players match wits with terrifying foes and daunting challenges. The only limit is your own imagination.

138066.name: 24 Karat
138066.description: A family game based on the Swedish television show with the same name, hosted by Harald Treutiger. The goal of the game is to advance to the final act where you get to see if you got what it takes to win the elusive gold bar. You do this by drawing cards that have all kinds of weird statements on them, put money on if they are either true or false and then roll dice to tell who was right. This is mixed with some contextual statements like for example "will the phone ring during the game session?". Though usually it's mostly a game of plain luck.

138067.name: Giraffalaff Limbo
138067.description: The Giraffalaff Limbo will have your preschoolers howling with laughter as they try to limbo alongside the ticklish Giraffalaff giraffe. A quick spin of the wheel reveals which silly animal's walk you'll have to do under the limbo bar--whether it's the bird walk or the crab walk. Just make sure not to knock down Giraffalaff or he'll go into a frenzy of giggles, and you'll be out of the game! Designed for children ages three and up, this limbo set is a fun and activity-filled game that will keep your child engaged.

138068.name: Champion
138068.description: A swedish game from sometime in the 1960's where you manage a dog kennel. You buy dogs and enter them into competitions in different countries, breed them, sell puppies and try to make your kennel the most valuable of all the players. The game board has one path that everybody has to follow and you spin a wheel to move. Every square you land on says something that alters your situation in some way. Maybe you get to mate your dogs or they get sick. At the end of the trail the player with the most valuable kennel wins the game.

138069.name: Zunftblatt (Extrablatt - Gratisrollenspieltag 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Fanwerk: Das Schwert des Elfenkönigs vom Eiswindtal
138069.description:
user summary

With three pages plus an ad, this is more of a leaflet. For the Gratisrollenspieltag, the Zunftblatt gave away some of their back issues for free, and added this small special.

138071.name: Match of the Day
138071.description:
The object of the game is to manage a football team and take it from Division 4 to Division 1. To collect and make up a balanced team of players by buying and selling, and then to win the World Cup.

Playing around the board progressing from Division 4 to Division 1 each manager has the opportunity to win money, buy players and play Leauge Cup games. Finally challenging any other managers to play the Final of The World Cup and win.

Managers move around the board based on the role of the dice. Landing on different squares results in a choice of actions - taking cards, getting bonus payments, taking new players or challenging other managers to games. Managers may buy or sell players at any time throughout the game - with the ability of different players determining the outcome of matches. By winning matches, the managers team is promoted to a higher league and ends the game by achieving a win in the world cup final after reaching division one.

138072.description:
No 1 L.A.D.A.S (lost) Promo Card

This train is FREE to build (but the player still needs to take a Build action and the game must have had the train build event) and comes with three rubble cubes on it. Whenever the player takes the Surveyor action (i.e. go wandering up the mountain), take one of the rubble cubes off of this train card. If there are no rubble cubes on it at the end of the game (and the player still 'owns' it), then it's worth 9VP. This DOES count as a train for the purposes of "one train only" and the train upkeep event!
138072.name: Snowdonia: Lost Train Promo Card

138073.name: The Tome of Excess
138073.description:
[From back of book]
Black Crusade
The Tome of Excess
Embrace your desires and surrender to sensation!

Slaanesh is the Chaos God of Pleasure and Excess. He offers the limitless bliss of endless passions and insatiable appetites to his legions of depraved followers.

This book introduces four new Heretic Archetypes, along with cruel weapons, rules for empowering minions, new Daemon Engines, and more to amplify the rapacious hordes of the Dark Prince.

Rules for expanded interactions and social combat allow players of all alignments to seduce their foes into becoming devoted lackeys. They also gaining new ways to use their growing Infamy, plus new dark rituals to curse and entrap enemies.

New secrets of the Screaming Vortex are unveiled, such as the Demons of Contrition, the xenos guardians of the Forbidden Portal, Malignia's deadly jungles, and more. Heretics must also best a Pirate Prince of the Ragged Helix in their bid to launch their own Black Crusade.

Draw you blade and let nothing prevent your pursuit of excess!

A copy of the Black Crusade Core Rulebook is needed to use this supplement. Intended for audiences 14 and older.

Publisher Blurb:

"You believe there are limits to existence. My god shows me otherwise, and in his service I have known realms where indescribable pleasure and pain become as one. Come, let me show you...”
–Lascivoux the Devourer, Sensati Extremis of the Barbed League

The Tome of Excess is a sinfully indulgent supplement for Black Crusade. This powerful tribute to Slaanesh introduces four new Heretic Archetypes, along with cruel weapons, rules for empowering minions, new Daemon Engines, and more to amplify the rapacious hordes of the Dark Prince.

Rules for expanded interactions and social combat allow players of all alignments to seduce their foes into becoming devoted lackeys. Players also gain new ways to use their growing Infamy, plus new dark rituals to curse and entrap enemies. Discover secrets of the Screaming Vortex, such as the Demons of Contrition, the xenos guardians of the Forbidden Portal, Malignia’s deadly jungles, and more. And in the included adventure, Heretics must best a Pirate Prince of the Ragged Helix in their bid to launch their own Black Crusade!

138074.name: Turf Wars
138074.description:
Turf Wars is a game of conquest. Players are encouraged to form alliances and manipulate the situation so that ultimately, your faction, and preferably your faction alone, dominates the land.

There are up to ten (10) rounds of game play for Turf Wars each of which consists of five (5) phases:
• Perform Pre-Event Action(s)
• Place Reinforcement Troops
• Reveal Event
• Select Action Cards and Perform Actions
• Score & Spend Dominance Points

Object of the Game
There are four (4) ways your faction can win:
1. Dominate the appropriate number of turfs on the board that match your faction’s Home Turf.
2. Land the killing blow while wiping out your faction’s nemesis, if in play.
3. Achieve the objective outlined on any of your Secret Win Cards.
4. Attain highest number of Dominance Points (DP)at the end of 10 rounds. This results in a win only if no other win conditions are met first.

138075.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 328 - Dec 2002)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Papyrus, where no game is out of print!
This Isn't The Zine You're Looking For #137
Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #61
You might very well think so...
138075.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #328
December 2002

Cover art by Jason Dressel.

138076.name: The Bridge
videogamehonor: 2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
138076.description:
The Bridge is a 2D logic puzzle game that forces the player to reevaluate their preconceptions of physics and perspective. It is Isaac Newton meets M. C. Escher. Manipulate gravity to redefine the ceiling as the floor while venturing through impossible architectures. Explore increasingly difficult worlds, each uniquely detailed and designed to leave the player with a pronounced sense of intellectual accomplishment. The Bridge exemplifies games as an art form, with beautifully hand-drawn art in the style of a black-and-white lithograph.

Source: The Developer Website.

138077.description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering the Sirius Campaign, was the early age battles before main story.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
138077.name: Battles of Vega Star Zone
boardgamefamily: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles

138078.name: Fox & Rabbits
boardgameversion: Waddington Sanders English / French First Edition 1984
138078.description:
Cheeky rabbits race around the field, hiding behind bushes to outwit the sharp-eyed fox.

A roll and move, players choose three rabbits of the same colour and place them on one corner of the field on the START hole.

1. The starting player throws the dice and does two things in the following order:
a)Moves the fox to the sector of the centre circle corresponding to the number,
b)Moves one of his Rabbits in a clockwise direction on the track.

E.G. If a 2 were thrown, the player first moves the Fox onto sector 2; secondly, he moves one of his rabbits two places in a clockwise direction.

2. If the fox can "see" any rabbits in that sector of the board, they must go back to their START hole.

3. If a rabbit is in the same sector as the fox BUT is behind a bush, then it is hidden from view and does not go back to START.

4. Play moves in a clockwise direction.

5. On their first three turns, each player must bring out all three of their rabbits. If a rabbit is sent back to his START hole, it must be brought out onto the track on the player's next turn.

6. Any number of Rabbits may occupy the same space on the track.

7. If a six is thrown the player may have an extra turn.

8. A player does not have to throw the exact number to get a rabbit HOME.

The same rules apply for a two or three player game.

138079.name: Artifacts I: Ducks of Ultimate Doom
138079.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 20 page pdf contains 21 Artifacts that you can use in any fantasy campaign. Inside you will find a wide variety of artifacts from the Aegis Armor to the Staff of Jesters (not to mention the Ducks of ULTIMATE DOOM!)

138080.name: Annihilation
138080.description:
Annihilation is a Battleship-style game for two players using pencil and paper. Each player receives an identical printed sheet from a game pad, featuring a circular overhead map of the northern hemisphere. The map is divided into boxes by longitudinal and latitudinal lines, which are labeled by numbers and by names of constellations. Some boxes are shaded, representing the oceans. Also present are boxes to track each player’s hits; in place of ships are (in order of most to least boxes) Capital, Trade and Industry, Air Base, Navy, and Peace. Each player “hides” each of these objectives on his own side of the map, vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. The Navy must be in the ocean, Peace is a single box that may be anywhere, and the rest must be on land.

Each player then takes a turn firing volleys at the other side. A volley consists of 15 bombs, which can be any combination of airplane bombs, rockets, or atomics. Airplane bombs count for 1 bomb against the limit, rockets for 3, atomics for 5. Volleys are done all at once, with the opponent not announcing hits until the volley is over. Players track these developments by crossing off boxes on their paper. When a player sends a volley, if he has previously received any hits, those hits are subtracted from the 15 bombs he may fire on his current turn.

Airplane bombs strike only the square called by the player, rockets strike the first square and any two adjoining squares called immediately by the player, and atomics strike the initial square as well as the four adjoining squares along all four sides. Any target hit on one square by an atomic is immediately destroyed, any target hit by a rocket suffers an additional box hit after what the player targeted. Should any player strike the target of Peace, the game is immediately over, otherwise the game is won when all of a player’s other targets are destroyed.

138081.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Once Upon a Time, players tell a story together using cards that show fairytale elements and endings. Now add more adventure to your game with the Once Upon a Time: Seafaring Tales expansion. Inspired by daring pirates and stories of the sea, the 38 Story Cards and 17 Ending Cards in this set can be shuffled into your Once Upon a Time storytelling card game deck to add new themes and more variety to your game. For an even stronger nautical feel, try removing some of the core Story or Ending Cards.
138081.name: Once Upon a Time: Seafaring Tales
boardgameexpansion: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game

138082.name: Dribble
138082.description:
"Fast-moving championship basketball game by Lowe"

The game is played with two dice; one standard d6, and one with letters:

P (Plus): ball is to be moved directly forward
M (Minus): ball is to be moved directly backwards
R (Right): ball is to be moved to the right
L (Left): ball is to be moved to the left
D (Diagonal): ball to be moved diagonally

The object of the game is to score by moving the playing piece across the court into the basket at the far end. The player who scores the most points within the playing time is the winner.

(Source: instructions)

138083.name: Artifacts II: Lawn of the Dead
138083.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 20 page pdf contains 11 artifacts with an undead theme. Inside you will find a wide variety of artifacts from the Bone Sword to the Wooden Army of Kristiane. Each Artifact has Name, a Common Name for flavor, a Description, and a detailed History.

138084.name: Races I: Animal Kingdoms
138084.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this d20 fantasy sourcebook you will find 5 races that will shock and amaze you, for these races are all intelligent animals! We go deep within the heart of the Amalia Lands to bring you:

The Anatidae Kingdom (Duckmen)
The Buteo Kingdom (Hawkmen)
The Probsocidea Kingdom (Pachydermen)
The Rana Kingdom (Frogmen)
The Ursidae Kingdom (Bearmen)

138085.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 327 - Nov 2002)
rpgissuearticle: "Doc" Stevens and the Warriors of Mongo #64
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Papyrus, where no game is out of print! #79
The Road to Stanehouse, Part Eight
This Isn't The Zine You're Looking For #136
You might very well think so...
138085.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #327
November 2002

Cover art by Lee Brimmicombe-Wood.

138086.name: Legion
138086.description:
From publisher blurb:

LEGION!

This multiplying miscreant is a one-woman gang, able to make duplicates of herself with only stomp of her foot or slap of her hand. While she's been known to work with Mustang and Magnum, she's a solo act that's never solo.

138087.name: Piotr Paradigm
138087.description:
From publisher blurb:

Piotr Paradigm!!

Scientist. Professor. Mastermind. Meet the Tribute Universe's own mad scientist as he invades your game to take on even the most powerful hero. Included in this issue are the stats for Paradigm, as well as builds for a chunk of his arsenal! Beware the shift that he may cause!

138088.name: Visor
138088.description:
From publisher blurb:

VISOR!

One-time thug turned full-time supervillain, this Optical Offender is interested in the power and riches that come with his new found equipment. Whether it be his heat vision, pusher vision or other blast that he uses from his visor, he's got a mean look in his eye and he's staring at any hero in sight!

138089.name: Crimenet
138089.description:
From publisher blurb:

CRIMENET!!

In our premiere issue of AoV: Teams, meet the shadow organization behind many of the villains in the Tribute Universe. Within this book you'll get the background, agents, crime bosses and management of the world's most criminal organization. Characters included are Mister Crime, Miss Information, Kit-Bash & Payback, with nutshell stats for several crime lords and agents.

138090.name: Wild Hunt (Issue 38 - Apr 1979)
138090.description:
User Summary of Contents:

My Name is Legion #38 by Mark Swanson

A new character class Sethu: The Lesser Lenta




Fenris Speaks #33 by Glenn Blacow

The Armies of Edwyr/Oskley
The History of Oskley




An Open Letter To Gary Gygax by John T Sapienza Jr

Dragons Past #3 by Greg Stafford

The Battle Horse; A new mount for RuneQuest
Latest News form the Campaign
Background History on My Current RuneQuest Campaign
A Preview of the King Authur Campaign




A Wizard of Cambridge by Richard W Lesses

The Golden Dragon #10

Terrizon Shows its Teeth
Parrying System




Comments on The Wild Hunt #36 by John T Sapienza Jr

The (Return of the) Unstoned Acolyte By Wesley D Ives

On Players Driving Convoys Through Holes in the Rules




Karma by Margaret Gemignani

Letters from the Outer Realm #2 by Chuck Huber

Are GM's Made of Born?
When All the Chaotics Go Bankrupt, YOu Win...
Disrupt Ecosystems as a 9th Level Spell




Al Araaf #14 by R Mark Chilenskas

Reviews of Different Worlds #1 and Wyrm's Footnotes #6
Two new nobles in Degis




The Name of the Game is Dungeons & Dragons #18 by Bill Seligman

Ideas for two new races in Argothald: Dragons and Spirits
Assault on the Castle of Osay'Zhna part 2




Ravings of an Angry Marsh by Steve Marsh

138091.description:
Guile is a medieval memory card game of deception and intrigue for two players. Players are either the noble King Arthur or the nefarious Sir Mordred, and the Knights of the Round Table are the instruments of your influence in Camelot. Your chosen knights will advance your schemes as you trace the web of subterfuge and manipulate it to your own ends. The victor will wield the most influence when each Knight's loyalties are revealed.

The Round Table is formed by eight face-up Knights, with each player controlling four. Each Knight also bears a face-down Influence Card on top of it. On his turn, a player can look at the Influence Card of his Knight-errant or exchange that card with an Influence Card of any other Knight at the Round Table. Play continues in this manner until the turns have circled the Round Table twice. At that time, all of the face-down Influence cards are revealed, and the player who has the highest sum of Influence wins the round. A new round is set up and played again, and the first person to win two rounds wins the game.

Who will hold sway in Camelot? And who will hold sway on the morrow? Only time will tell...

Guile includes the 'inspansion' "Extended Cast", which adds even more possibilities for treachery and deceit.
138091.name: Guile
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 084: Terra Nova Games

138092.name: Wild Hunt (Issue 39 - Apr 1979)
138092.description:
User Summary of Contents:

My Name is Legion #39 by Mark Swanson

Fenris Speaks #34 by Glenn Blacow

Social Stability in Edwyr




The Runelord Writes by John Sapienza

Letters from the Outer Realm #2 by Chuck Huber

Goronwe #2 by Glenn Blacow

Missle Weapons in Goronwe




Passing Strange by Michael McCausland

The Magic Web
Tom O'Bedlam
Here Be Dragons...
Mystic Runes Found Deep in the Dungeon
What's in a Name?




Taking the Scenic Route by Blake Kirk

The Swenstown Campaign Anders Swenson

Fenris Speaks #35 by Glenn Blacow

Thoughts on Plate Armor
On Elves
The History of Oskley




The HeroQuestor by Steve Marsh

The Name of the Game is Dungeons & Dragons #19 by Bill Seligman

GM Qualities
Dragon as a Character Race

138094.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Von Drakk Manor Level
138094.description:
Baron Von Drakk has pledged the might of his nightmare horde to the Dark Consul. Twisted necromancers of the Dust Covens have plundered crypt and grave, raising legions of armor-clad skeletons and undead abominations to serve their dark masters. The skies echo with the cackle of witches on their brooms as they cast curses on those below. Yet all is not lost. Mighty Heroes of Light have answered the call to defend Crystalia. Infused with the Goddess’s spirit, they stand ready turn back the darkness.

Super Dungeon Explore level boxes contain a boss, mini-boss, three heroes, and three spawn points.

138095.name: The Lone Ranger and the Silver Bullets
138095.description:
Images of Clayton Moore as The Lone Ranger/Jay Silverheels as Tonto and Silver.

Text at top reads "A Lisbeth Whiting Creation."

This game was only available for a limited before it was pulled off the market. It was because of licensing issues.

Cardboard platform in center holding 16 silver luster plastic bullets, each 1.25" long.

Players move around the track, scoring points based on the symbol in the box on which they land.

Badge = 50 points
Horseshoe = 40 points
Mask = 30 points
Gun = 20 points
Feather = 10 points
Lone Ranger = go again
Coming to or passing starting circle = 50 points
Landing on big pictures by exact count = 20 points
Outlaw = lose one bullet, go back 100 points

138096.name: Pipword
138096.description:
Each card has both a letter and one face of a standard die. Before each turn, 5 dice are rolled and placed on the dice board in order of their colors. Then the player tries to play a word of 3-5 letters, whose die faces match a contiguous subset of the dice on the board. If they do, they score the sum of the cards' pips, doubled for 4-letter words and tripled for 5-letter words. There are also wild cards, and slug cards that can be added at either end.

The winner is the first person to reach the specified total score, e.g. 100 for 4-5 players.

138097.description: The JUSTICE and MIGHT expansion increases the ability for players to directly attack one another through the use of new City Tile steam effects and Development abilities. It also adds new ways to earn victory points, even through a strategy of peace and diplomacy.
138097.name: City of Gears: JUSTICE and MIGHT

138099.name: JaXiQuoZ
138099.description:
From the web page:
" Cool Factors:

Easy to carry.
Quick to learn and play.
Fun for word-lovers and strategy gamers alike.

Description:
Shuffle the custom deck and deal each player ten cards. Select a card from your hand to keep and pass the rest to your neighbor. Keep cherry-picking a single card from each hand until they're depleted. Each player then tries to make a single word from his cards. Letters you use in your word score points--cards you take but don't use count against you! Be the first to score 100 points, and you've won.

It has a deck of 60 cards, which have a letter and number, in different colors. Rarer letters like J and Q have multipliers on them, and there are wild cards.

138101.name: Oh My Word
138101.description:
From the web site:
" Cool Factors:

Amazing 12+ Games in one!
Fast, stimulating game play!
Fun for the whole family - always fresh!

Description:
“Oh My Word” is not just one game, but is 12+ games in one, with more being developed and added frequently! You can play any of the games with the same deck of cards!

One of the most fun and exciting games ever created is “Battle of Words!” It comes in “quick start,” "basic," and "advanced" versions. The basic version can be mastered in a matter of minutes and is fun for the entire family. The play consists of forming words, lengthening existing words, combining words, and stealing words from your opponent(s). The advanced version is easy to learn but will stimulate and challenge even the most astute word gamers. In addition to the basic play, there are 20 action cards that create all kinds of excitement and dynamics between the players. In either version, each player competes for high score through word values, word length values, bonus letter values, bonus word values, other word bonuses, and the number / quality of words acquired by the end of the game.

You can also play the following;
“Cross Words” - plays similar to a crossword puzzle game, without the limits of a regular game.
“Play On Words” - plays similar to a 3-D crossword puzzle game, without standard limitations.
“Finding the Right Words” - plays similar to a cubed word game, without the grid or cube.
“The Last Word” - plays similar to a word jumble or word search, with strategy & scoring options.
“Simple Words” - plays similar to solitaire, but played with words and is more entertaining.

You can even play poker style games that involve many more strategies and scoring options, such as;
“Word For Word” - plays similar to Texas Hold 'em.
“Keep Your Word” - plays similar to 7-Card Stud.
“Choose Your Words” - plays similar to 7-Card Draw.
“Hold Your Words” - plays similar to 7-Card No Draw.
“A Few Words” - plays similar to 7-Card No Peek.

In addition, you get "Your Words, Not Mine" which creates several more variations of game play, allowing you to play many of the games backwards! Rather than competing for high score, each player competes for low score by transferring their words / scores to other players."

The deck comes with 176 cards.

138102.name: Frazzed
138102.description:
From the web page:
" Cool Factors:

Lay down the letters!
Baffle your opponents!
Keep yourself in the game!

Description:
Frazzed (formerly Baffle) is the word game where you try to lay out the letters of your own word while preventing everyone else from guessing your word, because if they do, you're out of the game. Meanwhile, you can eliminate your opponents by guessing their words."

There is a Letter Cards Deck with 275 cards, and a Word Cards Deck with 100 cards.

138103.name: The Calixis Sector Encyclopedia
138103.description:
User Summary:

When Black Industries published Dark Heresy, they openly requested fans to submit descriptions of planets. Various of the submissions they received were edited and used to expand the newly-created Calixis Sector, becoming an official part of the game's setting. The core rulebook of course had limited space, so the full descriptions for all the planets that Black Industries accepted were published on the company's website, forming a freely-accessible gazetteer of the Calixis Sector.

Following Games Workshop's closure of the Black Industries imprint, Fantasy Flight Games acquired the licence to publish role-playing games set in the Warhammer Fantasy and Warhammer 40,000 universes. They retained an on-line gazetteer for the Calixis Sector, but in a cut-down form that detailed only the major worlds.

But fans had saved copies of the full original content and compiled it into a PDF titled "The Calixis Sector Encyclopedia". This PDF can still be found, circulated by fans on various internet forums dedicated to discussing Dark Heresy and related games.

138104.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The fires of continent-spanning war engulf western Immoren, forging great leaders in a crucible of conflict. Bold commanders orchestrate grand strategies and daring battlefield tactics, their actions bringing glorious victory—or the despair of final defeat. Do you have the courage and cunning to lead your forces to ultimate triumph? Take command and muster the military might of an entire nation to conquer the Iron Kingdoms!

Warmachine: High Command is a deck-building card game for 2-4 players set in the steam-powered fantasy world of the Iron Kingdoms. Leverage your resources, rally your armies, and dominate your foes to set your banner above all of western Immoren!

This set can be combined with the following other core sets:

Hordes: High Command
Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune
138104.name: Warmachine: High Command
boardgameexpansion: Warmachine: High Command – Into the Breach
Warmachine: High Command – Invasion of Sul
Warmachine: High Command – The Big Guns
boardgamepodcastepisode: 5 Minute Initiative - Ep. 12 - High Command
Episode 31 The Command Is Not That High
Strange Assembly 113 - Sophia Regina

138105.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Brutal conflict spreads across the wilds of western Immoren, fought by savage warriors and terrible beasts. Powerful warlords orchestrate grand strategies and daring battlefield tactics, their actions bringing glorious victory — or the despair of final defeat. Do you have the courage and cunning to guide your forces to ultimate triumph? Take command of the mightiest warriors and beasts to conquer the wilds of Immoren!

In Hordes: High Command, each player takes control of one faction of the Hordes world – Skorn, Circle of Orboros, Trollblods or Legion of Eveblight – leading whole armies of soldiers, Warlocks and mighty Warbeasts to great battles which will shake all of Immoren and change it forever. Each faction has individual decks with faction-specific warbeasts, units, and resources which assure different strategy and gameplay from the other factions. Additionally, before each game, players choose three of the five warlocks specific to their faction. This decision makes every game different and allows for multiple strategies. During the game, players play a whole season of War, trying to build up their strength, then capture strategic locations to earn victory points.

Hordes: High Command can be combined with the following other core sets:

Warmachine: High Command.
Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune
138105.name: Hordes: High Command
boardgameexpansion: Hordes: High Command – Castle of the Keys Campaign Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 31 The Command Is Not That High
Strange Assembly 113 - Sophia Regina

138106.name: Hammer of the Emperor
138106.description:
Publisher's Description:


"This ain't training, trooper. This is the real thing. Those are real bullets and real bombs. This is war. If you want to make it through the next few hours alive, you better do exactly as I say and exactly as I do."
— Sergeant Rince Klebb, Baraspian 3rd Rifles, shortly before his death


Hammer of the Emperor is a handbook for the brave soldiers of the Imperial Guard. New options for regiment creation and mixed regiments, along with details on renowned regiments like the Attilan Rough Riders and Tanith First-and-Only, give players unique ways to wage war in the 41st Millennium. Plus, enhance your missions with new Advanced Specialties, an expanded armoury, rules for Mounted Combat, and much more!

138108.name: February 2013: Panic!
138108.description:
From Introduction:

While it’s common for a character to become ‘Panicked’ during an Outbreak, it often has much more far reaching consequences than just adding a Mishap Die to your checks. Any number of poor decisions can result from being ‘Panicked’, which we are representing with a few unique Hazard options.

138109.name: The Book of the Asur
138109.description:
designer summary

After three editions of Warhammer fantasy role play game, three different editions of Dwarf supplements (they have even a magazine called White Dwarf), and no Elf supplement at all; in these times where we are working to correct gender discrimination, I decided to work to correct race discrimination!

In this fan project you will find the recompilation of the recent history of the Asur and some of their most fabled heroes, descriptions of the different regions of Ulthuan and house rules for regional features of the Asur, Elven culture and religion, a short description of Elftown -the largest high elf settlement in the land of men, house rules for High Elf nobles in the harsh Empire lands, and the role of high magic in the Asur every-day life as well as house rules for High Magic apprenticeship.

All this is supported by several new careers and some already existing careers re-edited with an elf flavor, pets, followers, items...

user comment
this is a High Elves fan supplement for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay (3rd Edition)
it can be found on the Fantasy Flight Games website

138110.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The battles of Warhammer: Invasion grow larger and more intense than ever before with the multiplayer battles of Cataclysm, the game's fourth deluxe expansion. Cataclysm comes with a rulebook, six fulcrum cards, 38 tokens, and 159 player cards (three copies each of fifty-three different cards) that allow up to four players to war for dominion over the Old World.

The expansion also provides new ammunition for those who wish to continue exploring the fast-paced, bloody, back-and-forth battles of the two-player matches from the Warhammer: Invasion - The Card Game Core Set.

The Cataclysm multiplayer format builds upon the game's classic kingdom building, questing, and battles, but follows rules for a new turn sequence that explores the shifting tides of battle between the Old World’s six main races. Meanwhile, you'll war to acquire as many copies as they can of a new form of token – the dominance token, which represents the success of your efforts to subdue your foes and establish your rule.
138110.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Cataclysm
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 11: The fine arts of war
Episode 3: Two chumps and a champ
Episode 7: It was the best of times, it was the End Times

138111.name: Bayern kaufen ...
138111.description:
Objective:
get most money within agreed time
- acting by turns -

a classical Monopoly, taking place in Bavaria, Germany with all the well known activities like buying, trading..
typically 3-6 players, including banker 7

138112.name: Sabrina the Animated Series: Spooked!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138112.description:
User Summary

Based on the cartoon series of the same name, Sabrina has accidentally changed the kids of her school into animals. Now she, along with help from her pet cat Salem, must change them back. 16 levels await, with a password system saving the action.

138113.name: Tales of the Space Marines
138113.description:
From the Introduction:

You are a Space Marine, named because of an ancient trademark dispute that only ended when the XIVth Void Commando Group said "fuck the law" not with words but with relativistic kinetic weapons. Also, because "Space Naval Infantry" is nowhere near as catchy. The Space Marines are the vanguard of an aggressively hegemonizing starfaring civilization.

Upon encountering a new world, you strap into a four ton combination of vacuum suit, combat armour, and recreational tank. You use a range of improbably large weapons designed to make other living beings die messily - and to make a range of toasted bread products to keep your morale high. You attempt genocide of the natives until they capitulate to your civilization's rules

This is not a game about ultraviolent imperialsm. This is a game about being an ultraviolent imperialist.

138114.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 361 - Sep 2005)
138114.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 361
September 2005

Cover art by Michael K. Todd.

138115.name: Sabrina the Animated Series: Zapped!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138115.description:
User Summary

Based on the cartoon series of the same name, Sabrina has accidentally changed the kids of her school into animals. Now she, along with help from her pet cat Salem, must change them back. 16 levels await, with a password system saving the action.

138116.name: Scooby-Doo! Classic Creep Capers (GBC)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138116.description:
The Game Boy Color version features the gang trying to solve the case of the ghost of Dr. Jekyll. The player controls all members of the gang. The Mystery Machine had run out of gas in front of the Jekyll Mansion. The gang goes through each area of the mansion and the lab.
