The player must pick up items for later use, such as a stool, a sausage, and a book with the code to get into the lab.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scooby Doo! Classic Creep Capers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138117.name: Sesame Street: Elmo's 123s
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138117.description:
User Summary

An educational game featuring Elmo from Sesame Street. Choose from several different number-based games which include Count, Choose, Plus, and Minus.

138118.name: Sesame Street: Elmo's ABCs
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138118.description:
User Summary

An educational game featuring Elmo from Sesame Street. Learn the alphabet and basic spelling in six different games.

138119.name: Sesame Street: The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138119.description:
User Summary

Based on the movie of the same name, Elmo has lost his blanket in a garbage bin and now must travel through Grouchland to get it back. There are six levels to go through.

138120.name: Sgt. Rock: On the Frontline
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138120.description:
User Summary

Based on the arcade game Frontline. Take control of a soldier and blast your way through enemies in levels sporting atop-down view. Different weapons and vehicles are available as you make your way through the missions.

138121.name: Shanghai Pocket
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138121.description:
Back of the box

The ultimate Puzzle! Three ways to test your strength, either against the computer or a friend.
Shanghai: Twelve challenging levels!
Kong Kong: Race your opponent to clear your layout! Watch for Power Tiles!
Gold Rush: Beat your opponent to the Golden Tile!

138122.name: Shrek: Fairy Tale Freakdown
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138122.description:
User Summary

A one-on-one fighting game featuring character from the animated film, Shrek. Fight your way through the tournament to finally take on the champion himself, Lord Farquaad.

138123.name: Darklands: a World of War
138123.description:
Darklands is a world in which you command the armies of man and beast that your ancestors once did for glory, power or simple survival.

What if dragons really flew and giants really walked the earth? What if berserkers actually were bear-men, man and bear joined together? What if all of the myths and legends we take for granted were real and our ancestors fought against - and with - creatures and beings and realms we thought were nothing more than the fantasies of our uncivilised selves?

Based in the Dark Ages in the year 650AD in Northwest Europe, Darklands is a Skirmish Wargame that allows you to field the men and mythological beasts of the time. This game will allow you to:
- Take command of Norse Trolls and Jötunn and conduct raids on the coast of Dark Age Britain.
- Lead the hosts of Baalor, the Evil Eye in the Ice, and the Fomoraic, a race of half men and beast along with hideous sea creatures under the thrall of Baalor in their quest to crush Dark Age Ireland.
- Defend Dark Age Wales with the Brythoniaid and their draconic allies.

The game will feature the following Kindreds (factions):
- Albainn (Picts)
- Angelcynn (Angles)
- Atalantes (Classic Greeks from the mythical continent of Atlantis)
- Brythoniaid (Welsh Britons)
- Byzantii (Dark Age Romans)
- Érainn (Irish)
- Fomoraic (Fomorians)
- Khthones (Escaped slaves of the Atlantes and all are Reptilian Anthropomorphs such as Snakes, Crocodiles, Hydras and Basilisks)
- Norse (Vikings)
- Ysians (An alliance of Kernow and the mythical city of Ys)

With these additional, smaller Kindreds appearing as allies to the others:
- The Vras (Greedy ratmen allied with the Ysians)
- Infernii (Daemons from Dantes Divine Comedy allied with the Byzantii)

Some features of the gameplay:
- Individual alternate unit activation
- D10s based
- Inches are the primary measurement
- Game turns are called 'Hours'
- Will feature weather and time of day
- A big mechanic of the game is that all warriors large and small, when they are wounded, become weaker for the rest of the game.
- Bows will be able to shoot arrows the length of the table and beyond - but their shots loose power with increased range.
- Army Standards and Army Musicians important to game play and orders
- Plastic round bases with arcs of visibility pre-marked
- Dark Magic will be involved. Using it will come “at a price”

138124.name: The Simpsons: Night of the Living Treehouse of Horror
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138124.description:
User Summary

Take control of the different members of The Simpsons family through levels based on the Treehouse of Horror episodes of their animated cartoon.

138125.name: Snoopy Tennis
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138125.description:
User Summary

A tennis game featuring characters from the Peanuts comic strip. Play exhibition matches or through a tournament. Different characters have different strengths and there are several different courts to play on.

138126.name: Space Marauder
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138126.description:
Space Marauder is a scrolling shooter, and has been compared to NES and SNES era shooter games such as Space Megaforce. The game puts the player in the role an infantryman dropped into an alien base that is determined to enslave humanity. There are three different power-ups, and the game allows you to shoot in eight different directions. However, due to the difficulty of switching the direction of fire during the midst of battle, it is regarded to be easier to just shoot in one direction. The three power-ups are considered standard for the genre: a blue bullet, a lighter blue laser, and a pink laser. The game uses a password system to continue progress.

Source: Wikipedia, "Space Marauder", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138127.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In ancient times, immortal vampires played games with people's lives and with real blood stakes. Now in card game form, no real blood will be spilled, but the strategy, tactics, and power-plays still abound. Based upon a game that exists in the True Blood universe, Night Eternal: The Game is a competitive card game of intrigue, power-plays and betrayal where vampires jockey for power, position and ultimate control of the rival factions: The Authority and The Monarchy.

Players must ante blood from their pools to both factions each turn of the game. Players build up their hands by acquiring cards from a powerful, but temperamental Immortals deck and a willing and able Agent deck. The cards that a player chooses to play will determine the faction to which he or she is loyal...for now. In turn order, each player plays out one card (face up) during each of three rounds each turn, so you never just how much power it will take to seize control of a faction each turn.

Players must pay attention to the cards their opponents are playing. It's more difficult to enable a powerful card's special ability if your opponents are playing weaker cards. Weaker card special abilities are easy to resolve, but weakness doesn't win the war. Special abilities might allow a player to steal blood from a faction or move it from one faction to another, so switching your loyalty to a new faction (by playing cards of that faction) might just throw off your opponents' best laid plans.

In the end, power still rules the day. At the end of each turn (after three rounds of card play), the cards are scored. The player with the highest value of Authority cards earns that faction's blood pool. The player with the highest value of Monarchy cards earns that faction's blood pool. The key to victory is to have more blood tokens than any other player when the first player dies...by running out
of blood.
138127.name: Night Eternal: The Game

138128.name: Spawn (GBC)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138128.description:
User Summary

Based on the comic books of the same name, players control Spawn through many levels. Spawn was once a normal human, but circumstances lead to his death and becoming a hellspawn by Malebolgia. He is supposed to lead Malebolgia's dark armies, but decides to turn against him, and must now defeat Malebolgia in order to rest in piece.

138129.name: Speedy Gonzales: Aztec Adventure
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
138129.description:
User Summary

Sylvester has kidnapped all the mice in Mexico and it is up to Speedy Gonzales to get them back. Control Speedy through 18 stages using various weapons. A password system saves the action.

138130.name: Planarch Codex: Dark Heart of the Dreamer
138130.description:
From the introduction:

This is a planar supplement for Dungeon World, World of Dungeons, and other games of dungeon adventure. It is modular, so use the parts you like.

FERAL ANTHROPOLOGIES provides new GM guidelines for playing in settings where culture matters.

CORSAIRS AND LOW BRIGANDS describes the pervasive scourge of planar banditry and how to take part in it.

THE RAVENOUS CITY introduces the monstrous planar metropolis of Dis and its inhabitants.

138131.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 360 - Aug 2005)
138131.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #360
August 2005

Cover art by Scott Gallery.

138132.name: The Spiral Game
138132.description:
Players each have one or two pawns. Depending on a dice roll they chose which pawn to advance along the spiral. Pawns landing on or adjacent to their own colour advance forward or backward along the spiral, or move inward or outward. If you and on another pawn the other pawn moves backwards five spaces, but may then in turn trigger off backward, forward, inward or outward movements.

A quick, fun family game reminiscent to Clue (Cluedo), which offers some interesting tactical decisions.

138133.name: Flinke Rechner
138133.description:
Objective: gain most point by fixing squares
- acting by turns -
During her/his turn each player places a (yellow) meeple on the board (a grid of 5x7 squares), filling one free corner of a square;
as soon as one (or more) square(s) is(are) fully occupied number(s) within is(are) added or subtracted (depending on colour) to/from your account.

138134.name: Dungeon Fighter Online
138134.description:
User Summary

Less a vast MMO proper than a series of instanced Beat 'em Up levels connected by a town, DFO features typical RPG classes like Mage, Fighter, Thief, and Priest, as well as "Gunner" and "Slayer". The whole game is 2D, in SNES style, and combat plays very much like a Final-Fight-type beat-'em-up. The variety of special moves -- all skills, which you purchase and improve with skill points gained from levelling up -- are mostly launched using arrow key combinations with the main two attack buttons, a la Street Fighter.

138136.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 291 - Nov 1999)
rpgissuearticle: At the Sign of the Salient Hurcheon #112
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
ISO The Real World Volume II/Issue 2
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #100
Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #50
138136.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #291
November 1999

Cover art by David T. Okamura.

138137.name: The Quiet Year
rpghonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2013 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
2013 Indie Game of the Year Runner-Up
2013 Indie RPG Awards Best Production Runner-Up
2013 Indie RPG Awards Most Innovative Game Winner
138137.description:
From the publisher:

For a long time, we were at war with The Jackals. But now, we’ve driven them off, and we have this – a year of relative peace. One quiet year, with which to build our community up and learn once again how to work together. Come Winter, the Frost Shepherds will arrive and we might not survive beyond that. But we don’t know about that yet. What we know is that right now, in this moment, there is an opportunity to build something.

The Quiet Year is a map game. You define the struggles of a post-apocalyptic community, and attempt to build something good within their quiet year. Every decision and every action is set against a backdrop of dwindling time and rising concern.

The game is played using a deck of cards – each of the 52 cards corresponds to a week during the quiet year. Each card triggers certain events – bringing bad news, good omens, project delays and sudden changes in luck. At the end of the quiet year, the Frost Shepherds will come, ending the game.

138138.description:
Publisher Blurb:

New ships for Federation Commander! 15 new ships (Fed fast destroyer, Klingon F6B, Romulan K7R, Kzinti destroyer, Gorn destroyer-battlecruiser, Tholian TK5, Hydran D7H, Andro SatBase, Lyran JagdPanther, WYN fast cruiser, ISC fast cruiser and escort cruiser, Vudar fast cruiser, Seltorian fast cruiser and new light cruiser. A proper battlestation, a new monster (Sun Snake), 2 cards for small ground bases, 40 one-inch and 140 half-inch counters , and 8 new scenarios.
138138.name: Federation Commander: Reinforcements Attack

138139.description:
From the Rules

QVN Ship List Pack #1 includes additional ship lists and counters for use with BoneGames game of late 19th century warfare Queen Victoria's Navy. This is not a complete game. Ownership of Queen Victoria's Navy and its free expansion Admiral On Deck is necessary in order to use these ship lists.

Ship List Pack #1 includes ship lists for the Chinese, Japanese, and Russian navies as they were from the period 1880-1907.
138139.name: Queen Victoria's Navy Ship List Pack #1: China/Russia/Japan

138141.description:
A mass Exodus to the newborn planet Eeventide is occurring. As you venture from Earth to Eeventide, you become a Drifter, gaining the ability to fly and drift across a new world. Forge a special deck of cards from stardust, and battle other Drifters by summoning massive creatures to fight for you! Your very existence is bound to the planet by a mysterious contraption that glows with an ethereal light. You can join a faction or fight solo as you pave a path.
The first two guilds have risen, Dragonis & Skyborn, each fighting over a planet that requires constant conflict.


Players begin the game with 10 Life Points, which represent their will left to fight. Each player takes turns playing by following the 5 Phases of a Turn:

Draw Phase: Draw 3 cards from your Energy Deck and 3 cards from your Main Deck
Energy Phase: Play your energy onto the board in any arrangement you like
Creature Phase: Summon any creatures from your hand by placing them on blank piles of energy
Attack Phase: Attack your opponent's creatures using your own, or attack their Life Points directly if they have no creatures
End Phase: Pass the turn to your opponent





Players win the game by using their creatures to attack their opponent's Life Points directly. Each energy behind a creature counts as 1 point of damage in a direct attack. Players can attack with as many creatures as they want during their turn, and use instant-speed Symmetry cards to make their creatures stronger or change the tide of battle. Symmetry cards can be played literally at any time, on either player's turn for surprise interrupts.

Energy cards are universal, so players can use any combination of cards. Decks can be constructed by following the one simple rule of limiting 2 copies of a card per deck (excluding energy).


The base set Birth of Creation is now available, featuring Dragons & Angels!

Each Harmonized Starter Deck is competitive and fully customizable right out of the box!

The cards in Starter Decks are a unique set in themselves and will not be found in booster packs
Harmonized Skyborn Starter Deck
40-Card Angel Deck
Starter's Guide
1 Rule Card
1 Bonus Extended Art Promo Card


Harmonized Dragonis Starter Deck
40-Card Dragon Deck
Starter's Guide
1 Rule Card
1 Bonus Extended Art Promo Card








A premiere edition set of decks will be released alongside the first booster pack expansion, Galaxy Tides, October 2014! Retailers, please ask your distributor about pre-ordering and gain access to store exclusives.
138141.name: Exodus Trading Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: S4 EP 406 - Exodus with Gina Ippolito

138142.name: Xanadu: Promo Card – Colección de Arte de Palacio / Palace Art Collection
138142.description:
First promo card for the game Xanadù.

This is a Jade Building which gives a lot of victory points.

On its first level it gives 9 Victory points and on its higher level it gives 3 Victory points.

The Palace Art Collection cost 1 Jade, 1 Ink and 1 Bronce to play.

When this card was distributed it carried the signature of two of the games designers (Velásquez and Tobar) in the upper right corner.

138144.name: Caractor Match
138144.description:
Taken from the game's web page:

CARACTOR MATCH is a fun, fast-paced card game where players try to match colorful symbols to make pairs. Make your pairs the quickest and win!

Each turn, players choose to draw cards from the deck or take the discard pile, make pairs, discard and pass the turn. Each symbol appears on three different cards. Each card has two different symbols. Easy enough for children to play and elegant enough for adults to enjoy.

138145.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 359 - Jul 2005)
rpg: Lacuna Part I. The Creation of the Mystery and the Girl from Blue City
138145.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #359
July 2005

Cover art by Michael K. Todd.

138146.description:
From the Rules

The Bombardment of Alexandria 1882 is an additional historical scenario for use with BoneGames game of late 19th century warfare Queen Victoria's Navy. This scenario is not a complete game. Ownership of Queen Victoria's Navy (and the Admiral On Deck expansion) is necessary in order to use this scenario. Visit the BoneGames website at www.bonegames.com for information about Queen Victoria's Navy, Admiral On Deck, and other games by BoneGames.

Historical Background

Early in 1882 the Egyptian Army forced the Khedive, Tewfik Pasha, to appoint Colonel Said Ahmed Arabi AKA Arabi Pasha as the new Minister of War. In this position, and with the backing of the army, Arabi was the de facto ruler of the country. Arabi was viewed with distrust in both Britain and France. This distrust was not without reason as he and his followers viewed the Khedive as a puppet of the Europeans, attacked Europeans in the streets, and threatened to nationalize the Suez Canal leaving the stockholders without a cent, and to repudiate Egypt's foreign loans.

A combination of fear for the Canal, the shortest route to India after all, the outraged cries of the investors and a pinch of concern for the Europeans in Egypt, plus a heavy dose of Jingoism led the British government to prepare for war. France, for some very convoluted internal political reasons, reversed policy and refused to help.

While an Army was being assembled the British decided that their first step should be to neutralize the extensive coastal batteries defending Alexandria. On 10 July,Vice Admiral Sir B. P. Seymour demanded that the forts, then being strengthened, be surrendered. The navies of other nations and all commercial shipping quickly sailed out of port. The Egyptians refused this demand and Queen Victoria’s Navy cleared for action. On 11 July, 1882 the bombardment began at 0650 hours.
138146.name: The Bombardment of Alexandria 1882

138147.name: Kinderfest
138147.description:
Objective: be the first finisheng the round-trip of an amusement park
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
each player rolls the die moving forward according number; ending on a marked (red/green/blue) space follow instructions. Target (100) must be reached with a matching number.
remarks:
game was packed/sent out in a paper bag without die and meeples

138148.name: Signature Bingo
138148.description:
User Summary

In Signature Bingo players work to create a 'bingo' by finding people to sign their bingo card. Each square on the bingo card has a phrase or statement that must apply to the person being asked; for example, a player might be searching for someone who fits the square, "I can speak 2 languages," and thus ask a new acquaintance whether they can or not. If the acquaintance can, the player asks for their signature on the square.
Players who achieve Bingo within a particular time frame are usually rewarded with a prize, though the game is more of an ice-breaker for large groups.

138149.name: 7th Seal: Armageddon RPG
138149.description:
Publisher's Blurb

7th Seal is a cinematic role playing game based on post-apocalyptic anime. Within this book you will find all the rules and inspiration you need to create heroes, build adventures and save the world, or what is left of it.

7th Seal reveals a world in chaos, ravaged by the Last War, Armageddon, a viral contagion and an alien invasion. From this disastrous beginning, though, emerges a new breed of heroes. Forged in the fire of war, fuelled with Old Testament faith, alien technology and psionic mutations these heroes fight to bring order out of chaos, to rebuild and protect their world, and to defeat the Leviathan. So don you power suit, say your prayers, grab your lucky plasma rifle and your psionic friend, too, and let’s kick some mutant-demon-zombie-alien-butt.

138150.name: Das neue Basketballspiel
138150.description:
Objective: score most points flipping a ball into a basket
- acting by turns -
players try to flip a (table-tennis) ball into a basket, positioned a a height of ~20 inches;

138151.name: Reign of Winter Player's Guide
138151.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Reign of Winter Player’s Guide gives players all the spoiler-free information, inspiration, and new rules they’ll need to create characters prepared for delving into the adventure and frigid mysteries of the Reign of Winter Adventure Path.

Within, players of this campaign will find everything they need to create character backgrounds tied to personalities and events vital to Pathfinder Adventure Path’s fight to turn back the tide of unseasonable pockets of winter popping up all over Golarion. Inside players find campaign-specific traits to give adventurers the edge they need to take on cruel witches, evil fey, and frigid threats encountered amid the snow and ice. This player’s guide also features a brief survey of Heldren, a small village in southern Taldor where the excitement begins, as well as various class options for heroes ready to take up the call to end the Reign of Winter!

Adventurers don't need to head out into the cold unprepared! Gather your allies and let the Reign of Winter Player's Guide start your trip into the thrill and danger of the Reign of Winter Adventure Path.

138152.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 294 - Feb 2000)
rpgissuearticle: At the Sign of the Salient Hurcheon #14
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
ISO The Real World Volume II/Issue 4
ISO The Real World Volume II/Issue 5
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #103
Welcome to the Future: Georgetown U. Auctions off Class Spaces
Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #51
138152.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #294
February 2000

Cover art by Tracey Zacharov.

138153.name: Realflight Basic
138153.description:
User Summary

Greatplanes Realflight R/C Flight Simulator Basic provides "The essential R/C flight experience". Included are the installation CD a very simple quick start guide, and a hobby quality controller with "Quick Select" menu buttons and "Reset" button for the inevitable "Humbling Moment". Once installed you will be able to choose from 47 different aircraft (12 rotor wings and 35 fixed wing airplanes) then choose from 6 "Photofield" flying sites.

138154.name: Wild Hunt (Issue 40 - May 1979)
138154.description:
User Summary of Contents:

Fenris Speaks #36 by Glenn Blacow

The Unstoned Acolyte by Wes Ives

The Chronicles of the Abbey of Saint Brixi




My Name is Legion #40 by Mark Swanson

Reviews of Journal of the Travellers' Aid Society, Different Worlds #2, and The Dungeoneer #11
The Degrossificaton of Gorree

Welcome to the World of Argothald

Letters from the Outer Realm #4 by Chuck Huber

Can a D&D World be a Medieval Society?
Does FRP Make for Good Literature?




The Runelord Writes #5 by John T Sapienza Jr

138155.name: Pirates!
rpghonor: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Free Game - Runner-Up
138155.description:
From the designer's website:

This is a game for incredible adventures, fun and relaxing, very undemanding, a game well suited for improvisation. You play a pirate, vile, dirty, unfair, disrespectful and cruel, wandering the Caribbean in search of treasure, alcohol and beautiful women. Pirates do not have an ounce of reflection and throw themselves headlong into the adventure, taking all the risks, regularly receiving memorable blows that would kill an average whale but which merely slow down the pirates. They are superstitious and have a kind of moral code of their own which is usually the cause of crazy situations.

This is a game for those who know nothing about navigation, sailing, geography in the seventeenth century nor anything too serious. There is no real immersion, just the "color" and laughing. Think of it as a pirate movie who will not teach you anything, but will give you a good time. Thanks to the rules, the GM has very little work and will mostly give story primers and hit back the PCs, the game will move on its own. The rules also encourage players to play together, not against each other.

The topic require some maturity, after all it is a question of murder, teasing ladies, drinking, rapine... This is a light and fun caricature of a world which in reality was much darker. Here beatings given or received have little importance, there is no display of blood or guts, just the infantile "bam! you're dead" and "bing! in your teeth." You must also learn to accept the frequent disappointments that your character will suffer.

Pirates! differs from other games on the same theme by the extreme simplicity of the rules, the rather low preparation involved and the tone which is light hearted rather than epic.

138156.name: Kerbal Space Program
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Sci-fi Game of the Year Winner
2014 Game Developers Choice Awards Audience Award Winner
2014 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2014 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2015 Golden Joystick Best Indie Game of the Year Winner
2016 D.I.C.E. Strategy/Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Crowdfunded Game of the Year Nominee
138156.description:
Kerbal Space Program (commonly abbreviated as KSP) is a beta-stage sandbox-style space flight simulator game, currently in development for Windows and Mac OS X. Players assume the role of commanding many aspects of the Kerbal space agency including mission planning, rocket design, and space navigation and piloting. Kerbal Space Program supports game mods and currently has an active modding community.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kerbal Space Program", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Microbadge:
- Kerbal Space Program fan - Jebediah

138159.name: Actual Sunlight
138159.description:
Actual Sunlight is a short interactive story about love, depression and the corporation.

The game puts you in the role of Evan Winter, a young professional in Toronto, as he moves through three distinct periods of his life. The story is linear, unavoidable and (hopefully) thought-provoking. You experience his perceptions, fall under the consequences of his decisions, and meet everyone who didn’t change him.

Gameplay is minimal, and serves only to move from one part of the (admittedly) text-heavy story to the next. The game fiercely attempts to be worth it.

Actual Sunlight is not appropriate for children. It features mature themes and an adult-workplace amount of profanity. And it does so immediately.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
138161.description:
Players begin with a ship, and travel from planet to planet, hiring crew, purchasing ship upgrades, and picking up cargo to deliver (jobs) all in the form of cards. Some crew and cargo are illegal, and can be confiscated if your ship is boarded by an alliance vessel. Travelling from planet to planet requires turning over "full burn" cards, one for each space moved. Most do nothing, but you can also encounter an Alliance ship, have a breakdown, or even run into Reavers. Completing jobs gets you cash. First player to complete the story goals wins.

Game description from the publisher:

In Firefly: The Game – based on the popular Firefly television series created by Joss Whedon – players captain their own Firefly-class transport ship, traveling the 'Verse with a handpicked crew of fighters, mechanics and other travelers. As a captain desperate for work, players are compelled to take on any job — so long as it pays. Double-dealing employers, heavy-handed Alliance patrols, and marauding Reavers are all in a day's work for a ship's captain at the edge of the 'Verse. Firefly: The Game is a high-end thematic tabletop boardgame from Gale Force Nine (GF9) and the first in a series of tabletop hobby board games and miniatures games from GF9 set in the Firefly Universe.
138161.name: Firefly: The Game
