138162.name: Pixel People
138162.description:
With the help of your trusty assistant you welcome new clones to your city at the arrival centre, then it’s up to you to find them a job. Create residents by combining the skills of others, build them a place to put their new skills to use and watch your Utopia grow!

Source: The Publisher Website.

138163.name: Konsorcjum
138163.description:
Consortium is a print & play dice game for 1 to 6 persons in which the players take the roles of powerful businessmen, trying to acquire the most worthy concessions possible. The concessions concern three types of natural resources (energetic resources (E), metals (M) and water (W)).

The goal is to score the maximum possible number of points. The points of each player are summed at the end of the game and are attributed for the number of their concessions, for their political influence and for the supremacy in every three kinds of resources.

The game can be played from 2 to 6 players but it has a solitaire mode also.

Konsorcjum is language independent and comes with Polish, French, English, Spanish and Portuguese rules.

138164.name: Shipwreck at Har's Point
138164.description:
From the publishers website:

A few weeks ago a ship was wrecked off the hamlet of Har's Point. Rumours abound that the ships was carrying wealth, and the unhappy spirits of the dead sailors walk the nearby beaches. A 1st edition Advanced Dungeons & Dragons adventure designed for 4-6 player characters of levels 2-4 (about 12-16 character levels).

138165.description:
Shattered Throne is the first expansion to the Planet Masters dicegame. This optional set of rules explains how to use the new dice.

Three new alien races with special abilities are available to the players. A new central planet is added to the dice pool and players can now invest in technology advances.

Background story:
The central government on Solium Sphaera has fallen. The planet is in turmoil. Social unrest divides the galaxy. The all consuming technology race between the empires has shattered the symbolic throne. Rivalry between the empires has never been this tense. Fleet sizes are rising. The amount of weapons is growing. The empire with the most advanced technological knowledge will seize control of the central megaplanet Solium Sphaera. He who controls Solium Sphaera reigns the universe.
138165.name: Shattered Throne

138166.description:
Huida de Silver City (trad. Escape From Silver City) is the board game about survival, where zombies will hunt you without rest through streets and buildings, where there is no such thing as endless ammo and you never know what could be awaiting round the corner. Embody one of the outbreak survivors and cooperate with your partners so you can manage to leave the city before time runs out. You should be careful, though, because one of them looks a little bit ill and the girl was bitten a while ago… and she is anxiously staring at that bleeding wound in your arm. Maybe it’s just better save her the suffering with a bullet, you can make it yourself after all… or maybe not…?

Includes a large survivor-styled board, 30 personalized standups counters to represent characters and zombies, two dice: one eight-sided and another one six-sided, 93 cards, plenty of items to represent weapons and objects in general, 7 customized characters sheets, comprehensive rulebook with a fair amount of quests aside the main game.

The approach is simple... we have to flee the city. There are three ways to escape: land, sea and air. The last one is only available if between players is the character of the pilot. The other two are available ... as long as the ship does not leave nor the military blow the bridge to contain the outbreak. Do not forget that the transport may have limited seats.

And on the way? Zombies, hidden areas which reveal themselves by the survivors approaching. But beware! these areas may contain more zombies or obstacles that force us to get round. Also, there are many common and special buildings that we can loot- Only if we are not eaten- looking for weapons, equipment and medkits. Meanwhile, zombies are surrounding us, they corner us, hit us… they also bite us so we can get infected!! of course the rest of the team doesn't need to know, right?
138166.name: Huida de Silver City
boardgameexpansion: Huida de Silver City: Carne Fresca
Huida de Silver City: La Feria de los Monstruos
boardgameaccessory: Huida de Silver City: Deluxe Tokens
boardgamepodcastepisode: DdJ 018. Zona Lúdica. Asylum Games. Peká Editorial. Ludonova. Gonzo Bríos.
Episodio 10 – ¡Juegos, juegos, juegos! y ¡jornadas, jornadas, jornadas!
Podcast: Diógenes Busca Juego 04 – El doble filo del Crowdfunding

138167.name: Я твоя понимай
138167.description:
The legendary Sannikov Land is discovered at last! Civilization ambassadors from all over the world move to the small piece of land lost somewhere in the Arctic. The are ready to offer the aboriginal Onkilon tribe various civilization achievements, from clock and football to submarines and atheism, as an exchange for the natural resources of the island. But still, it’s quite necessary for envoys at least to explain the indigenes what are they talking about before persuading them to buy all these surely useful miracles of culture, science and engineering because the only way to talk to the Onkilons is in primitive pictograms which represent simple words such as “fish”, “mother”, “egg”, “cold” or “above”.

My Understands You is a board game of associations and creative thinking. Players one after another take a role of civilization ambassador, who should explain any expression of the modern world using simple images. Others play as the Onkilons and try to guess what the guest of the Big world is talking about. Victory points charge by right conjectures and understandable explanations. When everyone will play as an envoy for 2 to 5 times, depending to the number of players, the game ends and the winner is defined according to the earned points.

At the game beginning each player gets a set of the voting tiles with the numbers from 1 to 6 on them and 3 stake tiles: smoked herring, reindeer hide and mammoth tusk. By the way, players acquire 3 big cards with civilization achievements, 2 words on each (for example, “oil derrick”, “backpack”, “deodorant”, “calculator”) and 6 small cards with pictograms (such as “woman”, “bird”, “loud”, “night”).

Each turn the envoy puts his achievement cards in a column. Upper word or phrase is counted as the first, the one under it as the second and all way down to the lower as the sixth one. Then the envoy decides which of the achievements he will explain with the gained pictograms. He should use 2 or 3 small cards: for example, “water”, “fire” and “below” for “oil derrick”. After the decision about the achievement and its explanation he puts the needed small cards with face up and the number tile face down.

Other players acting as the Onkilons join the round. They try to guess which of 6 achievements the presenter is trying to show. They find the word or phrase on the big cards that is the most suitable for the played pictograms and lay out the appropriate number tiles face down as well. Also the indigenes need to use one of the stake tiles. Victory points depend on the stake if the word hypothesis will be right: 1 point for a herring, 2 for a hide and 3 for a tusk.

When all the Onkilons have made their choice, everyone turns the voting tiles face up to see who guessed the achievement correctly. If all the players guessed or nobody did (in other words, the explanation was very clear or too complicated), tribesmen get 1 point each and the ambassador has nothing. If the right choice was made only by few natives, they get points according to their stakes and the envoy gains points for the biggest stake of the correct answer.
Ex-presenter takes new cards in exchange for used and hand over the turn.

My Understands You suits for the company of friends and for families as well. The most comfortable gameplay is for the 3-4 players – everyone can be a presenter for enough turns. Still the game can become longer for more player as well: achievement cards can be played for another round. Even if you’ll get the same words, the explanations can be fully different so it will let you discover lots of imagination inside your mind that you didn’t even suspect of.

138168.name: Walt Disney 'Bambi'
138168.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (100)
- moving by turns -
typical 'Roll & Move' game - ending on a marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
cute pewter figures

138169.name: Tony Bath's Ancient Wargaming
138169.description:
From the publisher:
" Tony Bath’s early inspiration was the force that launched ancient wargaming. With his friend Donald Featherstone, he pioneered the first table top ancient battles and the most well-known of all wargaming campaigns, the Legend of Hyboria.In 1965, he founded the Society of Ancients and it's journal Slingshot. This compilation of his work includes: The Peltast and Pila Ancient Wargaming Rules The complete book, Setting up a Wargames Campaign The Legend of Hyboria (including notes on the conclusion of that climactic campaign). Setting up a Wargames Campaign is a complete guide to setting up an ancient and medieval campaign and has chapters on: Map movement,Contact, battles and after effects, Playing with umpires and without, Supplies and replacements, Guidelines on running campaigns in other periods. As Donald Featherstone said, 'a perfect little book' "

138170.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"You can either profit by this...or be destroyed!"
–Luke Skywalker, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

Edge of Darkness is the first deluxe expansion for Star Wars: The Card Game. Its twenty-two new objective sets add 132 total cards that allow players to battle for the fate of the galaxy as either of two new affiliations, the dark side's Scum and Villainy or the light side's Smugglers and Spies.

Both of these affiliations live at the outskirts of Imperial law, and Edge of Darkness draws heavily from the original Star Wars trilogy as it builds themes centered around the remote planet of Tatooine and the independent mining colony of Cloud City. Edge of Darkness allows you to expand your games of Star Wars with Jawas, Tuskens, bounties, captives, and sabotage. You'll also find such notable heroes and villains as Chewbacca, Lando Calrissian, Greedo, Bossk, and Jabba the Hutt, and you’ll be able explore unheralded new events within the expanded Star Wars universe.
138170.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Edge of Darkness
boardgamefamily: Star Wars: The Card Game LCG

138171.name: Terry Wise's Introduction to Battle Gaming including his unpublished wargaming rules
138171.description: Terry Wise was one of the great early wargamers. This book describe how to start wargaming and includes three straightforward sets of rules on Ancient Warfare, Horse and Musket and WWII

138172.name: Paddy Griffith's Napoleonic Wargaming for Fun
138172.description:
From the publisher:"
In the early days of ‘modern’ wargaming, Napoleonic games were tremendously popular. They allowed the new, not necessarily young, wargamer to fight the glorious actions they had heard about in their school history lessons. Often starting with the Battle of Waterloo as their first action, the general would deploy his hastily painted soldiers from Airfix’s Napoleonic range. Airfix offered British and French infantry, as well as cavalry and guns for both sides.

Napoleonic tactics were simple in principle, but were hard to master in practice; for example infantry in a line maximized its firepower, but was vulnerable to cavalry. Changing to a square kept the infantry safe from the cavalry, but made them vulnerable to artillery and reduced their musketry to ¼ of the unit’s strength2. The games, just like the battles of history, were all about combining the efforts of the infantry, cavalry and artillery using ‘combined arms tactics’ to sweep the enemy away. The key problem with these games was the ‘helicopter overview’ of the action the players had of their largely divisional sized games. While representing the battles of the Napoleonic Wars in some ways, they did not recreate experience of the commanders of the time.

Paddy Griffith’s excellent book aimed to fill the gap and offer no less than seven different sets of rules to simulate the experience of command at different levels. Just as the early wargamers took the Airfix Napoleonic’s and converted them for use in a wide range of periods, the ideas offered by Paddy in these rules have equal potential to transform any wargamer’s tabletop experience. I am very pleased for the opportunity to reprint this classic work.

This book contains no less than seven sets of rules:

Skirmish level

Divisional game

Brigade game

Army level game

Generalship game

Map Kriegsspiel

Tactic Exercises Without Troops
"

138173.name: AirFrame
138173.description:
A standalone miniatures wargame of future air superiority from One Pound Wargames, AirFrame allows players to assemble and customize their formation using existing air combat models from their collection. The game focuses on tactical manoeuvre and resource management in the 3-dimensional battlespace. AirFrame can also be combined with MechaWar for combined arms battles.

Each airframe comes with a variable number of stat points depending upon their value. These are allocated by the player across four stats covering speed, firepower, armour and defence. Each airframe performs two manoeuvres a turn, with enemy airframes able to react with responsive manoeuvres.

Damage will degrades your ability to stay in the air, but a critical hit may blow your opponent out of the sky in a single, devastating strike!

Key features:


Miniatures wargame of future aerial combat.
Integrated turn sequence.
Action-based turns.
d12s for shooting.
Customizable statlines.
Fully compatible with MechaWar from One Pound Wargames.
Designed for use with any range of modern or science fiction aircraft, and compatible with scales from 1/805 (2mm) to 1/161 (10mm)

138174.name: RaceRoom Racing Experience
138174.description:
User Summary

A free to play car-racing game that features a focus on skill based driving. Players race cars on set tracks while being connected to a motorsport portal for real and virtual sports.

The game comes with a set amount of content which is available for free. The game also allows players to make micro-transactions to purchase new cars tracks and game modes.

138175.name: Primal Fears
138175.description:
User Summary

Primal Fears is a cooperative overhead shooter, in which you maneuver your character through buildings while fending off hordes of enemies. You can play by yourself or with up to 3 friends, and use 15+ weapons and gadgets to get through the levels.

The story of the game is that due to a chemical leak everything is mutated and trying to kill you, except for you. Your job is to uncover the truth.

138176.name: Conspiracies
138176.description:
Conspiracies is the first installment in the Conspiracies series of full motion video adventure games. Conspiracies was developed by Anima Interactive.

Story
The game is set in the 21st century, where the human population suffers from a number of problems, including overpopulation, poverty, organized crime, and depression. Earth has dissolved into a federation of cities. The game is specifically set in Greece, where each city-state has its own governor and local government. However, this is overshadowed by a coalition of political lobbies, the big companies, the organized crime, that imposes their own reality.

Nick Delios, the protagonist, was originally in the academic world, but left it after being kicked out of his team. He eventually becomes a detective, specializing in cases of industrial espionage. When Thanos Pekas, Police Inspector and an old friend, asks him unofficially to help him solve a murder case of a small time crook, Delios accepts. He soon learns that the case is far more complex than he thought, involving multiple conspiracies.

Source: Wikipedia, "Conspiracies (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138177.name: Conspiracies II: Lethal Networks
138177.description:
User Summary

Conspiracies II: Lethal Networks is the second installment in the Conspiracies series of full motion video adventure games. Conspiracies II: Lethal Networks was developed by Anima Interactive.

Story
At the end of the year 2063, Earth joined the Peripheral Galactic Alliance as an equal member. Now, for the first time, Earth is expecting a significant improvement in its situation. Everybody believes that a new era is beginning: an era of development, prosperity, and closer co-operation with other civilizations that will lead to the eventual solution of the political, economic and social problems of the planet. Nick Delios, ex private eye and now a governmental secret agent, is accused of attempted murder against Annita Argyriou, the President of the powerful Detronics S.A., but someone has framed him. In his effort to find the truth, he will find himself in the middle of multiple conspiracy networks throughout the Peripheral Galactic Alliance, threatening even its own existence.

138178.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 326 - Oct 2002)
rpgissuearticle: "Doc" Stevens and the Warriors of Mongo
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Papyrus, where no game is out of print! #78
This Isn't The Zine You're Looking For #135
When in Doubt, Assume Jay Jay and Mr Pickles are Out to Get You
You might very well think so...
138178.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #326
October 2002

Cover art by Jeremy McHugh.

138179.name: Fuji's World
138179.description:
The objective of Fuji's World is to be the first to obtain the required number of victory points. To obtain vicory points, players try to open branches of Fuji and put a number of products on the market there.
There are four regions where you can open branches. Each region consists of several countries. The aim is to market a complete set of products in a country. A product set consists of photo paper, film rolls, offset plates and R&D.
If you market all the products in a country, your competitors no longer have a chance and you gain a victory point. But until that moment, you can lose your branch at any time!

"Invest and conquer new markets for our Fuji Tilburg products! This is what Fuji's World is all about. This game has been specially developed as a Christmas gift for all personnel and temporary staff at Fuji Tilburg. Not just for them, either: it is also important that those at home feel involved with Fuji. We hope that Fuji's World will provide the basic for many exciting family evenings and perhaps it will lead to new inspiration for achieving our objectives."

138180.description:
SQUAR3 (pronounced "Square") is a small but complex tactical tile laying game for two to four players. The players take turn placing square tiles on a 3x3 grid that forms the game board. Each tile has a point value and will influence all adjacent tiles. The players also place gems on top of these tiles to claim them for the final scoring. Some of the tiles have special actions that the player claiming that tile can use.

SQUAR3 is similar to games like Isis & Osiris or Go as the placement of tiles and player pieces is crucial for scoring the most points. A further depth of play stems from the orientation of each tile, the layering of tiles and the management of the actions available to each player.

Games of SQUAR3 can last for only a couple of turns or up to 30 min and can be quite mind-burning.
138180.name: SQUAR3

138181.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 354 - Feb 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Age not Necessarily a Modifier for Wisdom #1
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Lozen's Adventure in the Folds, Part 4
This is Not the Beginning of a Title... (Legends From Loegres #111)
This Isn't The Zine You're Looking For #163
rpg: Star Trek: The Role Playing Game (FASA)
138181.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #354
February 2005

Cover art by Matt Stevens.

138182.name: Flying Nightmares
138182.description:
From back of game box:

Hold on tight because the flight sim engineers at Domark have pushed the limits of 3DO technology! A state-of-the-art flight and combat simulator, Flying Nightmares will have your heart pounding and palms sweating. This rockin' romp through unfriendly skies delivers the very best in gaming graphics, speed and smoothness. Lightning-fast 3D graphics make full use of the 3DO Interactive Multiplayer system's capabilities. Over 100 objects, vehicles, enemy aircraft and mission objectives, rendered in superb texture-mapped 3D.

138183.name: Shadows Over Sylvania
138183.description:
Publisher blurb:

In Shadows over Sylvania you take on the role of a Vampire thrall of one of the bloodthirsty rulers of the accursed county of Sylvania. Your adventure takes place in the years following Count Vlad von Carstein’s failed attempt to become the first vampire Emperor. There are no Colleges of Magic, Konrad von Carstein is yet to seize control of the realm, and the legendary battles of Grim Moor and Hel Fenn are still in the future.

Throughout the adventure to come, you will be forced to battle numerous enemies who would stand against you, both mortal and Undead. When this occurs, you must fight them using the rules that appear on the following pages. You will also come across weapons and other useful items that may help you progress in your adventure. And then there are the difficult decisions that you will be forced to make which could well have a direct impact on how events play out later in the story.

When you have completed the adventure, you can play it again and again, making different decisions, branching the story in new directions.

Pick up your copy, and begin your battle against the fell fiends of the domain of the dead!

138184.name: Witch Hunter GM Screen
138184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Put the master back into Grand Master. Everything needed for ease of play at your finger tips.

Print this out and apply it to card, or insert into a 3 panel ultimate GM screen

138185.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 323 - Jul 2002)
rpgissuearticle: "Doc" Stevens and the Warriors of Mongo Issue #62
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Papyrus, where no game is out of print! #75
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #132
You might very well think so...
138185.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #323
July 2002

Cover art by Quentin Westcott.

138186.description: Several unique "Activation" and "When Established" abilities didn't make into the final version of the Legacy: Forbidden Machines expansion – but since those cards are still interesting and fun, they're available as the promotional expansion Legacy: Forbidden Machines - Deep Vault and are playable with all other technologies from the Forbidden Machines expansion.
138186.name: Legacy: Forbidden Machines – Deep Vault

138187.description:
Game Wonders is a fan expansion for 7 Wonders. It adds new wonders with a game theme to extend the game play of 7 Wonders and it's expansions 7 Wonders: Leaders and 7 Wonders: Cities.

Play Transylvania and get stronger for every enemy you defeat, Jerusalem that gives you additional Gold and Victory Points for every new leader your neighbors hire, or devote your wonders to the different deities on Olympus.

12 New Cities are available to play with new functionality and powers.
138187.name: Game Wonders (fan expansion for 7 Wonders)

138188.description:
Bad things are going down at Rattlesnake Creek. Decisions taken in the heat of the moment may scar some desperate men for the rest of their wicked lives. When the dust settles, only one side can claim victory. Will it be yours?

Revolver: The Tarnished Star – the fourth in a series of expansions for Revolver – adds an optional "duel" scene at Rattlesnake Creek and an extra decision for the McReady player that may equip the imprisoned Santiago with a hidden weapon. The expansion also adds new cards to the Frontier Deck that was introduced in Revolver Expansion 1.3: Vengeance on the Frontier.

Revolver: The Tarnished Star also includes new cards for both players that give them the opportunity to customize their decks, bringing new variety and replayability to each game.
138188.name: Revolver Expansion 1.4: The Tarnished Star

138189.description:
A whole mess of danger lurks in the wilds: from a deranged masked knifeman, to strange lights in the woods, to a secret valley flush with hazards - both lawman and bandit alike will need their wits about them to survive!

Combine this expansion with the base game and build your own deck by adding new cards to the pre-constructed decks, and explore new tactics and define your own play style!

This expansion develops all the existing decks, from which both players may draw unique cards - giving your games more replayability and adventure.

Revolver: Death Rides a Horse also includes new cards for both players that give them the opportunity to customize their decks, bringing new variety and replayability to each game.
138189.name: Revolver Expansion 1.5: Death Rides a Horse

138191.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 38 - Feb 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: A Life Less Ordinary
Doing It My Way: Anagathics: Doping the Inevitable
Doing It My Way: Life Support
In A Store Near You: Helot Grav Police Wagon
In A Store Near You: MPV: Band Wagon
In A Store Near You: The Hidden Present
Raconteurs’ Rest: Drop Out, Part Twenty One
Up Close and Personal: Henri Gaudette
138191.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #038: February 2013

Cover: L. E. Spry

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

138194.name: Undead Escape
138194.description:
Undead Escape is a cooperative styled map building game designed for 2 to 5 players. In Undead Escape, one player plays as the human character, whose goal is to set enough fires to burn the zombie's factory to the ground. The remaining players will play as zombies doing everything they can to thwart the human player.

The game is built using pieces of the factory floor, which includes 16 movement spaces and locations for items. Items are placed face down and must be discovered by the players and stored in inventory and eventually used or destroyed depending on their player type.

Zombies will attempt to find newspapers and throw them into one of two water barrels randomly placed on the map. The human player attempts to find pieces needed to make fires, such as newspaper and matches, or a molotov cocktail. When the human player has enough items to start a fire, he must get to one of the fire locations on the map and light it.

To make things even more difficult for the human player, the zombies may also stash other items in their inventory, in which the player can only get back by attacking and winning a battle.

138195.description:
Metro City is redeveloping an old industrial district for mixed use (residential, commercial and industrial) and the mayor is offering bonuses to two developers for aesthetic completion of key streets. Can you win greater bonuses than your competitor by strategically building homes, offices, stores, courthouses, parks and malls in ways that upset your opponent’s plans for the city?

The city district is a 6 x 5 grid with 11 named streets. Each street has a mayor's bonus associated with it, from $1 to $15, drawn randomly at the start of the game. Players try to develop each street better than their opponent to claim its bonus.

Each player keeps a hand of 5 Building tiles out of 20 available to them. When placing a tile on an empty city block, if the tile completes a street (a row or column) they compare the value of their Buildings on the street to their opponent's Buildings to determine who wins the bonus. A straightforward comparison simply involves adding the number of each tile: Residential Buildings count from 1 to 5, Commercial Buildings count from 2 to 6 and Industrial Buildings count from 3 to 7. However, four types of special tiles change how the bonus is determined: a Park or Mall prevents either player's Industrial Buildings from counting towards the bonus on a street; a Power Plant or Mall prevents Residential Buildings from counting towards the bonus. Finally, the Courthouse allows the player to switch the bonuses of two streets.

Instead of placing a tile on an empty block, a player can discard a Currency token and build over a block they have already developed.

Whoever has the most money wins, and earns a key to the city from the mayor!
138195.name: City Blocks

138196.name: Babes in the wood
138196.description:
Objective: players striving to be the first to reach center and back out again.
- moving by turns -
each player moves according spinner, starting from a pink corner space; each player attempts to move towards the center space - called 'Heart of the Woods'. Red spaces on the board must be reached by exact spin in order to move in (later out) of the circle; once reaching the centre, players then turn around and move back out to any of the (pink) starting spaces.
remarks:
should be published ~ 1900

138198.name: Road Wolf
138198.description:
Road Wolf is a free, home made, tabletop, turn based game of highway combat. Players choose vehicles, crew, and components and engage each other in high-speed scenarios on the road.

Physical components include a road (easy to make your own), vehicles (modified Matchbox or Hot Wheels cars work fine), dice, measuring sticks, record sheets for vehicles, and counters for crew and equipment (downloadable for free).

Players choose a scenario and purchase vehicles as described by the scenario. Most scenarios pit one player (or team of players) against another, with different win conditions depending on the scenario.

Unlike many vehicle games that rely on arena combat, Road Wolf follows vehicles traveling down a long, dangerous road. Movement is relative to the other vehicles, as all vehicles are assumed to be hurtling forward down the road, represented by a "road" move at the end of each turn. Hazards such as bridges or debris can move "towards" the vehicles during the road move, as can immobilized vehicles.

Each turn, vehicles get two actions to spend moving, shooting, or other actions. Vehicles may Ram or Melee each other as part of a move action, encouraging close combat. Degrees of success can damage or destroy vehicles or crew, or cause wipeout checks that can lead to lost ground or even chain reaction crashes.

138199.name: Mico
138199.description:
This game is played with 2 or more players, and 1 or more standard decks of cards.

After shuffling the cards, one card must be hidden. Then each player receives 9 cards, and the remaining cards forms the stack. Each player must try to make combinations of 3 cards, either 3 of the same number, or 3 cards in sequence. The combinations must be discarded. After make all possible combinations with the cards in hand, the players must take cards of the stack in order to make new combinations. All players can play simultaneously; there is no order of play.

When the stack run out of cards, the players, starting with the dealer and continuing in clockwise order, take cards of the player to the right (without see the cards of the player).

At the end, one player will remain with the last card in hand, and this card must be the same of the card hidden at the start (if not, somebody have make a mistake). This player is the winner.

138200.name: Court/Ship (KS Playtest Draft)
138200.description:
From the Kickstarter description:

The court of Louis the XV of France was a weird place. He had a place called a "Deer Park" where he kept a stable of young mistresses, he kept his court in the cramped and weird living situation of his palace, and from all reports lived a crazy and decadent lifestyle. Women would come to court to become his mistress to gain a title and lands. This was also the time of the "gentlemen scientist" when there was growing interest in science and technology, as well as new systems of government. Into this environment... an alien invasion begins. This Fate Core expansion by J.R. Blackwell will explore themes of identity, hierarchy, and what it means to be human.

user comment
This is the backers-only preview draft of Court/Ship

138201.description:
Gods and Goddesses are mercurial beings, given to jealousy and treachery, but they can also possess compassion and valor.

Who among the pantheon can win enough glory among their believers, so that their story of mythic victory can be passed down through the generations?

They Who Were 8 is a game for 2-4 players where each player serves two Gods, seeking to praise them for their Glory, and trying to avoid stories of their Infamy.

The game can be played in two different ways:

• Titanomachy:
A game for 2-4 players trying to achieve an individual victory.

• Pantheon:
A partnership game for 4 players, played in two teams of 2.

In both of these games, the players take actions that represent a bard’s retelling of the ancient story of They Who Were 8. They may also call upon the powers of their Gods to control the narrative and establish their version of the saga as the one told for eternity.

Note: They Who Were 8 was inspired by a cycle of poems by Todd Sanders written in 1999. The poems are fragments of a larger ancient saga, lost to time.
138201.name: They Who Were 8
boardgamepodcastepisode: #31: Terraforming Mars review & on-tap; Dan, Live from Essen; Great American Beer Festival 2016
RDTN Episode 114: They Who Were 8, Rum & Bones Second Tides, & Fuzzy Tales

138202.name: Khaki in Flames
138202.description:
Khaki in Flames introduces a whole slew of new units to World in Flames, such as NKVD divisions, flak, coastal fortifications, shipyards, home guards, garrison divisions, border troops, the Red Sea Flotilla and more. Khaki in Flames also upgrades all Commonwealth units from WIF and all previous expansions on an easy-to-read khaki background, and gives players territorials and Chinese warlords in new colors for when these units "switch sides".

Contents
• 1200 full color counters
• Rules for over a dozen new types of land, air, and naval units
• One WIF Combat Chart

138203.name: Mahjongg Dimensions
138203.description:
It’s Arkadium's hit 3D Mahjongg game! Check out this classic matching game with a big twist. Just when you think you're stuck, you can rotate the cube to reveal more matches to clear! Click and match any tile that has two adjacent sides free. To rotate, use the arrows on screen or on your keyboard.

Source: The Developer Website.

138204.name: Planet Run
138204.description:
You are Captain Xavier Mertz pilot of the ship Yamato. One day while cruising, your ship was hit by asteroids and you landed on Planet Run. You need to find the resources to fix your ship while trying to survive from dying of hunger!

Planet Run is a solo worker placement game where you become an astronaut exploring the planet to find resources to fix your ship. You need to survive by hunting for food. Food you eat will determine how many energy dice you will get on the next turn. You may construct gadgets to help you in your task. On turn 15, you must launch your ship!

138205.name: Skirmish Tactics Apocalypse
138205.description:
CONTROL A FACTION
DESTROY YOUR ENEMIES
EMERGE VICTORIOUS

Skirmish Tactics Apocalypse (STA) is a two player dice-based skirmish-level tabletop game set in a post-apocalyptic near future.

There are two ways to play STA: skirmishes and campaigns. Skirmishes are standalone games played for a single victory, with no lasting repercussions. Campaigns are a series of skirmishes. In campaigns, players begin with a squad of recruit characters.

The game board for STA is built from modular tiles which are themed to represent different environments. The default game board is a destroyed urban setting. Players build the game board with nine modular tiles, each of which are divided into a 7x7 grid. Characters use the grids for movement.

STA is a scenario driven game. Each scenario typically has multiple objectives, and combat between factions is usually a secondary or tertiary objective. Players win skirmishes in STA by gaining victory points through accomplishing these objectives.

Each character in STA is represented by a token and has a corresponding character card. During campaign play, characters improve their attributes and develop new abilities as they progress from Recruit to Veteran and then Elite status.

Players control characters from one of the game’s six factions. The Combine and Marauders are part of the core game; the other four factions can be integrated seamlessly.


Combine: The Combine is the military arm of the government that rules over much of what is left of the world.



Echo: Echo is a faction lead by a secretive cabal of humans with psychic powers.



Erthen: Erthen are a biologically developed race formed from a mixture of human, mineral, and organic matter.



Marauders: The Marauders are a loose-knit band of human rebels who specialize in guerrilla warfare.



Order of the New Dawn: The Order of the New Dawn are creatures from the strange subterranean realm known as the Basement.



Soldiers of Light: The Soldiers of Light are humans who believe the fall of mankind was brought about due to a dependance on technology.

138206.description:
How Many Feet? is a two-player micro-deduction game in which players hold four cards "backwards" — that is, facing the other player, as in Hanabi — and take turns asking questions about the numbers visible at the top of their cards. Possible actions in the game are:


Guess a number for any two cards in your hand. Your opponent answers more/less/exact number.
Once per game, you can rotate a card in your opponent's hand to change the number value.
Guess the sequence of numbers on the cards in your hand; guess correctly, and you win.


How Many Feet? was given away with a Office 21 crowdfunding project and might also be available at conventions and events.
138206.name: How Many?

138207.name: Mr. Toad's Journey
138207.description:
A Goose-type game for pre-5 year olds. The game appeared in the 1978 Playhour Annual. Mr. Toad was a character who first featured in Kenneth Grahame's The Wind in the Willows, written in 1908.

Rules
To play this game with your friends, you will need a dice and counters. To start playing the game, each player has to throw a six, and then throw the dice again and move his counter along the numbered spaces. On the white spaces there are things you must do if you land on them. The player who reaches number 50 first, is the winner.

138208.name: Baby Doll's Game
138208.description:
Baby Doll was a comic strip character in Playhour, a favourite comic for the 5's and under. It is a typical Goose-type game and is taken from the 1978 Playhour Annual.

Rules
You need a dice and counters to play this game with your friends. Baby Doll wants to get to the doll's house. But to get there, she has to go along a path of stepping stones. You and your friends can have a race to see who gets to the house first. Throw a six to start, then throw the dice again and move your counter along the numbered stepping stones the dice shows. On the grey stepping stones there are things you must do if your counter lands on them. The one who reaches the house first, wins.

138210.description: Saga: Northern Fury is the first supplement to Gripping Beast's Dark Ages miniatures skirmish game "Saga". The 22 page full color supplement comes with four additional card Battle Boards - The Anglo-Saxon, The Breton, The Jomsvikings, and The Scots.
138210.name: Saga: Northern Fury
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 85 - Saga & Northern Fury
Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 87 - More about Saga, Northern Fury and Skraelings

boardgamehonor: 2013 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Supplement Nominee
138211.description: Saga: The Raven's Shadow is the second supplement to Gripping Beast's Dark Ages miniatures skirmish game "Saga". The 28 page full color supplement comes with four additional card Battle Boards - The Franks, The Irish, The Norse Gael, and The Strathclyde Welsh.
138211.name: Saga: The Raven's Shadow
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 95 - Saga, Dreadball, Judge Dredd, X-Wing & W40K
Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 98 - Dystopian Legions & Saga: Raven's Shadow

138212.name: The Talisman of Gorshan
138212.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Talisman of Gorshan is a FREE browser-based adventure for d20/v3.5 and includes a dice generator and links to the d20 System Reference Documents. Play from any internet connection. No need for dice or books.

An adventure for 4-5 characters level 8-10

In The Talisman of Gorshan the adventurers will seek out and return the 3 fragments of a powerful artifact once held by the mage, Gorshan. The talisman was broken by an orc’s blow in the battle for Broadarrow Crossing years ago, and the fragments carried away by the horde.

Gorshan has managed to locate the fragments through remote viewing and needs the party to retrieve them. The adventure will take them to the high mountain nests of the Dragonhawks to the chilling grounds of Rakor’s Tomb and the desolate fields of the Forsaken Farms. These locations are all found in a small wilderness region known as Danarr.

The adventure begins in Helmwood, a trading hub and home of a burgeoning lumber industry in the southern area of Danarr. The mage Gorshan has traveled here in order to be nearer to the last fragment to decipher its exact location. The party will be staying in Helmwood at the Dizzy Dryad Inn when they are approached by Gorshan’s men.

138213.name: Formula 1
138213.description:
Ronnie Peterson (1944–1978) was a Swedish racing driver known by the nickname 'Super Swede'. He was a two-time runner-up in the FIA Formula One World Drivers' Championship. (Source: Wikipedia)

The 1974 edition of the game has Ronnie in his Lotus 72 with the number 1 on the front cover. The 1977 edition has him in his six wheel Tyrrell P34 on the front cover. (Source: http://www.ronniepeterson.se/subc/eng/p.html)

This game is different from other versions of Formula 1 because it has "Chans"(Eng: Opportunity) and "Depå"(Eng: Pit) cards, and rather than a dashboard with a speedometer, tire and brake wear gauges, the player boards are gear boxes used to indicate what gear/speed the car is in as well as indicators for "Slitage"(Eng: Damage) and laps. The course is also different than other Formula 1 games.

138214.name: Fools!
138214.description:
You play the part of a Fairy Lord, commanding one of the four armies of Fairy in an epic tournament.

For each tournament, four humans are 'invited' to join by the fairy lords. Often kidnapped or unwittingly stumbling into the Fairy land, these humans exemplify the fairy's love of fools and foolish people.

You can use your powers to change the outcome of each battle, but be wary! The nobility of Fairy are very honorable in nature and won’t stand for such trickery! And watch out for the fools! They can ruin your whole battle.

Fools! is a simple card game, with one deck of 64 cards. Each player draws a small 'army' of 3 face down cards and a hand of three cards. The army cards represent those fairies who will distinguish themselves in battle. Your hand represents fairies and fools you can use to hinder your opponents or strengthen your own army.

Cards can be played as Standard Bearers, some with special effects. Players are then required to replace a card in their opponent's army with one from their hand. They may then replace a card in their own army with one from their hand. Through this all, their army cards remain hidden from everyone.

At the end of each turn, your hand is discarded and your army cards (actually those who've distinguished themselves in this round of battle) are revealed. Points are added up and the highest score wins the turn.

2 player games play to 5 points, 3 players to 4 points and 4 players to three points.

This light card game is meant to fill the same roll as Zombie Dice - a fast, light and portable game to be played anywhere. Also great with kids.

138215.name: Ecolibrium
138215.description:
Ecolibrium is an imaginative real-time eco-system simulator where the aim is to maintain harmony within your own created environment. You need to select creatures, plants and artefacts to create a balanced eco-system. If your eco-system is not balanced, you can feed your animals manually or exile unwanted animals into the wilderness using Vita’s near feature for others to pick up for their respective eco-system.

Grow your world by hunting fantastical creatures from the environment around you using GPS or, if you prefer, you can sell or buy them in the online player-to-player auctions. It’s all in aid of giving your eco-system the perfect harmony, so don’t be shy! And if you’re competitive, try online challenges and climb up the global leaderboards.

Source: The Publisher Website.

138217.name: Police City
138217.description:
You play as a young officer whose ambitious goal is to become the leader of the NYPD. Thanks to your staff and the support of your colleagues, you will stop gangsters, regain control of neighborhoods, traffic capture, in brief all which will allow you to be promoted and to fill the quotas of the mayor of the city.

City Police is based on a mechanism of simultaneous placements: each turn, you send your staff (inspectors, sergeants, lieutenants ...) on the site of the city by conducting joint actions with other players. The hardest part will not necessarily stop the gangsters, but you agree you later for the distribution of benefits of each intervention.

Thus, at every moment of the game, you will make the right decisions and advance good arguments in a very short time. Negotiation and reactivity are your main weapons. But beware: if you and your colleagues will too shoot in the legs, it will be the Mafia who eventually win the game.

City Police is a fun and relaxed which makes great negotiation and role-play. Unlike Gangs City, you need to know to make decisions very quickly, on the stroke of the pulse. It will show you reagents both intellectually and physically, since the investments are trades like an hourglass time of 30 seconds. Thus, the parties are very lively and rhythmic.

So, all the time of the game(set,play), you will have to make the good decisions and to move forward the good arguments in a short time. Negotiation and reactivity will be your main weapons. But pay attention: if you and your colleagues if you do not hear enough, it will be the Mafia who eventually win the game.

City police is a funny and relaxed game which leaves the beautiful part in the negotiation and in the role-play. You will have to know how to make decisions very quickly, at the time impulse. It will be necessary to show you reactive at the same time intellectually and physically, because placements and negotiation are made the time of an hourglass of 30 seconds. Thus, the parties are very lively and rhythmic.

138219.name: MindTrap Geometrical Riddles: Master Level
138219.description: Travel size MindTrap card pack what focused less on the storytelling mysteries and riddles like the classic game and more on pattern recognition, logic problems and well, geometric riddles.

138220.name: MindTrap Geometrical Riddles: Genius Level
138220.description: Travel size MindTrap card pack what focused less on the storytelling mysteries and riddles like the classic game and more on pattern recognition, logic problems and well, geometric riddles.

138221.name: MindTrap Geometrical Riddles: Novice Level
138221.description: Travel size MindTrap card pack what focused less on the storytelling mysteries and riddles like the classic game and more on pattern recognition, logic problems and well, geometric riddles.

138222.name: MindTrap Shadow Mysteries
138222.description: This Travel size MindTrap card pack focuses on various types of lateral thinking like murder mysteries and trick questions.

138223.name: MindTrap Left Brain Right Brain
138223.description: This Travel size MindTrap card pack focuses on various types of lateral thinking. In Left Brain Right Brain you will find yourself challenging the brain as a whole with your artistic, visual side, as well as the logical left brain.

138224.name: MindTrap Brain Cramp
138224.description: This Travel size MindTrap card pack focuses on various types of lateral thinking. Brain Cramp includes challenging Rebus puzzles and conundrums that leave you with a good kind of headache; this game proves a good headache exists!

138225.name: Von Kontinent zu Kontinent
138225.description:
Objective: earn as much money as possible carrying goods with your ship all over the world - game ends after 50 rounds
- acting/moving by turns -
each player buys goods (max 2 - only one per kind of goods) at your starting port; roll the die and move forward; ending at a port you may sell goods (up to your choice) and may buy (whats available - if there is space enough) at the current rate;
if the marker - after each player has finished her/his turn - is moved forward ending on a red space draw as many 'chance cards' as ships are in a port; before next turn all changes have to be executed.
Starting round 50 each player has to move her/his ship to the next port.

138226.name: What Bird Am I?
138226.description:
The object of the game is to identify the bird species in as few clues as possible in order to win the most points for that card. With a point scale of one to five, a player can earn the most points by identifying the bird in just one clue. If it takes a player five clues before identifying the bird, then one point is awarded. A beautiful photo of the bird is on one side of the card for all to see, after the bird has been identified, or if all the clues have been given.

Player with the most points is the winner.

138227.name: Move 'n Flip
138227.description:
MOVE 'N FLIP is a 2 player Strategy game played on a 8x8 Chess Board.

Each player has 12 pieces which are double sided – with different directions of movement on each side. At the end of each move the piece is ‘flipped’ to the other side giving different directions for the next move.

Movement is similar to DRAUGHTS/CHECKERS i.e. either a single move or a jumping move over one or more of your own AND/OR your opponents’ pieces. Any opponents pieces jumped over are captured and removed from the board.

The sole survivor is the winner!

138228.name: Monster Truck Rally
138228.description:
From Designer's Web Site

Welcome to the world of Monster Truck Rally! You are the driver of a monster truck, bent on the destruction of the smaller cars. Will you race to the finish in the races, or will you smash the course in the freestyle course?

Monster Truck Rally will have three different types of game play,you will have Racing, Free Style Stunt events, and a 12 part Campaign game using both racing and free style.

Winning Conditions:
The winning conditions depend upon which style of game play is used. If you only use the racing aspect of the game, then it is the fastest truck. If you use the freestyle aspect then it is the truck with the highest point total. However if you use the campaign game the winner is the truck with the most points (money) after all 12 events.

138229.name: Crazy Taxi: Fare Wars
138229.description:
Crazy Taxi: Fare Wars (known as: Crazy Taxi: Double Punch in Japan), is a PSP game, which is a port of both Crazy Taxi and Crazy Taxi 2. There is also a multiplayer aspect which was not available in the games' predecessors, where players compete against one another for customers and fare money. The game was developed by newly created Sniper Studios.

Gameplay

Crazy Taxi: Fare Wars combines both Crazy Taxi and Crazy Taxi 2 with new features that allow players to interact with their opponents in brand new ways unseen on other systems. Giving players the ability to play wirelessly with other PSP systems nearby through Ad-Hoc or game sharing. Players can ram their opponent's cab to steal their fare or use the new interference feature to make them crash or slow down their fare delivery time.

Crazy Taxi: Fare Wars gives users the ability to record about 80 seconds of gameplay footage and then transfer it to a computer for media uses. Another feature unseen in previous Crazy Taxi games is the ability to play any MP3 files stores on a memory stick, in the game. Almost all of the sound effects have been re-recorded and are completely different than older versions of Crazy Taxi.

Differences

The original game's soundtracks contained songs by the bands Bad Religion and The Offspring has been removed, as well as many of the real-world stores in game, due to licensing issues, though many retain the iconic designs of copyrighted stores (eg. Pizza Parlor using Pizza Hut's iconic "Red Roof" prior to 1999). However, the game allows custom soundtracks; MP3 files stored on the memory stick can be played in-game.

Other differences include the afforementioned multiplayer via Ad-Hoc wireless, and game sharing, using only one copy of the game, and the ability to record your game footage; about 80 seconds of game footage is recordable and transferable.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crazy Taxi: Fare Wars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138230.name: Sherwood: The Legend of Robin Hood (d20 Edition)
138230.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Sherwood Forest, a place of myth and legend. In this exciting campaign setting written by the master writer, Wil Upchurch, you will find everything you need for your Robin Hood d20 campaign setting. This book contains:

Weapons of the Robin Hood period
New Classes that define the legends
Gazetteer covering Robin Hood's England
Summary information about the Robin Hood legends
Character information on all the Robin Hood mythological characters

138231.name: Dave Arneson's Blackmoor
138231.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over 30 years ago, Dave Arneson created the world that spawned a generation of role playing fans! This core campaign setting is 240 pages and features a full color pull out map of Blackmoor! Features Newly Revised and additional materials from the previous hardback edition!', ' The First Fantasy Campaign. Thirty years ago, the worlds first fantasy campaign began. Now its back! Enter Dave Arnesons Blackmoor, a brooding world of dragons, dungeons, and danger. After thirty years of development, Blackmoor is ready for your adventures.

138232.name: Irrvägar
138232.description:
User summary

A tile-laying game for 2 players. The game consists of square tiles with blue and red stripes on them. Players take turns placing the tiles so that they match, and the goal of the game is to get, in your colour, a stripe loof that covers 5 or more tiles.

138233.description:
Ascension: Rise of Vigil is a deck-building game in which players acquire cards from a central pool, then place those cards in their discard pile to be shuffled into their deck for later use; creatures also show up in that shared card pool, and players can combat them to earn victory points (VPs) and possibly other benefits, such as the ability to remove less useful cards from their deck or to banish cards from the pool that others might find useful. The game ends once all the available VPs have been claimed or the shared deck of cards runs out.

Ascension: Rise of Vigil, part of the Ascension deck-building game series, is both a standalone game for 2-4 players and an expansion that can be combined with any other Ascension game to support up to six players.

Rise of Vigil introduces treasure cards to the game system, with all treasure cards in this set being "Energy Shard". When a treasure card is drawn from the shared deck, you place it in the empty space in the shared pool, then continue to draw until you reveal a hero, monster or construct to cover the treasure. When you acquire or defeat that top card, you also gain the treasure, which is added to your deck like hero and construct cards. When you play a treasure from your hand, you immediately draw another card from your deck; more importantly, you can use the energy on these cards to activate special powers on certain heroes, constructs and monsters. (Non-treasure cards can also provide energy, but they are usually worth VPs whereas treasure is worthless aside from the energy.) Energy available on a turn can be "spent" more than once, so if you have, say, two energy, then you can power up all cards with an Energize cost of two or less.

Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Big Bad Bunny Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Constricting Horror Promo

138234.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 358 - Jun 2005)
138234.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #358
June 2005

Cover art by Matt Stevens.

videogame: Combo Pack: Sonic Advance + Sonic Pinball Party
138235.name: Sonic Pinball Party
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
videogamecompilation: Combo Pack: Sonic Advance + Sonic Pinball Party
138235.description:
Sonic Pinball Party is a video game released for Game Boy Advance in 2003. It is a celebration of sorts for Sonic Team featuring many references to its previous games, mostly Sonic.

Story

The story is set in Casinopolis (in Station Square), where Doctor Eggman turns the people gambling into robots, and brainwashes Miles "Tails" Prower and Amy Rose. Sonic must rescue his friends by winning a pinball tournament called the "Egg Cup Tournament."

Boards

The game features three Pinball tables, based respectively on Sonic Advance, the Sega Saturn classic Nights into Dreams..., and the Dreamcast/arcade game Samba de Amigo.

The player must defeat Eggman to move to the next area in the Sonic board. The player moves to the next area when they collect all the Ideya and defeat the Nightmaren in the NiGHTS board. The Samba De Amigo Board never changes, as there are no real objectives except for getting a high score.

In the Sonic board, shooting the ball into a hidden hole three times changes the character shown on the table from Sonic, through Tails, Knuckles, Amy and back to Sonic.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Pinball Party", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138236.name: Combo Pack: Sonic Advance + Sonic Pinball Party
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
138236.description:
User Summary

Combo Pack: Sonic Advance + Sonic Pinball Party is compilation of two GBA games on one cartridge; Sonic Advance and Sonic Pinball Party.

138237.name: Erie
138237.description:
FEAR IS EVERYWHERE

Erie drops you into a visually stunning, yet terrifying scenario where your goals are to investigate, survive, and finally escape.

Source: The Game Website.

138238.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 290 - Oct 1999)
rpgissuearticle: At the Sign of the Salient Hurcheon #290
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
ISO The Real World Volume II/Issue 1
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #99
rpg: Star Trek:  The Original Series Roleplaying Game
138238.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #290
October 1999

Cover art by Quentin Westcott.

138239.name: Blockers! 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel
138239.description:
From Spiel 2011, a sample version of Blockers!, packaged with Zatre 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel.

This version plays 2-3, unlike the full-size version, which plays 2-5. The grid is 5x5, rather than the 9x9 of the regular version.

It uses one game board and 48 cardboard tokens:

A, B, C, D, E, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, Club, Moon, Diamond, Circle, Star, and Blockers in red, yellow, and blue.

The goal is to have the fewest number of groups of tiles on the board at the end of the game.

The players take turns placing one of their tiles on the grid and then draw another tile to replace it. There are three tiles which each player can place on each space: a letter (rows), a number (columns), or the shape on the space of the board (five areas; the corners plus diamonds form a cross in the center).

If another player has placed a tile it may be captured by playing a legal tile in its place, only if removing the tile doesn't break a group of tiles belonging to the player into more than one group. If players tie for the fewest number of groups at the end of the game, then the winner is the one who captured the fewest opponents' tiles.

138240.name: Zatre 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel
138240.description:
From Spiel 2011, a sample version of Zatre, packaged with Blockers! 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel.

This version uses 25 cardboard tokens (five 1-pip, and four each of 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6) versus the 121 tokens of the regular version.

Zatre is short for Zahlen & Treppen, numbers and steps. Players alternately draw and place tiles on the board extending the pattern already laid. When you make a vertical or horizontal line that totals 10, 11 or 12 (12 is the limit), you score 1, 2 or 4 points accordingly.

Simple and quick, but surprisingly challenging when you get the idea. The idea being that you must keep an even, balanced score pad, scoring 10s and 11s, not just successive 12s. Easy to pick up, but it requires some effort to score well; spotting those opportunities to place one tile which scores each way, making sure you keep clocking up 10s, to turn into 11s or 12s.

138241.name: Silhouette Mirage
138241.description:
User Summary

A 2D sidescrolling action game, Silhouette Mirage features a dualistic gameplay element, which developer Treasure would later revisit in Ikaruga. Enemies are aligned with one of two aspects; Silhouette and Mirage (essentially, blue and red). The heroine, Shyna Nera Shyna, possesses both of these aspects, one on her left side, and the other on her right side. Therefore, you adjust your active alignment by facing left or right. Like Ikaruga, attacking enemies with the opposite alignment does extra damage.

138242.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 4 - Sep 2010)
rpgissuearticle: The Inn of the Last Rose
138242.description:
Lapsus Calumni #04 – The Inn of the Last Rose

Editorial description:
An inn for all needs.

I have a reputation among my older friends for using inns and taverns probably a tad too much, they are quite cliche I will admit, but I feel that is part of the fun. I have heard of many a game where the players went from adventure to adventure without so much of a moment of down time. In my past games I have found this down time is perfect for players to expand their character's ...for lack of a better term... character. Introduce allies and enemies, those damn town guards and the mayor¡ s beautiful daughter, or better yet his too pretty wife with a wandering eye, were sure to come up and cause nothing but trouble for our brave heroe

I hope you are able to throw this little inn somewhere in a campaign of yours and let your players experience the magic that a non-dungeon romp can bring. Sometimes just having character sit around and shoot the breeze can be very rewarding. Until next time!

138243.name: Omen: A Reign of War – Echoes of Myth
boardgameversion: English First Edition for Omen 1st Edition
English First Edition for Omen 2nd Edition
138243.description:
The fires of war have begun to smolder, and it's clear that an end to the Reign of War is in sight.

Echoes of Myth, the final planned expansion for Omen: A Reign of War, introduces twelve brand new units, including an all new unit type: Spirits. When a Spirit enters a City, it has two different abilities, and you choose which one you will use. However, you have the option of paying the Spirit's cost, plus a little extra, and discarding it from your hand to use both abilities.

138244.name: Frog Fractions
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2013 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
138244.description:
User Summary

Frog Fractions is a game in which you, Mr. Hop, must protect your fruit from pesky bugs by eating them. But you daren't stop there. The influx of bugs is so great that you eventually have to track it to its source!

Also, there are some fractions involved.

What Frog Fractions really is is a farcical game that plays with conventions and expectations in the name of humor. It starts out with a simple layout in which you gobble up bugs to protect your fruit, but, through a series of upgrades (among other things) you quickly move into unexpected and surprising territory.

138245.name: Unser Blumenspiel
138245.description:
Objective: be the first gaining 12 red meeples, placed onto your board
- moving by turns -
place your flower board in front of you and move forward according die roll:
ending on
an arrow => roll die again
a blank space => miss one turn
a space with white dots => take as many red meeples as dots you stand on and place them on the board
a space with black dots => remove as many red meeples as dots you stand on
content: 4 flower boards, 4 blue & 48 red meeples

138246.name: CarTag Scavenger Hunt
138246.description:
Designed to be played by up to four people on a road trip, where players are searching for different items outside the car. Items inside the car cannot be used. The driver may have to referee, but should not try to play – be safe and keep your eyes on the road!

Each player needs a game book and a pencil.
All players are racing to spot the same items. When you spot an item - call it out and make sure you have a witness to your find. Whoever spots an item first checks it off - while
everyone else must keep looking for the next occurrence of that item.

Player who gets 3 (or 4) items first is the winner of the round and he gets the sticker to their book. Once a winner is declared, move on to the next round.

Player with the most stickers at the end of the game is the winner.

138247.name: CarTag Lincence Plate Poker
138247.description:
Designed to be played by up to four people on a road trip, Players search for combinations of letters and numbers on license plates to make a winning hand. The driver may have to referee, but should not try to play – be safe and keep your eyes on the road!

Each player needs a game book and a pencil.
A license plate is dealt when your vehicle either passes - or is passed - by a vehicle in the next lane.
Once everyone has finished collecting their license
plates, it’s time for each player to figure out their best hand to check their boxes on their book.

Player who has the most boxes checked get the sticker on his book.

Player with the most stickers at the end of the game is the winner.

138248.name: CarTag Letters and Numbers
138248.description:
Designed to be played by up to four people on a road trip, CarTag Letters & Numbers has players searching for letters, numbers, and words on passing signage and vehicles (including license plates). Items inside the car cannot be used. The driver may have to referee, but should not try to play – be safe and keep your eyes on the road!

Each player needs a game book and a pencil.
All players are racing to spot the same items. When you spot an item - call it out and make sure you have a witness to your find. Whoever spots an item first checks it off - while
everyone else must keep looking for the next occurrence of that item.

Player who gets 3 (or 4) items first is the winner of the round and he gets the sticker to their book. Once a winner is declared, move on to the next round.

Player with the most stickers at the end of the game is the winner.

138249.name: Upsala-Sviten
138249.description:
user summary

A system-agnostic, loosely connected adventure trilogy, in the literary style of H.P. Lovecraft.

The scenario is set in the city of Uppsala, at the turn of the century 1900. The events in each of the adventures turn into Lovecraftian nightmare.

Language: Swedish.

Part I: Mörkret Mellan Stjärnorna (The Darkness Between the Stars)
Part II: Ur Afgrunden (Out of the Abyss)
Part III: I Skuggorna (In the Shadows)

138250.name: Upsala-Sviten: Handouts & Characters
138250.description: Characters and handouts for the adventures "Mörkret Mellan Stjärnorna" (The Darkness Between the Stars), "Ur Afgrunden" (Out of the Abyss) and "I Skuggorna" (In the Shadows).

138251.name: Keeper's Guide to the Secret War
rpghonor: 2014 ENnie for Best Art, Cover - Nominee
2014 ENnie for Best Writing - Silver Winner
2014 ENnie for Product of the Year - Nominee
2014 UK Games Expo Best Role-playing Game Winner
138251.description:
From the back cover

Discover the secret history of World War Two: stories of amazing heroism, in which stalwart men and women struggle to overthrow a nightmare alliance of steel and the occult; of frightening inhuman conspiracies from the depths of time; of the unbelievable war machines which are the product of Nazi engineering genius - and how close we all are to a slithering end! The Secret War has begun!

The Keeper's Guide To The Secret War is a full-blown tome of dark knowledge, including:

allied and Nazi forces and intelligence agencies
occult organisations and mythos-based missions
new tomes, secret weapons, artefacts & equipment
key characters and vile creatures
new rules and strategies for World War Two combat and survival




In fact - there is a whole shoggoth's worth of Cthulhu villainy, enough for any keeper to have his investigators dead, insane or running for their lives in no time!

138252.name: Investigator's Guide to the Secret War
138252.description:
From the back cover:

Discover the secret history of World War Two: stories of amazing heroism, in which stalwart men and women struggle to overthrow a nightmare alliance of steel and the occult; of frightening inhuman conspiracies from the depths of time; of the unbelievable war machines which are the product of Nazi engineering genius - and how close we all are to a slithering end! The Secret War has begun!

Inside you'll find a whole kit-bag stuffed with:

new occupations, skills, equipment, and backgrounds from across Europe, the British Commonwealth, and the United States
how you can keep the home fires burning, become part of the allied war effort, or risk everything by joining the partisans to bring down the Reich from within
what life was like serving with the various military forces and on the home front
an array of historical and fictional material to help you create exciting player characters and NPCs
a background generator, designed to help you find out what dark secrets your past contains...

138253.name: Space Dogsbody
138253.description:
Space Dogsbody is a quirky game of space exploration, resource collection, and reputation management. The players fly around space mining asteroids, fulfilling menial missions, ferrying tourists, dodging pirates and upgrading their ships, trying to make a name for themselves and some quick cash!

40% of the board starts off face-down, and players will have to explore these tiles by flying onto them, hoping to find sources of valuable minerals or lost space stations offering powerful upgrades.

There are also tourists who will pay to be carried around space, as long as the players have a Spare Bed for the tourist to sleep on in the cargo bay. Upgrades like Business Cards will increase the reputation payout for completing missions, and the players can sell Advertising Space on the side of their ship for another source of income.

Players acquire reputation in each of four categories, all of which carry sizeable monetary rewards for certain levels. Merchant reputation comes from selling resources, Freelancer from fulfilling missions, Hacker from installing upgrades on your ship, and Vigilante from destroying pirates with lasers or explosives.

138254.name: Mein Blumenspiel
138254.description:
Objective: be the first collecting 6 flowers - learn the names of different flowers
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game, collecting flowers; ending on a space without flowers name those flowers you've collected already - this rule changed within the Spika edition to: miss one turn

138255.name: Kinderparty
138255.description:
Objective: gain as many winning points as possible
- moving/acting by turns -
each player moves according die roll - ending on a space draw a card with a matching symbol:
try to manage your task successfully (a bit like 'Activity');
if it was accepted by majority of players gain that cart (winning points are shown - depending on difficulty)

typical tasks are:
- mimic a profession
- name two different fishes
- repeat 2x the sentences:"Esel essen Nessel gern, Nessel essen Esel gern." witout any mistake
- count down from 40 to 20; replace multiples of 5 & 7 with a special name...

138256.name: Basics, Spells, & Magic Items
138256.description:
User summary:

A collection of the 3.5 D20 OGL rules for basic mechanics, spells and magic items.

138257.name: Creature Stat Blocks

User summary:

A collection of the 3.5 D20 OGL creature and monster stat blocks.

138260.description:
User summary:

A collection of the 3.5 D20 OGL monster rules and challenges.

138261.description:
User summary:

A collection of the 3.5 D20 OGL psionic character rules, monster rules and challenges.

User summary:

138266.name: Cleric Spells

138270.name: Ranger Spells
