138271.name: Sorcerer & Wizard Spells
138271.description:
User summary:

A collection of the 3.5 D20 OGL sorcerer and wizard spell rules.

138274.name: Complete Marksman Web Enhancement
138274.description:
From Introduction:

Presented below are several new feats for use with the marksman base class.

138275.name: Ruling Three
138275.description:
From publisher blurb:

The From the Deep Adventure Path resumes after the PCs have returned to the city of Arbil for some much-deserved rest. But instead of finding a peaceful city, increasingly frequent and vicious raids by the tribal orcs found along the unclaimed coastlines spoil the plans of the party.

The PCs are tasked with tracking down the reason why the orcs are attacking Arbil in increasing numbers. In their journeys, the PCs will travel along the wild coastlines of Tion, encountering the untamed inhabitants that have yet to be pacified by the Protectorate, and even out across the ocean ruled by the Maquoran Fleet.

But is the true danger from across the ocean or from below it?

Also included in "Ruling Three" is detailed information on the lizardfolk race, several new psionic monsters, and information on the coastlines of the Protectorate.

138276.name: Colorfast
138276.description:
Colorfast is an abstract game where players each represent a primary color. On their turn, players will either place a cube of their color, or convert an existing cube to another color that is one away from the current one on the color spectrum (red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple). The object is to get five cubes in a row made of your primary color and any derivative secondary colors (e.g. red, purple and orange). When (re)placing cubes, players may not choose a space that is adjacent (orthogonally or diagonally) to one of the last two pieces played on.

Rules are changed slightly for the 2 player game, having each player also take a turn with a neutral color (yellow).

138277.name: Imperialism: Victorian Era Wargame Rules
138277.description:
Microbadge:


User Summary

This set of rules was in constant use for the better part of two decades by the Western Washington Wargamers. They are an eminently playable and reasonably realistic set of miniature wargame rules.

The game is a simultaneous movement wargame, utilizing paper maps (or overlays and grease pencils) to plot movement. The game also uses casualty record sheets to record "damage" prior to a stand being eliminated. Six sided dice are used for combat randomization and modified according to a unit's type and morale.

The rules were originally written for use with 20/25mm wargame figures, however the game is easily scaled to 15mm (and even 6mm & 2mm).

Appendices include army lists and values so that custom armies can be created, suggested reading and viewing lists, and sources of miniature figures (several of which are still valid 30 years later).

138278.name: Aborea (2. Auflage)
138278.description:
Publisher blurb (German)
ABOREA - Das Tischrollenspiel ist in einer neuen Auflage verfügbar!

Jetzt ist noch mehr in der Box drin: Neben dem Spieler- und dem Spielleiterheft, der Leet-Karte und der riesigen PALEA-Karte, sowie den zwei Würfeln, ist ein drittes Heft, randvoll mit Spielmaterial, hinzugekommen.

Das Komplett-Set enthält alles, was man zum Spielen braucht.
Steigen Sie jetzt in eine neue Welt ein und erleben Sie unendliche Abenteuer.

Erstellen Sie binnen weniger Minuten Ihren Spielcharakter, erkunden Sie ABOREA und freuen Sie sich auf viele Stunden unvergesslicher Erlebnisse - zusammen mit Ihren Freunden!

user translation
Aborea - the tabletop RPG is available in a new edition!

Now there's even more content in the box: Apart from the player's and GM's guide, the map of Leet and the huge map of Palea, and the two dice, we have added a third booklet chock-ful with scenarios and other play materials.

This set contains everything you need to play. Enter a new world and experience endless adventure.

Create your character within minutes, explore Aborea, and enjoy hours of memorable moments with your friends.

138279.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 5 - Oct 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Magical Lexicon – The Head of Ghazoul
138279.description:
Lapsus Calumni #05 – The Head of Gazoul

Editorial blurb:
He we come across an item of magical qualities of dubious use. This item should allow creative GMs with a
MacGuffin or at the least, an entertaining interlude as their players attempt to discern the meaning of the cryptic messages this head is known for.

User summary:
Some brief fiction and a magic item for Warrior, Rogue & Mage.

138280.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Battle rages through the halls of Subterra Bravo as unearthly creatures and human military fight over control of the underground facility. Amid the turmoil, a few desperate prisoners have managed to escape this hellish place.

You were not so lucky.

Subterra Bravo is now locked down, its exits sealed – and with them, perhaps your fate. Your only hope is to descend back into the bowels of this nightmare facility in search of another way out, but waiting within its unexplored depths are new dangers and even more deadly denizens, ready to put a grisly end to your bid to escape. Can you and your fellow survivors overcome your fears and the horrors that stand in your way, or will you fall prey to the frenzied monsters that hunt you?

LEVEL 7 [ESCAPE]: Lockdown is a death-defying expansion for LEVEL 7 [ESCAPE] that adds new enemies, room tiles, and rules along with five new scenarios that will put your will to survive to the ultimate test.
138280.name: Level 7 [Escape]: Lockdown

138281.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 6 - Oct 2010)
138281.description:
Lapsus Calumni #06 – The Goblyn Grotto

Editorial blurb:
Here we have another product for Warrior, Rogue & Mage. This short encounter could be played as a sidebar mission for the players to encounter during a long trek across the country in between adventures, or it could be the start of a dungeon using the small cave entrance on the southeast side of the canyon.

138282.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 265 - Sep 1997)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #74
Toho Academy Presents Vorsprung Durch Technik
Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #41
138282.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #265
September 1997

Cover art by Avram Grumer.

138283.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 7 - Oct 2010)
138283.description:
Lapsus Calumni #07 – The Spider’s Den

Editorial blurb:
Yet another product for Warrior, Rogue & Mage!

I had a great time making this issue, I selected spiders because webs look cool on maps and nothing is scarier to me than some big hairy spiders. I also went for something that I have seen on Dyson’s blog in his excellent Dyson’s Delve where he foreshadows creatures that he will present in lower levels of his dungeon. This is a great idea that I felt I needed to steal for my own devices. I attempted to work in two hanging threads that I hope to explore in future, deeper, levels of the dungeon.

138284.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 8 - Mar 2011)
138284.description:
Lapsus Calumni #08 - Timble's Treasures

Editorial blurb:
Greetings,
It has been far too long since the last issue of lapsus calumni was pushed out onto the unsuspecting internet. Unfortunately work has kept me very busy lately and I have little time to focus on the zine. In addition, being here in Iraq, I lack some of my normal tools I have at my disposal to help me produce the work as I had done for previous attempts. All previous issues had hand drawn maps that were inked and then scanned, but here I lack that ability. I recently downloaded a new app for my iPad called ArtStudio and realized this is just powerful enough for my silly little endeavors. ArtStudio, along with the Apple-made app called Pages, were used in creating this PDF ﬁle. Thus, I believe this is the ﬁrst, 100% completely made on an iPad zine (at least that I have done anyway). I consider this issue a test in concept, if it proves fruitful, I hope to continue creating the zine using my iPad.

User summary:
This issue features some brief fantasy short fiction and a generic fantasy shop based on the fiction.

138285.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 9 - Mar 2011)
rpgissuearticle: The Green Talon, a small inn & tavern in Aywick
138285.description:
Lapses Calumni #09 – The Green Talon

Editorial blurb:
Another issue of Lapsus Calumni done, this one again created completely on my iPad. I have to say I am really enjoying the ability to create, edit, and layout these issues of the zine o my iPad. It is extremely easy to complete these and I think produce a decent product.

For this issue, we delve back into the world of Sylnae, this time visiting a pub my players had visited in my previous campaign. I have ﬂeshed out Sarge and Maryiam a little from how they were written many years ago. The Green Talon sits in the middle of the small village of Aywick, one of the two places visited by my players numerous times and served a sort of base of operations for them (along with Croftminster). Sadly Snikle never really visited the place, but I am enjoying his experiences and showing his unique point of view on places around the world. I have a few more places in Aywick that I hope to explore and detail in upcoming issues of the zine.

User summary:
This issue features short fiction and a system-agnostic fantasy tavern based on the fiction.

138288.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 10 - Jun 2011)
138288.description:
Lapsus Calumni #10: The King’s Tomb

Designer's comment:
This one was completely inspired by Brent Wolke’s recent work on Risus settings and is an unabashed homage to those games we played as children back in the 80′s. So yeah, this is all his fault. In honor of him, I even stole some of his creature ‘stats’ for this module. Also, this just happens to be eight pages long. Go figure.

The moniker of “micro-dungeon” has recently begun to be floated about the net and it is perfect for this little dungeon. I much prefer these micro-dungeons to the earlier fad of mega-dungeons. They just present a nice little adventure with enough detail to spur a GM on, but leave enough open for him to customize a bit.

138290.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 11 - Sep 2011)
138290.description:
Lapsus Calumni 11: Van Housen Manor

Designer's commentary:
My friend Bryan and I have been working on this issue of Lapsus Calumni for a good while now. It started out as a map that I drew then I had the idea of collaborating with my good friend Bryan on a short adventure. I am really glad I did because he came up with some great ideas. Ones I would never have thought of...the main one being the use of fungus.

The intro:

Van Housen Manor is murder mystery where the PCs are hired by a relative to travel to a keep/manor out in the wilds after her uncle has not been heard from in two months. Lady Vorsheen has been in regular contact with her uncle over the years and knew him fairly well through the letters they exchanged. She is concerned how he has taken to his work as a means of dealing with the loss of his wife.In his last communications with her, his writing was different than before and presented an image of a deranged madman. Her last message to him was sent a month ago and she has not received a reply.

This is a short, 4 or so page adventure involving a bit of mystery and exploration using the Risus system and comes complete with a map. It could easily be used for another system with a few slight modifications. Enjoy!

138291.name: Lapsus Calumni (Issue 12 - Mar 2012)
138291.description:
Lapsus Calumni 12: The Environs of Milagros

Editorial introduction:
This issue marks a departure from previous issues. This issue is written for the fine folks of the Old School Renaissance and encompasses a large area spread over a hex map - that strange mapping template from days of old. I am planning a new campaign and this will be my starting point. From here, I am hoping to continue to add to this region and detail some of the city with its interesting inhabitants and curious locations.

138292.name: Argyle & Crew's Little Book of Big Ideas
138292.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's a collaborative storytelling adventure for kids. It's a great pick up game for adults. It's the sock puppet RPG!

Welcome to Argyle & Crew’s Little Book of Big Ideas! Here you will find eleven scenarios for you and your players to enjoy. Some are geared towards younger children facing new situations such as airports and traveling on a plane. Others are geared towards children who could use a hand facing their fears or learning more about their own emotions. Some are just plain old fun. We hope you’ll enjoy them all!

The Scenarios:

Differences: A Soppet's Guide to Anti-Bullying – a scenario for kids aged 5+
First Airplane Ride – a scenario for players aged 3+
Pet Shop Chaos – a scenario for players aged 3+
The Soppets Save Halloween – a scenario for kids aged 4+
The Soppets Go to a Birthday Party – A scenario for players aged 4+
Body Parts – A scenario for children aged 4+
The Scared Soppet - A scenario for players aged 4+
Darn the Torpedoes! A Guide to Naval Combat with Paper Ships - a scenario for players 9+
Scavenge! A Convention Game - a scenario for players aged 6+
A Guide to Visiting Fictitious Lands in Real Life - a scenario for players aged 4+
Fruits & Vegetables of Gigantic Size – a scenario for children aged 4+

138293.name: Differences: A Soppet's Guide to Anti-Bullying
138293.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bullying. It can be hitting, pushing, teasing, name calling and many other things. In this scenario we'll explore who bullies, who gets bullied and what we can do to stop it.

An Argyle & Crew scenario for children aged 4+.

138295.name: Darn the Torpedoes! A Guide to Naval Combat with Paper Ships
138295.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when you have a magical land powered by pure imagination, populated by living and breathing sock puppets that have a dispute over a large body of water? Magical naval warfare, of course!

This is a quick and easy guide to having full scale, slightly magical naval battles in your own home. Rules which cover movement, combat, glowing blue and what happens should a dog or small child eat or maim your fleet are included.

To play this, all you will need is some paper, a six sided die, a ruler or tape measure, and a Soppet to pilot your ship. Argyle & Crew is not necessary to use these rules, but will be needed if you’d like to include your Soppets.

An Argyle & Crew Scenario for people aged 12+

boardgamecompilation: Es war einmal: Magische Märchen & Ritterliche Romanzen
138296.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In Once Upon a Time, players tell a story together using cards that show fairytale elements and endings. Now add more magic to your game with the Enchanting Tales expansion. Inspired by enchanted princesses like Cinderella and Snow White, the 38 Story Cards and 17 Ending Cards in this set can be shuffled into your Once Upon a Time storytelling card game deck to add new themes and more variety to your game. For an even stronger magical feel, try removing some of the core Story or Ending Cards.
138296.name: Once Upon a Time: Enchanting Tales
boardgameexpansion: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game

138297.name: The Soppets Save Halloween
138297.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween is a big deal in the land of Skcos, but this year, it may not happen!

The nasty Mr. Iago has stolen the last day of the month! October has no Halloween unless the Soppets can find it!

A short scenario for 1 to 25 kids ages 4+

138298.name: The Scared Soppet
138298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever been scared? Being scared can be fun if you're watching a scary movie or telling scary tales. There are also plenty of times that being scared is no fun at all! What do you think is scary? If someone you knew was scared, what could you do to help?

We've all been scared at one time or another. It can be fun if you're on a roller coaster or watching a scary movie. There are other times though when it is no fun at all.

Different people find different things scary. Some people are scared of monsters; others are scared of things that may not be scary to you and I. We'll take a look at what it's like to be scared, and see what we can do help our friends when they're scared.

With a group of kids, it's a great way to see that everyone is afraid of something. With the use of their Soppets, they can talk about and act out these fears behind the safety of a sock puppet, each taking turns helping each other out.

For individual children who may have experienced traumatic incidents in their lives, it's a chance to address these incidents with their parents, caregivers and behavioral health professionals. Role playing through these incidents with the guidance of someone they trust.

138299.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 267 - Nov 1997)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #76
Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #42
138299.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #267
November 1997

Cover art by Keiko Kito.

138300.name: Battle for York
138300.description:
Battle for York is an area control/battle game set in a fictional world inspired by the Napoleonic Wars of the 19th century. The Empire of York has fallen apart after centuries of misrule. Now, many factions have formed, each with a different idea for how the next Empire should be run. The game plays with 2-4 players in an hour or less.

In this low-luck game, players carefully manage their hands of cards for one of two purposes: adding reinforcements or activating powerful tactics which may aid them in battle. There are no dice in Battle for York, so victory in battle is the result of player decision, planning, and sometimes, a careful bluff.

The game features 4 unique factions, each with unique tactics and abilities to gain the upper hand in the conflict. Every faction plays differently, which provides a deep and varied strategy game in a short amount of time. For first time players, a generic shared faction is provided to help you learn the game and the mechanics before diving into the complexities of factions.

Players take one action at a time, so there is little down time in this fast-paced game. Battle for York is a great light to medium game for game night.

138301.name: Jihad Turning Points: Atreus
138301.description:
From the company website:

Despite centuries of unrest, the Free Worlds League (formed in 2271) is the oldest of all the Great Houses. Its capital, Atreus, colonized during humankind’s initial exodus to the stars, is held as the ideal of the democracy prized by the people of the League.

Then came the Jihad.

Jihad Turning Points: Atreus fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of forces fighting for control—and survival—of the Free Worlds League’s capital world.

138302.name: Jihad Turning Points: Hesperus II
138302.description:
From the company website:

One of the most important manufacturing worlds in the Inner Sphere, Hesperus II was a primary objective of the Word of Blake’s Operation STEEL HAMMER. The plan was designed to disrupt the Lyran Alliance’s economic and industrial base. Long before attempting to seize Hesperus II, the Word concocted a lengthy invasion plan to weaken Lyran defenses. The Blakists aimed to succeed where other invaders had failed.

Jihad Turning Points: Hesperus II fleshes out all the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of units fighting for ultimate control of one of the Inner Sphere’s best-known factory worlds.

138303.name: Something Went Wrong (ZOECon Edition)
138303.description:
“Well, that's 264 points of damage. You splatter Hunk all over the common room. The patrons shriek in horror and run out of the inn, occasionally slipping on blood and entrails. You're now alone in a room that looks like a vat of beef stroganoff exploded in it.”

Something Went Wrong is a new, simple and extremely fun competitive fantasy RPG in which things go wrong. Everyone's the GM and no one is, but not all at once.

A group of skilled adventurers go on one last adventure to secure their futures and fortunes. Something they’ve all done, any number of times. And then something goes wrong. Featuring almost 5 classes, literal tons of gold and monster knitting circles, you won't want to miss out on this.

The premise is simple! As experienced adventurers, your characters succeed at just about everything in game. The only exceptions are hitting monsters with weapons and hitting monsters with spells. For those, you'll have to roll.

Players take turns as the GM leading their group of characters through one or more encounters. Every round of each encounter features another player taking the roll of the GM. The goal? Use your experience to cause the other characters to fail spectacularly! The last character left standing wins all the loot and gets to brag about it at the local tavern.

Something Went Wrong is a quick game which can be played with zero preparation. All you'll need are a d6, a d12, some paper and pencils and a good dose of humor.

Character creation takes roughly 5 minutes and a game can be played over the course of an hour or two.

Now with 1000% more NPCs! The ZOECon version of this game is inspired by the folks at Dead Gentlemen Productions and Zombie Orpheus Entertainment - specifically their Gamers, Gamers: Dorkness Rising and JourneyQuest properties. With a new character class, the Bard, new misabilities and new artwork, you'll love this game even more than you love other games of similar types.

138304.name: The Hyper Halfling's Book of Lists, Volume 1
138304.description:
Taken from the first section of the book.

Why and How To Use This Book
This book is designed as a supplemental aid for fantasy roleplaying games. It is primarily an in-game tool to help fill in the storytelling gaps caused by unforeseeable events, but can also be used to build stories before the game starts.

No matter how well the game master prepares, players will always end up asking a question there's no answer for. Instead of saying "Sorry, I didn't plan for that," these Lists make it possible to quickly roll up an answer. For those who prefer to make things up as they go, these Lists offer myriad options to combat blank brain moments.

138305.name: RPG Review (Issue 18 - Dec 2012)
138305.description:
RPG Review
Issue #18
December 2012
The Cthulhu Mythos and Gaming

NOTE: There is a misprint on the cover that lists this issue as being from December 2010.

138308.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 295 - Mar 2000)
rpgissuearticle: At the Sign of the Salient Hurcheon #15
Constructing Futures: A Quick and Dirty Guide for SF Writers
A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
ISO The Real World Volume II/Issue 6
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #104
138308.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #295
March 2000

Cover art by David T. Okamura.

138309.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 284 - Apr 1999)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #93
Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #47
138309.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #284
April 1999

Cover art by Quentin Westcott.

138310.name: Darkening Skies
138310.description:
Tales of the Wide Blue Yonder: Chapter 2

Darkening Skies

over the planet of Haven. An Imperial warship, half-metre long and heavily armed, lies still and unresponsive. Her shadow falls across continents. The Trade Union are spooked. They'll blow the ship to pieces; try to forget it ever existed. But there were people on that ship, soldiers and prisoners, and enough weaponry to equip an army.

So a rag-tag band approaches the ship in a cheap and collapsing boat. One searches for friends, another for adventure. One looks for love and one looks for profit.

One looks for answers.

From the Introduction.

138311.description:
Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination is a storytelling game set in a world in which a machine can predict how a person will die with 100% accuracy with only a small blood sample. However, the machine delights in being vague and twisted. A card reading "Old Age" could mean you die in your sleep at age 120, or it could mean you're run over tomorrow by an elderly driver who forgot to take his pills today. Players of the game take the role of assassins, who must use the various tools at their disposal -- from storytelling to a slew of items available from specialty Black Market shops -- to create a situation in which a target is killed in a way in line with their Death Prediction. The Machine of Death Game uses this basic idea, of assassins working in a world were cause of death is known to create various game modes.

The General Gameplay of most modes works like this:

A target is assigned, and given certain details (including Death Prediction, and extra Intel details, such as things they particularly like or dislike – to help predict their behavior).
Players – assassins – are given Black Market Gift Cards. These are the items they are allowed to use in order to accomplish their goal: killing the target.
Players use the Gift Cards to devise a plan. Each Black Market card provides an item to be used in an Action. Three actions should chain together in some way that results in the death of the target.
The plan is greenlit, either by a Chief player, or via consensus, depending on game mode.
The timer starts and the plan is put into action. This is represented by dice rolling to beat a "difficulty score." An unlikely plan hinging on a single item may need to roll a 6 for that Action, but a rock-solid intricate plan may need to only roll a 2 for each card.
The skull face on the die also adds a frantic element (replacing the 1 face, if the skull is rolled it prompts the flipping of a Fate Coin to add additional randomness).
In case of failure of any die roll, that Action didn't work, and the plan must be revised. While the timer continues running, the assassins draw a new Black Market item, amending their previous plan and rolling for a new Action. They may also call in "Specialists", who are characters with special skills (earned in previous rounds).
If any three Actions are successful before the timer runs out, the target is killed. With the remaining time, the players may roll for Aftermath tasks (such as fleeing the scene or destroying the evidence). Completion of these tasks earns Specialist cards to be used in later rounds. This is the only way to replenish the group's overall Budget of playable cards.
If the timer runs out before three Actions are completed, the target escapes. This is the end of the round.
In the published rules, this also ends the game. This rule was subsequently revised, allowing players to make another attempt on the same target, or take the loss and move on to additional targets. Hard-core players may end the game at this point.
The team wins if they can accomplish four successful kills before their total Budget of Black Market cards are exhausted.




Game Variants:

Chief Mode is where one player takes on the gamemaster role of the Chief, answering questions and deciding on the difficulty of the plan being created by the other players. Groups of 4 or more work best in this mode. In groups of 2-3 players, each player states their opinion, and the hardest value is the one used.
Psychopath is similar to Cards Against Humanity or Apples to Apples. Each player holds a hand of Death Prediction cards that represent hostages. One psychopath announces a murder weapon (based on a drawn Black Market card), and players each toss in the hostage they believe will be most likely to be killed by that weapon. Designed for 4+ players.
Speed Round is faster-paced and useful for introducing players to the death prediction concept. One Chief presents the Death Prediction Card of an assassination target, and players rush to play a Black Market or Specialist card that they think can kill the person in the predicted way. The Chief assigns a difficulty value to the fastest player's proposed plan, and the player rolls to see if they can pull it off. If they do, they earn that Death Prediction Card as a point; if they fail, another player may propose a plan.
Mechanical Chief uses 14 regular playing cards to replace the subjective judgments of the Chief. Each Black Market card is dealt with a playing card, the value of which is kept hidden until the die is about to be rolled. This variant is good for faster play, and directs discussions toward justifying the revealed values within the story, rather than debating the merits of various plans.
Teams is useful for very large groups. The players split into two rival assassination teams, and alternate attacking targets, with a single Chief moderating. Teams operate under spelling bee elimination rules (one team's failure, followed by the victory of the other, results in the first team's elimination). A target that a team fails to kill must then be attempted by the other team, and a continuous narrative persists throughout the entire game.
138311.name: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination
boardgameexpansion: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Death
Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Death by Genre
Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Intel
Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Webcomics Pals/Chums

138312.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 266 - Oct 1997)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #75
138312.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #266
October 1997

Cover art by Lee Brimmicombe-Wood.

138313.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 322 - Jun 2002)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs from the Editor
Papyrus, where no game is out of print! #74
The Road to Stanehouse, Part Six
This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For #131
When in Doubt, Assume Ducks are Messengers of Evil
Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #59
You might very well think so...
rpg: Silver Age Sentinels: The Superhero Role-Playing Game
138313.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #322
June 2002

Cover art by David T. Okamura.

138314.name: A Game of Tales and Thrilling Stories: Adventure 1 – The Museum Case
138314.description:
You are a group of four kids and best friends. It seemed to be a day like every other day when something happened that got you really upset. A boy from your neighborhood stole money from one of your friends. You decide to get the money back. The thief hides in an old villa and you go inside. This is where the adventure begins that will turn to The Museum Case.

A Game of Tales and Thrilling Stories is a rules system for story-driven board games that does not require one player to take the role of a game master or narrator of the story. The system is similar to paragraph driven games, but follows a pre-defined story and therefore provides a more integrated story experience. The story elements are not written in a paragraph book but communicated through cards.

138315.name: War2: Glory
138315.description:
User Summary

War 2 Glory is an online strategy game played within a browser. Players build up a modern city, beginning as a lowly commander, and working up in rank through attaining victories against enemy cities. Players may ally with each other to ensure an advantage.

138316.name: Mage Knight: Resurrection
138316.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Mage Knight: Resurrection is a fantasy miniatures line utilizing the Combat Dial System game platform that the original Mage Knight game pioneered. Each of the 25 miniatures in the line will incorporate SwitchClix technology, and include two dials: one designed for the Mage Knight 2.0 rules, and a second HeroClix P.A.C. -compatible dial.

Mage Knight: Resurrection will be sold in both full starter sets and collectible booster packs.

138317.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It is the height of the Steam Age and the whistle of the Iron Horse harkens the boom of small towns across the country into major hubs of transportation and economic growth.

In Trains and Stations, a new take on train games, players must make deliveries, develop buildings, and profit from their decisions while working with and against other players. Will you focus on establishing mining operations in an attempt to gain a monopoly on coal, silver, and gold? Or perhaps you will focus on laying tracks across the landscape and helping other players move their goods—taking your cut, of course. Every game will evolve differently with unique twists and turns as you control the movement of goods across the game map!


Microbadges

Trains and Stations fan
138317.name: Trains and Stations
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 41 HOST A Trains and Stations Contest Party
Podcast #18: The Turbocast
The Game Pit Episode 14.3 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2013
The Game Pit: Episode 23 - Reckoning the Spoils

138318.name: Party Of Sin
138318.description:
Ever had that itching desire to break out of hell and into the highest reaches of heaven? In Party of Sin, you take control of the Seven Deadly Sins in a coopetitive puzzle-platformer for 1-4 players on PC.

Master the Sins

Master a large, dynamic team of anti-heroes -- the Seven Deadly Sins -- as you forge your destiny on a quest to troll humanity. Envy, Greed, Sloth, Pride, Wrath, Lust, Gluttony are all multi-dimensional with special powers useful in many situations.

Swap Sins At Any Time

Swap characters on the fly as you change tactics based on the situation: ALL the Sins are useful in combat, ALL the Sins aid in puzzle solving, and ALL the Sins have coop interactions, both Good and Evil.

Solo

Being alone requires more thought and planning as you make your escape from hell. Challenging puzzles and battles that will force you to combine powers in creative ways await you.

Coop

You are not alone! Play with up to 3 of your friends and combine the sin powers in new and sinister ways. You will discover that all your powers that work on enemies also work on other sins. Use them to help the team or punish bad behaviour.

Inspired by Known Classics

Super Smash Bros, Zelda, Super Mario. Party of Sin takes the best games of your youth and melts them down into a sinful super-game. Powers are adapted from classic mechanics like grappling hooks and time-shifting.

Religious Theme

Explore four biblical worlds as you make your way from the depths of Hell to the vaults of Heaven, one angel at a time. Fight enemies based in Christian mythology like demons, angels, cherubs and templars. Take the final fight to Saint-Michael himself!

Join the Party

Join a party of epic proportions that tests your ability to think from the other side of morality...

Which Sin are you?

Source: The Game Website.

138319.description:
This is the second game in the TPS line of the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

It covers the 1522 attempt by the Ottoman empire to take the city from the Knights Hospitaler. It is printed on a single postcard-sized piece of cardstock with game map on front and rules on the back. Counters need to be cut from around the edge of the card. Die-cut counters are available from ATO with any purchase at no additional charge.

The Ottoman side attempts to reduce the Hospitaler resistance by bombardment, mining and assault, while the Hospitaler side tries to reduce the Ottoman artillary and resistance by bombardment, counter-mining and sallies. These actions are taken by units activated by random card draws and results are resolved with a D6 roll.
138319.name: Nothing So Well Lost: The Siege of Rhodes 1522

138320.name: Edna & Harvey: Harvey's New Eyes
138320.description:
In Edna & Harvey: Harvey’s New Eyes, players return to the world of adventure game hit Edna & Harvey: The Breakout. Be prepared to meet many old friends and discover many new hand-made cartoon locations, realized in full HD glory!

Lilli, a young girl at a convent school, is the main character of Edna & Harvey: Harvey’s New Eyes. Seemingly the best-behaved little girl in the world, she executes all her chores in a diligent manner, no matter how unfair they may be. Her innocent, imperturbable way of carrying out the orders of others has something both tragic and eerie about it. Any angry thoughts, any childlike disobedience is buried deep beneath a seemingly impenetrable surface of sweetness. But how long will these feelings stay hidden? And where do the friendly little gnomes come from that paint over everything unpleasant in Lilli’s vicinity with a pleasant pink color? Are they real or just a product of her subconscious?

Source: The Developer Website.

138321.name: Oozi: Earth Adventure
138321.description:
Oozi: Earth Adventure is where classic platforming fun meets modern visuals and hand-drawn art. Lots of special abilities, dozens of enemies, extra difficult challenge mode and time limited arcade mode specially for hardcore gamers. A must have for all platformer fans!

Source: The Developer Website.

138324.name: Decker
138324.description:
Welcome to the 22nd century. In the game of Decker, you are a hacker who specializes in breaking into corporate computer systems, for which you are handsomely paid. Of course, these corporations don't idly sit by and allow you free run of their systems. The systems are guarded by Intrusion Countermeasure programs (ICE), which attempt to kick you out of the system, or possibly even kill you.

The basic equipment of a Decker is the cyberdeck. This wonderful piece of hardware plugs directly into your brain in order to allow you experience the full virtual reality world of the matrix. While in the matrix, you use programs to attempt to bypass the security measures of the corporate systems, or to crash them if all else fails.

You start out unskilled, unknown, and underequipped, but as you gain experience, you will increase your skills, hardware, and reputation in order to combat more difficult and dangerous systems. That is, if you don't get your brain fried in the process.

Source: The Game Website.

138325.description:
The battle of Bannockburn in 1314 defended the Scottish nation and was a major milestone on the path to the independence. The Scottish highlanders slaughtered the mighty English army that included more than 2000 knights and 15000 infantrymen.

The game allows to play the battle of Bannockburn as well as two predecessors: battle of Stirling (1297) and battle of Falkirk (1298). Players are given the command over English heavy cavalry or Scottish shiltrons and their goal is to eliminate units and leaders of the opponent and/or secure strategic targets of the army.

This is a typical hex and counter game. Initiative is determined in each scenario and kept for the entire game. Players perform their actions in order, with possible reactions (when enemy units enter missile range).

Example:
1. Player A moves cavalry (reaction fire possible)
2. Cavalry of player A attacks
3. Player A moves infantry (reaction fire possible)
4. Infantry of player A attacks
5. Player B moves cavalry etc.

Movement is determined by the terrain and the unit type. The battles are determined by comparing unit strength, which is modified by various factors (armor, charge, terrain, leaders etc.), and dice roll. Some interesting elements of game mechanics include fatigue of units, morale and cavalry movement (turning requires more space).

The game includes: three paper maps (2 made of two parts that should be duct-taped together or glued, on a single part), chits with units (punchable) and additional chits (for marking "charge", "fatigue" modifiers) that need to be cut out.

This game uses the "Medieval" system of "Taktyka i Strategia", implemented also in Grunwald 1410 (second edition) - revised and updated. Therefore it can be used with other games from the series.
An english translation of the rules with scenario and examples is provided within the game.


A number of scenarios for this game was published in Taktyka i Strategia magazine:
- Pięść Szkocji (No. 39)
- Falkirk Stream (No. 38)
- Falkirk Otimus (No. 37)
- Szarża Gloucastera (No. 20)
- Walna Bitwa (No. 20)
- Strumień Bannock (No. 19)
- Niebieska Linia (No 19)
- Stirling Maximus (No. 16)
- Królewskie Polowanie (No. 16)
- Waleczne Serca (No. 15)
138325.name: Bannockburn 1314

138327.name: 400 Years
138327.description:
A great calamity is approaching, and you're the only one who can stop it. Unfortunately, you're a sentient stone idol who can do little more than use your patience and timelessness to let the world and time pass around you, watching the landscape change with time and the seasons (or your own actions) until a solution presents itself. Scriptwelder delivers a slow but beautiful bit of interactive art married with clever puzzling for a zen-like experience.

Source: The Publisher Website.

138328.name: Supplices
138328.description:
A card party game.

Gather friends around the table, select the level of "hotness" of the actions to be done (from simple questions on lower levels, 1 to 3, to actions on higher levels 5 to 7. Level 4 is a balanced level).

Once you've chosen 3 levels to play with, the first player draws a card from the pool and select one of the two action written on it. Ask a player to execute it;

If he doesn't what he'll have to draw a Supplices card and will have to execute the action written down on it. You'll keep the card and get the points associated with it.

If he does the action, he will take the card and it's associated point.

The game continues like this until the deck of action card is completly depleted. The winner is the one with the most points.

Higher level cards score more points.

138329.description:
Brass: Catalonia is based on applying the mechanics of Brass to the Industrial Revolution in Catalonia. The rules changes reflect the geographical constraints in Catalonia and the different process of industrialization.

To play, you will need the following from the files section:
- the jpg map of Catalonia.
- the new deck of cards (you can also get them at Artscow).
- the one-page rules booklet (in fact, three pages, but they are each in one language: Catalan, Spanish and English).

RULES CHANGES FROM BRASS

1. The Canal Period is now the Road Period.

2. In the Road Period, a player may have as many Level 1 industry tiles as they wish in a given location, if and only if they are all Level 1 industries; mixing of Level 1 and higher industry level tiles from the same player at the same location is not allowed.

3. The building of a cotton mill in a location with hydraulic power (marked with the turbine symbol) gives a price reduction of 2 PTA in buying coal.

4. You can sell cotton overland to the Peninsula as long as the cotton mill is not connected to any face-up port. In that case in the act of selling you just flip the mill counter to its other side.

5. Selling cotton to a Distant Market is also possible, but only through Barcelona, that needs an already built port.

(Source: rules booklet)
138329.name: Catalonia (fan expansion for Brass)

138330.name: Porto Velvenya
138330.description:
(from the back of the book)
The mysterious Uthuria, land of 12,000 gods, where gold is as common as stones ... but not all of the myths about the southern continent are true, as the heroes have noticed since their arrival. Yet there are countless treasures to recover, dangers to brave and mysteries to solve.

And these are closer than they think, as a cruel plague has come down on Porto Velvenya. In the settlement of Al'Anfa wounds close no longer. Even the slightest injury can become a danger to life. It is the heroes who must uncover the dark secrets behind this threat, save Porto Velvenya and deal with the bloodthirsty people of Xor'atal. Difficult tasks that lead your heroes straight to the Green Hell.

Porto Velvenya is the first of three volumes of the Green Hell Uthuria regional campaign. Besides an extensive adventure, this volume contains a wealth of information on weapons, armor, creatures and people (including game stats) in this region and allows the dungeon master to use the area around Porto Velvenya for his own adventures.

138331.name: Sailor Boy
138331.description:
This is a simple spin the spinner and move game where you begin your adventure at sea as the lowly CABIN BOY and by successfully moving around the board eventually get promoted to Captain and win the game.

Complete game: 10 game pieces, spinner, & box. The bottom of the box is the game board

138332.description:
This is an 11 card expansion for Briefcase.

It includes 8 City Hall office cards and 3 Inspector cards.

Offices: For each game players randomly choose 4 of those offices to use in the game. At the start of each turn, each player may activate one office and take advantage of its one-time ability.

Inspectors: All Inspector cards are shuffled in the Buy deck. If, while producing a new B card, a player reveals an Inspector card, he/she must also place the Inspector card in to his/her discard pile.
When a player draws an Inspector card, he/she may play a Buy card to pass the Inspector card to the player on their left. When the game ends, players lose one victory point for each Inspector card remaining in their deck.
138332.name: Briefcase: City Hall

138334.name: Beacon of Hope
138334.description:
Author's introduction

Navaho myth says that this world we live in is the Third World, and that when it, like the two before, passes away, the Chosen people will travel to the fourth world through a mystical gate in the sky. It is December of 2012, and the Mayan calendar will shortly click over to zero. The ending of the Third World is at hand. Dreams and portents have depicted a lantern shining the way to salvation, and so a great lighthouse has been built in the Painted Desert. The Tribal Elders and Medicine Singers know that it is both a call to the chosen to gather, and a prayer to the Great Spirit to open the door. Many have gathered here at the base of the Lighthouse, this shining Beacon of Hope.

However, it is Trickster Coyote’s job to be sure that the chosen are truly worthy of the fourth world, and Coyote is not convinced. He has sabotaged the beacon. Grandmother Spider has chosen you and a handful of others out of the gathered crowd to travel on a mystical journey through time and space to unravel the damage that has been done. She warns, however that Coyote will also travel with the group, seeking to observe, to hinder, and perhaps, if convinced of your worthiness, to help. Coyote is a Trickster, she reminds you, able to appear to be anyone, or anything. She wishes you good luck, and sends you on your way.

Beacon of Hope is a roleplay game for 3 to 6 players and one Gamesmaster or GM, designed to be played in a single evening.

138335.name: Therapy
138335.description:
user summary

Therapy is a rules-light game/prank designed specifically for text-based role-playing (IRC, PbF or similar). A doctor treats a patient, while the GM provides adversity as needed.

138336.name: Sweating Seven
138336.description:
Overview (from the rulebook)

Sweating Seven is a role-playing game following the story of one or more characters who have been infected with sweating sickness. Those characters have 240 hours left to live and their
only hope is a doctor in a foreign kingdom who's been sequestered behind seven walls. The story follows them and those helping them as they race against the clock.

User summary
Using a guessing game similar to Battleship, players have to overcome obstacles - seven walls prepared by the GM.

138337.name: Rule of Three: Anything Goes Edition
138337.description:
designer summary

This is the bare bones rules of Rule of Three.

138338.description:
A multi-hour no-randomness economic game somewhat in the mold of Baltimore & Ohio set in the continental USA west of the Appalachians. Players found companies, determine share distributions and capitalisations, invest in companies they and others have founded, expand the companies across the country, and compete for the most victory points (not net worth) at the end of the game.

Released as part of the Winsome Games' Essen Collection - 2013.
138338.name: Continental Divide
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good The Board and The Man Who Loves Most of It: Episode 94 “Jonathan’s Top 10 of 2016″
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 59!!! A Contest Inside!

138339.name: The Hall of the Family
138339.description:
Designer's blurb:
Back late last year we released a free adventure and I made a promise that if it were downloaded a slew of times, I would work another one to release for free. Unfortunately the holidays and work have totally kicked my butt the last two months so I am just now getting around to releasing this one. I called on two of my pals to help me out and complete this one: +Josh Mannon and +Brennen Reece. Josh wrote a really unique and cool adventure and Brennen added in some really awesome artwork.

This is a short, system-less adventure written up in the old school fashion of kicking the character's ass and taking no names. We hope you enjoy this adventure, and if you do, be sure to check out our other awesome products.

138340.name: Ironclads: High Seas
138340.description:
Ironclads High Seas asks the question...what if the U.S. Civil War had been fought as a naval battle? For over a year the forces of the United States of America (northern states) and the Confederate States of America (southern states) have fought a bitter war. It starts when, in 1862, the governments of Great Britain, France, and Spain recognize the Confederate States of America in order to secure the raw materials abundant in the south. As the southern government becomes dependent upon trade with Europe, the north imposes a complete blockade to stop import and export. When the south responds by buying warships from European allies, it sets the stage for a naval conflict for control of American trade routes! Choose a side, build a fleet, and destroy the enemy in this interesting historical simulation!


Manage financial and strategic aspects while planning your squadron's structure

Scramble your fleet to gain sea supremacy

Set up battle squadron groups, their formations and management

Realistic ship models and characteristics

Advanced ballistics and weapon models

Source: The Publisher Website.

138341.name: Ironclads: Chincha Islands War 1866
138341.description:
Spain tried to restore by force its influence on its former colonies, Chile and Peru. This strong Spanish squadron occupied the Chincha Islands, very important to the economy of Peru. Peru received support from neighbouring Chile, Ecuador and Bolivia. After several battles, the heavily damaged Spanish squadron was forced to withdraw to the Philippines for repairs. In 1866, Peru strengthened its fleet and sent ships to the Philippines in order to inflict retaliation on Spain. The Spaniards decided to weaken the allies by sending a new fleet to South America. The opposing forces gathered strength for the decisive battle for the Chincha Islands.


A steam-ship period naval combat simulation games focusing on fleet-scale battles in real time.

Manage financial and strategic aspects while planning your squadron's structure. Scramble your fleet to gain sea supremacy. The naval combat game allows you to set up battles squadron groups, their formations and management, with realistic ship models and characteristics, as well as advanced ballistisc and weapon models.

Choose your ships, increase the experience of your crews and send your squadron into the high seas. Order a battle formation, and experience power of iron and a steam!

Source: The Publisher Website.

138342.name: Ironclads: Schleswig War 1864
138342.description:
The Danish government wanted to annex the duchy of Schleswig to the Danish kingdom while the Prussian government, for internal political and strategic reasons, wanted Schleswig to finally became a part of Germany.

A key element of Denmark's war strategy was the blockade of Germany's Baltic sea ports, thereby disrupting German overseas trade and hindering Prussian naval operations in support the Prussian army. The supreme commander of the Prussian army insisted that the navy attempt to breach the blockade.


A steam-ship period naval combat simulation games focusing on fleet-scale battles in real time.

Manage financial and strategic aspects while planning your squadron's structure.

Scramble your fleet to gain sea supremacy. The naval combat game allows you to set up battles squadron groups, their formations and management, with realistic ship models and characteristics, as well as advanced ballistic and weapon models.

Choose your ships, increase the experience of your crews and send your squadron into the high seas.

Order a battle formation, and experience the power of iron and steam!

Source: The Publisher Website.

138343.name: Ironclads: Anglo Russian War 1865
138343.description:
Russia sought to seize control of Constantinople. The city controls the Black Sea straits, an important economic and strategic point of the Black and Mediterranean Seas. This area was the cause of constant conflict with Britain, which was concerned about her Mediterranean interests. The Crimean War had weakened the position of Russia on the Black Sea, but, in the Baltic and North Sea, the Tsar built a new, modern fleet. In 1865, Poland rebelled against Russia. Britain supported the rebels and declared war on Russia. Two objectives of the Royal Navy are to destroy the Russian squadron in the North Sea and the establishment of a full blockade of the North.


A steam-ship period naval combat simulation games focusing on fleet-scale battles in real time.

Manage financial and strategic aspects while planning your squadron's structure.

Scramble your fleet to gain sea supremacy. The naval combat game allows you to set up battles squadron groups, their formations and management, with realistic ship models and characteristics, as well as advanced ballistic and weapon models.

Choose your ships, increase the experience of your crews and send your squadron into the high seas.

Order a battle formation, and experience the power of iron and steam!

Source: The Publisher Website.

138344.name: PT Boats: South Gambit
138344.description:
The original game "PT Boats: Knights of the Sea" has opened a new previously unknown aspect of naval battles in WWII. Now with the large-scale add-on "South Gambit" you will find yourself commanding a lethal torpedo boat in the very heart of two new theaters of war. The long listing of authentic warships, boats, weapons and aircrafts is now amplified with the legendary Soviet attack plane IL-2, German torpedo bomber He-111H-6, Italian cruiser Condottieri and many more.

You will join battle in the Mediterranean and transport British troops and supplies to Libya and Tunis, escort convoys to besieged Malta as it was in operations "Harpoon", "Vigorous" and "Pedestal". Then you will be relocated to the Black Sea region where some of the most dramatic historic battles were raging. Nazi "Kriegsmarine" will do it's best to disrupt sea communications between Sevastopol and Novorossiysk. So, you and your PT boat will play their role in night raids to the enemy bases and then in artillery attacks on Nazis in Yalta and Anapa.

Source: The Publisher Website.

138345.name: Earthsiege 2
138345.description:
Earthsiege 2 is a mecha-style vehicle simulation game developed by Dynamix, produced by Frank Evers (NYPH), and released in 1995. Earthsiege 2 is set the Earthsiege universe, which contains its predecessors Earthsiege (1994) and Battledrome (1995), as well as action game Hunter Hunted (1996), strategy games MissionForce: CyberStorm (1997) and Cyberstorm 2: Corporate Wars (1998), simulation Starsiege (1999), and first-person shooters Starsiege: Tribes (1999), Tribes 2 (2001), Tribes: Vengeance (2004) and Tribes: Ascend (2012).

As a simulation, Earthsiege 2 gives players the opportunity to pilot massive bipedal war machines known as HERCULANs (Humaniform-Emulation Roboticized Combat Unit with Leg-Articulated Navigation) (or 'HERCs' for short). Set in the 26th or 27th century, Earthsiege 2 features advanced weapons and technology for waging war. Earthsiege 2 takes place across North America, South America, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, and the moon.

Earthsiege 2 features a more advanced engine than Earthsiege, increasing the game's maximum resolution to 640*480. Additionally, the game features much more detailed terrain than its predecessor. Earthsiege 2 has 3D rolling terrain rather than the flat landscape of Earthsiege. Furthermore, video briefings and debriefings, along with included squadmate voices, add to the atmosphere of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Earthsiege 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138346.name: Moleskin Maps Volume One
138346.description:
Designer's blurb:
This first volume of Moleskin Maps contains ten of my Moleskin Maps, rescanned and cleaned up. The maps are in PDF format, with a page devoted to the entire map and a GM Prep Page to assist in setting up the encounter or dungeon. The GM Prep Page is an excellent tool to help GMs prepare their game sessions.

The product's zip file also contains a larger format image of each of the maps so you can drop them into Fantasy Grounds, MapTool, TableTop Forge, or Roll20 to facilitate easy online game play.

138347.name: Sub Command: Akula Seawolf 688(I)
138347.description:
Back of the box

Take charge of the most deadly modern-day submarines in the world! Test your skills while firing Tomahawk missiles, rescuing crippled subs, rising through polar ice caps to communicate information and much more. Whether transiting, diving, or surfacing you control the smartest, stealthiest and most feared subs on the water today!

Key Features


Three submarines to command - Seawolf, 688(I) & Akula
Authentic naval systems including sonar, radar & target motion analysis
Locate, track & destroy the enemy using cutting-edge sensor & weapon technology - even deliver Tomahawk missiles to inland targets
Two unique & challenging campaigns
Easy to use game interface with straightforward controls & automated crewmen
Enhanced sound & 3D graphics engine with over 250 3D objects

138348.description: Plastic components for the original Alien Frontiers game. Consists of eight colony tokens in the 5 player colors-each topped with a clear plastic dome, and three field generator miniatures. Also included are dock cover chits for 2 and 3 player games.
138348.name: Alien Frontiers: Upgrade Pack

138349.description: Contains 100 original edition undead for use with the Zombies!!! game or forming your very own army of the damned.
138349.name: Zombies!!!: bag o' Zombies!!!

138350.description: Special edition of the Bag O' Zombies!!! accessory for the game Zombies!!! Contains 50 clown figures.
138350.name: Zombies!!!: bag o' Clowns!!!

138351.description: 144 wooden trains that replace the discs in Steam with wooden train figures in 6 player colors, also one start player marker.
138351.name: Steam: Locomotive Set

138352.name: Qube: Svenska språket
138352.description: 500 questions about the Swedish language in 5 different categories, such as dialect & slang and funny synonym. Besides the cards with questions and answers the game also includes category cards to determine from which category questions are asked. All cards fit in the little cube shaped box.

138358.description:
Original French
Présentation des pièces et de leur bourse

Ces pièces ont été réalisés à partir de modèles réels datant de l'époque de Philippe le Bel (1285-1314).

Pour des raisons légales et esthétiques, la face et le dos ne correspondent pas : Le côté pile provient d'un gros tournois à L'O rond et le côté face d'un petit royal assis (reproduction des monnaies de Paris). A noter que le petit royal assis est la première pièce d'or introduite en France sur une base régulière (1290) et cote plus de 20000€ !

Les seuls changements entre ces reproductions et les originaux concernent la forme (sur les originaux les bords sont souvent rognés et l'arrondi bien moins net) et l'épaisseur (les pièces de cette époque étaient très fines, leurs reproductions sont plus épaisses).

Google Translation, User edited
Presentation of the parts and their scholarship:

These pieces were made ​​from real models from the time of Philip the Fair (1285-1314).

For legal reasons and for aesthetics, the front and back do not match: there is a replica royal setting on one side and an altered backside (reproduction coins of Paris). Note that the original small royal setting was the first gold coin introduced in France on a regular basis (1290) and is worth over €20,000!

The only changes between these reproductions and originals are the form: the originals often had trimmed edges that were rounded and differed in thickness (some coins from this period were very fine so the reproductions are thicker).
138358.name: Caylus: Metal Coins

138359.description:
Original French
Cette figurine en résine a été sculptée par la Team Toulouse Création et moulée par Historex. Elle a été produite à un peu plus de 1000 exemplaires et le master sera détruit après la production.

Le modèle peint a été également réalisé par la Team Toulouse. Evidemment, la figurine livrée avec le jeu ne sera pas peinte.

La figurine mesure 5cm avec son socle.

Google Translation, User Edited
Introducing the exclusive figurine of the King:

This resin figure was sculpted by the Toulouse Team Creation and molded by Historex. Only a little over 1000 were produced and the master was destroyed after production.

The model comes unpainted and measures 5cm from its base.
138359.name: Caylus King Figure

138360.name: Gygax Magazine (Issue 1 - Feb 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Gnatdamp: A sanctuary in the swamp
Playing it the science fiction way
Still playing after all these years
138360.description:
user summary
this is the first issue of Gygax Magazine

Gygax Magazine is the Quarterly Adventure Gaming Magazine which started publishing in the first quarter of 2013.
The magazine was founded by several veterans of the RPG industry along with Gary Gygax's two sons.

138361.name: Space Cadets: Bridge Station Insignia Buttons
138361.description: These are buttons to wear while playing Space Cadets, so that the crew members can tell each other's positions during the quick actions of the game. Uses the same symbols as the position icons used in the game.

138362.name: CON2! The Wraith of CON!
138362.description: A fast bidding card game that expands upon the CON! Card Game. Similar in rules, this one represents a convention going badly for all involved. Slightly darker humor with the guests, game now includes guests that factor in traits about the players themselves.

138363.description:
BGG Store Description

100 Casino size poker chips with BGG stickers. Set comes with clear acrylic tray.

Chip Distribution (Value):
20 White (1)
10 Red (5)
10 Blue (10)
20 Green (25)
20 Black (100)
10 Purple (500); 10 Yellow (1000)

Per the distributor website (discountcasinogear.com):
These 9 gram Las Vegas Style Chips are 39 mm diameter casino sized chips and are designed with the authentic casino style and unique edge spot design. The NexGen™ Pro Series Chip incorporates a unique process giving them the soft feel of a clay surface which makes them the most authentic poker chip available on the home gaming market. Additionally,this same process allows for multi-colored edge spots, resembling that of casino clay poker chips. They are full of vibrant colors that will look amazing on any gaming table.
138363.name: BGG Poker Chips: Set of 100

138364.description:
BGG Store Description
You've always wanted your meeples to have personality, and now they can. Now your meeples can look like the characters they represent (farmers, knights, scorcerers, princesses, monks, workers, peasants). This sheet of stickers includes 65 front/back pairs of stickers designed to fit all sizes (regular, large) and shapes (pig) of meeples in the Carcassonne game family.
138364.name: Carcassonne: Meeple Stickers

138365.description:
This is an update kit which includes the following internal printed components in the 3rd Printing (2012) of Dominant Species:

• Game Board
• Card Deck
• Tile/Counter Sheets
• Rulebook
• Player Aids
138365.name: Dominant Species: Upgrade Kit (Third Printing)

138366.description:
BGG Store Description
Stickers for use on the Dungeon Lords minion pieces.
138366.name: Dungeon Lords Stickers

138367.description:
BGG Store Description
6 miniature fireman in each player color.
138367.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Firemen Figures

138368.description:
BGG Store Description
The robot figures from Get Bit.
138368.name: Get Bit! Robot Figure

138369.name: RaiderZ
138369.description:
RaiderZ is a Free-to-Play Massively Multiplayer Online RPG (or MMORPG for short) in which players engage in battle against colossal and powerful beasts in order to save the world of Rendel from destruction.

Experience action-based gameplay, join a hunting party, and team with up to 15 other adventurers to beat back the monstrous forces of destruction. In RaiderZ, you must hunt together, or die alone.

Source: The Game Website.

138370.description:
Pumpkin Power... Halloween Freighter Ticket to Ride Train & Station Set

Frightful pumpkin trains and spooky stations are scheduled to arrive just in time for Halloween with an add-on for the Ticket to Ride Series – the Halloween Freighter.

This set of custom-sculpted trains and stations includes 45 new orange-colored Pumpkin Trains and 3 spooky Halloween Stations. It's a Halloween treat for Ticket to Ride fans worldwide that can be used as a replacement train set for any of Ticket to Ride game or map collection.
boardgameaccessory: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 – Team Asia & Legendary Asia
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 – India & Switzerland
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 3 – The Heart of Africa
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 4 – Nederland
138370.name: Ticket to Ride: Halloween Freighter

138373.description: A wild-west themed board for Agricola.
138373.name: Agricola: Wild West Board

138374.description: A 5-pack of designer boards that contains one each of Spring, Autumn, Winter, Wild West and Mars accessory boards for Agricola.
138374.name: Agricola: The 5 Designer Boards

138375.description: A 20 x 14,5 cm² cloth bag to store tokens for Agricola. The bag was originally released at Spiel 2009 together with the Agricola: Resourceeples Wooden Farm Resources (but sold separately). Since then, the bag has been available sporadically and often in combination with other accessories like the Agricola: Pink player pieces.
138375.name: Agricola: Stoffbeutel

138378.name: Small But Vicious Dog
138378.description:
User summary:
Small But Vicious Dog is a mashup of Moldvay/Cook B/X D&D and WFRP 1e. The rules are available from the designer's blog and consist of separate cover and body documents. The cover includes a cover page (blank), title page and table of contents, the body document contains the rules alone.

From the Introduction:
Welcome to a fantasy world where the men are Baldrick, the dwarves are punk, and the dogs are small but vicious. Welcome to a world of bawds, grave robbers, excisemen and witch hunters; a place where “Blather”, “Flee!” and “Mime” are legitimate skill choices; and where all material on the insidious threat of Chaos is officially interchangeable between settings.

Welcome (back) to the Grim World of Perilous Adventure.

Whisper it (that fanboys may not hear and descend a squealing), but for all the charm of its skewed familiar 16th century milieu and the lurking horror of Chaos, Warhammer Fantasy Role Play was little more than a modcop of classic Dungeons & Dragons. Yes, our beloved WFRP was yet another ‘fix D&D’ fantasy heartbreaker, albeit one which had the clout of the biggest name in British gaming behind it. Whole chunks of the system were lightly disguised D&D mechanics adapted to a roll under d% system1, and many setting
elements not gleefully ripped off from Tolkien, Leiber or Moorcock were already established D&D tropes by the time WFRP was published.

But that's ok. Indeed, that's part of why all right thinking people – Brits, Italians and Poles especially – love WFRP. To paraphrase a better man than I: we took an American invention, soaked it in a witches' brew of Bosch, Durer and Doré, Mervyn Peake and Tom Sharpe, Blackadder, The Young Ones, pints of bitter, cheap weed, Iron Maiden and The Damned, and then we played the hell out of it.

And that’s what this ill considered rules hack is about. Your humble author – a dirty little yahoo from a rainy, grimy, post imperial isle in the northern seas – decided to have a go at welding D&D and WFRP together. Why? So I could play games of WFRP ish misery and despair with rules of B/X ish brevity, thus achieving personal gaming nirvana. This here resulting travesty is a 90% pure game mechanics kitbash with minimal background material or context. I won’t even pretend I can précis 20 odd years of background material into 32 pages or so. If you want all that good stuff you should hunt out a copy of WFRP itself; it is worth your time.

I hope you enjoy my little love letter to *real* WFRP (the one that came complete in a single fat book). But “If you know a better hole, then go to it.”

138379.description: Miniature figurine for the game Okko: Era of the Asagiri

138408.description:
Google Translation, User Edited
THE storage for the full set of Dominion!
This is the case for Dominion; the Collector Case!

This case is made ​​of highly stable, high quality corrugated board.

The printed case has 5 compartments with drawers for all the Dominion cards. It fits the base cards and a small expansion (such as Alchemy, Prosperity, et al.) in the top drawer. Below are 3 drawers for larger expansions (26 slots. Be aware: Dark Ages has more cards than other expansions!). Finally, there is a drawer for playing boards and for promos and the blue edged randomizers. The spacing in the case is so well designed that even cards with protective covers fit.

The case comes assembled with a sturdy handle. The drawers conveniently organize about 2,500 cards.

Hans im Gluck Description (Original German)
DIE Aufbewahrung für wahre Dominion-Könner
Dies ist der Koffer für Dominion. Oder auch der Collectors Case!

Was bieten die Koffer?

Beide Koffer sind aus sehr stabiler, hochwertiger Wellpappe hergestellt.

Dieser bedruckte Koffer hat 5 Fächer. In diesem Fall ist er mit Dominion-Schubladen ausgestattet. Dabei passen die Basiskarten und eine kleine Erweiterung (Alchemisten, Reiche Ernte) in die obere Schublade. Es folgen 3 Schubladen für Editionen oder große Erweiterungen (26 Steckplätze. Vorsicht, die Erweiterung "Dark Ages" hat mehr Karten als die bisherigen Erweiterungen!). Schließlich gibt es eine Schublade für Tableaus, die Karten mit blauem Rand und Promokarten. Die Fächer für die Karten sind so groß, dass auch Karten mit Schutzhüllen hineinpassen.
Der Koffer wird zusammengebaut mit einem stabilen Griff geliefert.

Zusätzlich gibt es Schubladen, die zusammen ca. 2.500 Karten fassen.
138408.name: Dominion Storage Box
